Reviews.Title: “Charming, so friendly, the way forward”
Reviews.Author: OxfordQueenie
Reviews.Content: I am a friendly type of person. The kind that likes to say hello to my neighbours and greet other hotel guests in the corridor. That is why the round table seating at Hotel Lancelot appealed to me so much. My husband and I visited in September 2008 (I had to click Sept 2011 due to TA choices) as part of our Italian honeymoon tour. You might think it ood that newlyweds would be drawn to this shared table experience but why wouldn't we; we still love talking to and meeting new people no matter what. And we met some fantastic people night after night and laughed and drank the inclusive wine; such fun. I wasn't over the moon with the first room* so feeling a little deflated on honeymoon, my husband enquired about being moved. This was done quickly and without question. The second room was far more fitting and decorated in a Wedgewood shade of blue. The staff are attentive; the food is beautiful and well worth the half board option (or opt in each night as we did). The location isn't in the centre of everything but is very close to the Colosseum, easy for access to buses and I've no problem walking in a city this wonderful. *Looking back, there wasn't a problem with the first room, I think I was just a little spoilt from the huge suite we had just shared in Positano.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and helpful staff and great location”
Reviews.Author: PiscesV
Reviews.Content: I cannot say enough good things about the Hotel Lancelot and their staff. Amazingly friendly and helpful. Great location. Rooms were a decent size and well kept. The Roundtable dinner and breakfasts were great ways to meet other travelers. When I had an issue with a B&B I was supposed to move to on the last night after my friends left, they were so good to try and help me contact the other hotel - who's phone, etc. was not weekend. Again, thanks to everyone at the Hotel Lancelot for a great stay in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Highlight of our trip to Italy”
Reviews.Author: Lucy S
Reviews.Content: Hotel Lancelot was the highlight of our trip to Italy. Our granddaughter and her college roommate joined us for the Easter weekend. We had heard how charming it is, but you have to experience it to know it. Our rooms were quiet, comfortable, convenient and clean. The lobby and sitting area are lovely. The food was outstanding -- from the breakfast buffet which is included to the dinner. From appetizer to dessert it was presented beautifully. Red wine and white wine were at every dinner. The tables are set up so that you get to know the other diners, and we met the most delightful people from all over the world. We would highly recommend the Ferris Magic Night Tour of Rome after dinner. He takes you places you have heard of, but he gives you information you don't get out of textbooks and travel books. He will tell you how the Via Capo d'Africa got its name. The owners were very congenial as were their staff. They can help you with things like "what to see" and "how to get there." Thank you, Hotel Lancelot, for making our first trip to Rome so memorable.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful meals”
Reviews.Author: fickle-traveller
Reviews.Content: I don’t always review the hotels we visit, but the Lancelot deserves special mention. The same family have run the business since 1971 and it shows in the way that they care for the hotel and their customers. The secret of their success is that they have mastered the mostly forgotten art of keeping things simple and doing them well. The whole place is run with quiet efficiency; the staff stay in the background but are there and very helpful whenever you need them. You are genuinely made to feel like a welcome guest. The hotel’s website has plenty of useful information and we got the best deal by booking directly with them. Their response to enquiries was prompt and helpful. We booked a standard room and this was quite spacious, simply furnished but with a large comfortable bed. It faced on to the street but there was very little noise from the quiet road, except for the daily refuse truck which appeared noisily every morning between 8 and 8.30. It’s true that the bathroom was small (one at a time only) but like the rest of the hotel it worked well and was spotlessly clean. There is free wi-fi but if you don’t want to bring your own stuff there is also a free internet room. For us the best feature was the evening meals, and the hotel policy of encouraging guests to gather at the round tables. If there was a spare seat a member of the family might join also. The meals themselves were of very good quality and included wine, coffee and a liqueur if you wished. This was a very pleasant way to round off the day, sharing conversation and tips about visiting the sights with fellow guests. The staff always managed this in such a way that language was no problem (If you book dinner for three nights or more, there is a worthwhile discount.) The location is close to the Colosseum and the Forum, but a little further from the other main attractions. If you want to wander Rome’s lively streets after dark you might not want to set out again after dinner, so it’s best to have one or more days as B&B and eat in the town. For character and authentic Roman food at a reasonable price we liked L’Antica Birreria Peroni (it’s in the Trip Advisor restaurant reviews). Although close to the Trevi Fountain it seems to cater much more for locals than tourists, and is well worth checking out. Two things we found out as first timers in Rome:- There are lots of uneven and cobbled surfaces - take your most comfortable walking shoes. Also, take great care when stepping off the pavement - the traffic treats every set of lights like a Formula 1 starting grid and can come at you from unexpected directions. It’s fine if you stick to the proper crossing places, but jaywalking is not recommended. We would definitely stay at the Lancelot on any future visit to Rome and can recommend it highly to everyone else for its welcoming atmosphere, good food and company, and its quiet but handy location.

Reviews.Title: “Will never stay anywhere else in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Gatorfly
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel and staff! We just arrived back in the states after a Easter weekend stay in Rome. Initially I had made reservations at an American chain hotel outside the city but after reading many reviews decided it would be better to stay closer in. By the time I added up all the extras I would pay for daily transportation, extra breakfast for my young sons, and internet, it really ended up being a wash money wise so I elected to stay as close to the city sights as I could. I had read great reviews of Hotel Lancelot but was a little apprehensive since the price was so good. Boy were those feelings wrong as we ended up having the best stay I could have imagined there! As many others have so eloquently stated, even though the location of this hotel is steps away from The Colosseum and The Roman Forum, what really makes this hotel special is the staff! Always helpful, always courteous, always smiling and doing everything they can to make your stay in Rome memorable. From the moment we stepped through the door we had everyone making us feel welcome and at home. Tips on everything from local places with the best pizza to how to avoid the long lines for the sights were plentiful and offered with a smile. The room itself was fine and for a family with 2 young kids who went sight seeing all day was exactly what we needed. Having free WiFi so readily available in all common areas as well as your room was great, as was the breakfast every morning with fresh breads, meats, cheeses, cereals, yogurts, coffee and cakes. With so many great places to eat in Rome, we elected to only eat at the round table for dinner on Easter Sunday. It was an experience that we will never forget and was the perfect ending to our visit there. Four gourmet courses topped off with ice cream swans all served perfectly in a festive and fun atmosphere. When we go back to the Lancelot, we will definitely eat there more often, if not every night. To sum it up, if you are going to Rome, and don't stay at Hotel Lancelot, you will be missing out on a wonderful experience all in itself.

Reviews.Title: “My Roman home away from home”
Reviews.Author: Gestur_Traustason
Reviews.Content: This won‘t be a traditional review and I won’t make the slightest claim to be unbiased… Rome hosts the global HQ for the Food and Agricultural Organization (FAO). As a child in the late 70's I spent weeks in Rome while my father was at meetings at FAO regarding new postings or reporting on completed tasks. We would always stay at Hotel Lancelot and the hotel would normally have its fair share of FAO expats on their way home or on their way to new assignments all over the world. My brother and I explored Rome from the age of 6 to 16 and always considered Hotel Lancelot to be our Roman home more than a “hotel”. Didn’t do that image any damage that the staff more or less remained the same, we would meet old friends and everything was on an extremely friendly first-name basis. About 25 years after my last stay in Rome I decided to take my wife on an anniversary trip to Rome and the Lancelot. I was a bit worried when we arrived. After all my recollections were through the eyes of a child and it had been nearly a quarter of a century from my last visit. Since that time I have done a lot of traveling and am used to all levels and grades of hotels so I wondered how Hotel Lancelot would compare. Let me assure you it completely met my expectations. The rooms aren’t huge but they are above average. Certainly bigger than typical London or Paris business class rooms. Certainly smaller than rooms tend to be in the USA. Beds were comfortable, extra pillows and blankets available. The bathrooms are clean and have everything required but nothing luxurious or big. I had no issues with cleanliness, noise, heat or any other item regarding the room. They beat hands down rooms in comparable hotels in London and Paris in regards to furnishing, cleanliness and comfort. The lobby area was very clean and pleasant. There is a small bar to one side that proved an excellent place for a pre-dinner drink or a post-dinner chat. The staff was extremely helpful and informative. We got directions, suggestions, maps, information and even an umbrella for a rainy day. The elevator is special… Possibly the smallest one I’ve ever been in. We put our bags in it, pressed the third floor and took the steps. Wouldn’t be surprised if the elevator is hindering the hotel from the extra star they deserve. I doubt you will ever get a hotel that is central to everything in Rome. To me the key issue in Rome is having a hotel that’s conveniently located regarding transportation. If all roads lead to Rome then all roads and busses in Rome lead to the Coliseum. With the Hotel Lancelot situated so close by and armed with the info and maps from the lobby we started and ended our excursions with a bus-trip. Quick, cheap, convenient and offered a bonus sight-seeing tour. There are plenty of cafes and restaurants in the area around the Coliseum so going out to dine isn’t hard. However I strongly encourage you to experience the Round Tables and the full board at the Lancelot. You go to Rome to see all the historic sites. So you are up and about early in the morning and out walking and looking all day. Back at the hotel around six and personally I didn’t really look forwards to going out again to find a restaurant. So for us the full-board option was great. Just go to the dining area, sit down at one of the large round tables and see what table partners you get. We always met interesting people and we would share tips and ideas for the next day of sight-seeing. Got the address of the best ice-cream shop in Rome (owned by a former Swedish pro-football player), a tip to save time in the queue at St. Peters, heard a new story about one site and a warning about another being closed for repairs. The food was quite good and typical Italian. Sometimes great, sometimes just OK. Never bad. The wine offered won’t get any prizes but it was appropriate and plentiful. If I didn’t have the past connection with Hotel Lancelot then would I recommend it? No doubt. In fact I have already told several friends that have gone to Rome to stay there. None of them have complained. I for one am definately coming back. Gestur Traustason

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the stay”
Reviews.Author: tch912
Reviews.Content: This hotel was recommended by one of my cousin's coworkers. My cousin, friend and I loved the personal touch of staff at this historic hotel. We had a room overlooking the courtyard with three single beds.The furniture was beautiful antiques in excellent condition. The room was small but we only slept there. The location was in walking distant from Colossuem and the 110 open tram bus. We also had dinner there. The salmon was excellent but I didn't like the rice with squid. My cousin and friend enjoyed everything. Included in the price was breakfast buffet. We only stayed one night but if I stayed in Rome again this would be my hotel.

Reviews.Title: “well run;great staff”
Reviews.Author: t d
Reviews.Content: Though a bit removed from the "central" action of the old city, this hotel is a delightful place to stay. And the central city is within easy walking distance, or inexpensive cab ride. The rooms are well kept, spotless, and efficient; the public spaces are gracious. Best of all is the helpful and cheerful staff. And the location can be considered a plus. You get out of the tumult of the day for a quiet evening. If you want to dine in, the food is fresh and well prepared; if you want to dine out, you have access to some "real" restaurants beyond the tourist hub. All in all, a first rate value.

Reviews.Title: “It's the people”
Reviews.Author: eclipsoid
Reviews.Content: First, I should say that our room was small and a bit spartan. The terrace faced north, so it was in the shade and always a bit too chilly (it was early March) to use. (And you get cigarette smoke from nearby terraces.) But the people here are wonderful. They helped us in many situations, like making museum reservations, recommending places, or educating us about grappa. But they also helped out in unusual situations, too. (A missing computer cable...) The round-table dinners are a lot of fun and an excellent value. A good way to meet other travelers, especially because business people also stay here. (We had a fascinating conversation with an NGO worker, for instance.) Our room was very quiet, the hotel is on a quiet street but in a great location. The shared spaces are wonderful. There are two big lobbies with comfortable couches and chairs, and a big, comfortable bar. We did most of our WiFi access and reading in the lobby. (Note the free WiFi, too. Generally a decent signal and good bandwidth.) We would definitely stay here again and would recommend it to all our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel ever!”
Reviews.Author: bolliCA
Reviews.Content: My 10 year old grandaughter and I visited Rome for a week this last March, 2012. We were fortunate to get a hotel Lancelot recomendation from friends. I have stayed in 2 to 5 star hotels all over the world. Hotel Lancelot is my favorite. We were lucky enough to have stayed on the 6th floor with a view of the Coliseum and the city. We also paid a bit more for a terrace which was well worth the extra money. The staff was friendly and helpful. The seating arrangement at breakfast was deliberately arranged so that we had a chance to meet many other interesting people. My grandaughter is shy and somewhat picky with food. She was very happy with the breakfast choices and the chance to meet other people. We had dinner there three times and each time the dinner was wonderful. As others have said, the location is very good and the help from the front desk outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Ramikat
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our first trip to Rome, 9 of those nights were at Hotel Lancelot. We cannot say enough good things about this delightful hotel. The staff is friendly and helpful, the breakfast buffet is excellent. They even sell bus and metro tickets. The hotel is easy walking distance from many good restaurants and a gelato shop is right around the corner. We only ate dinner at the hotel one night but we were amazed at the delicious food including dessert, house wines and even an after dinner drink for 25E each, which is a good deal in Rome. We ate there towards the end of our stay, and had we known how good the dinner was, we would have eaten there more often. Dinner is served at round tables and we met many interesting people, quite a few who were repeat guests at the Lancelot. The hotel also has a cozy bar with comfortable seats where the friendly staff will serve you - usually you run into other guests there and can share the day's experiences. Our room was very comfortable, quiet, and had drawers and hanging space for clothes . From Capo d'Africa you are a few blocks walk to bus stops, the Colosseum, Forum, Palatine Hill and also a taxi stand. They are also very close to two historic churches, San Clemente and Santi Quatro Coronati. I highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Good location with free parking”
Reviews.Author: Farrell1971
Reviews.Content: We stayed her in March of 2012. We picked it primarily because we had a rental car and they provided parking. It was easy to find with a GPS and the parking was secure in a gated courtyard. The accomodations were fine and the people working the desk were extremely helpful. The location is on a quiet side street within walking distance to the Coliseum. The Vatican is a hike, so we took a taxi. They recommended a couple of nice little restaurants that were right around the corner that were excellent and affordable. I would recommend the Lancelot, especially if you have a car.

Reviews.Title: “The view from the terrace is stunning!”
Reviews.Author: JohnS-from-Kingsley
Reviews.Content: We went to Rome for the Six Nations Match, Italy vs Scotland, and stayed at the Hotel Lancelot on the top floor with our own terrace. The view is stunning and not to be missed. We were joined by friends from Scotland who were on their first trip to Rome and within 2 hours of arriving they were promising to return. The staff were genuinely pleasant and attentive, even on small details. The nearby restaurant recommendations were perfect - traditional trattorias with great food at low prices (for a European capital). It was the same weekend as the Rome marathon, just a short stroll away at the Coliseum, so there was colour and entertainment in abundance. Rooms comfortable, shower a bit of a squeeze (ok I'm tall), breakfasts sociable and free wireless works everywhere (even on the terrace).

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in Rome!”
Reviews.Author: IlikeEngland
Reviews.Content: This is the fourth time I have visited The Lancelot. I have just found it to be the best hotel in Rome.(and not too expensive) It's in a great location, the staff are friendly, the rooms are comfortable, food delicious and the ambience is just wonderful. I have never had anything to find fault with., so I jusr keep going back. I can recommend it without any doubts. I will certainly book it again. Thankyou Lancelot!

Reviews.Title: “High marks for Hotel Lancelot!”
Reviews.Author: JMPinto
Reviews.Content: If you want to be near the Roman Forum and the Coliseum, then this is it. I would recommend the Hotel Lancelot to anyone I know going to Rome. The staff were so helpful, the rooms, while basic, we're very clean and comfortable. And the breakfast was amazing. My husband is not a breakfast person, but he looked forward to this one each morning. It's ideal if you are looking to spend a good chunk of time at the ancient sites, and while it's a long walk to the Vatican, it is easily doable. It is also located in a very quiet neighborhood which was great for us since we were so tired after spending the entire day exploring Rome. All in all, this was a perfect start to our week in Italy!

Reviews.Title: “Charming family run hotel”
Reviews.Author: Forevermemories
Reviews.Content: Quiet area near the Coloseum. Staff couldn't be nicer. Luckily enjoyed dinner with the charming owner, the matriarch of the family, who is kind, informative, accommodating and made our stay even more enjoyable. We were lucky enough to be there when a Scottish group were in Rome for their patron saint being canonized. This enthusiastic group performed music and sang in the evening after dinner. This small hotel is perfect for family groups with its comfortable sitting areas, lovely patio and balconied rooms. There is an elevator, charming balcony with beautiful mosaic walled decor and table. Lovely landscaping. Excellent bar and extremely knowledgeable staff. Highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great way to start our trip to Italy”
Reviews.Author: MMB-9-46
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a a triple with a balcony. The room was immaculate. Staff was informative and very pleasant. Location was great. Area was quiet and only a short walk to the Coloseum, Forum, Palantine Hill and Metro. Metro tickets were purchased in the hotel-such a great convenience if traveling throughout Italy,as we were for 3 weeks. We would definately recommend staying there. Breakfast was included and very good. They also served dinner but we chose to go out. We did enjoy the bar area for coffee, alcohol and soft drinks. The very minor things we didn't like: there is no clock in the room, the bathroom didn't have space to put your toiletries, the towels are thin and not fluffy. The room has no fridge and we couldn't find ice.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, simple neighborhood hotel”
Reviews.Author: D W
Reviews.Content: I have been staying at the Lancelot for years on my frequent business trips to Rome, and I have always appreciated that it feels like a "home away from home." Many rooms look in to the central courtyard of the block, so your mornings are filled with the sounds of nearby families waking up and starting their day--a lovely, homey thing compared to the touristy isolation of many hotels. The staff are always welcoming and helpful, and it's nice to be remembered when you check in! The rooms are simple but comfortable; I only wish the beds were a bit better. I have always found the pillows a little flat and the mattresses a little harder than I like, and the whole set-up is starting to feel in need of a refresh after these years. But each room has its charming touches. The bathrooms are small and spare but always very clean; the interior-facing rooms with small balconies are my favorites. The neighborhood is wonderful too -- a small residential area tucked behind the Coliseum that is close to the Forum, Circus Maximus, Baths of Caracalla, San Giovanni in Laterano, FAO Headquarters and bus and metro lines, but is quiet and insulated from all of the bustle. A favorite spot is the Basilica di San Clemente two blocks away, or more precisely the amazing catacombs underneath. Lots of great places to eat and drink in the neighborhood; favorites include Treefolk up the street for an excellent beer selection, Il Pentagrappolo for wine, good food, and live music, and Luzzi's pizzeria. Bottom line--when I'm in the mood for a little more pampering (and willing to spend a chunk more change), I head to the Hotel Capo d'Africa across the street, but the Lancelot is my go-to place in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “My favorite hotel”
Reviews.Author: baranof
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Lancelot has been my favorite hotel for years. I have traveled extensively and i find myself comparing my experiences with the attentive staff and fabulous food at the Lancelot in Rome. The hotel is but a few meters from the colosseum and public transportations. I loved the round table meal times that offered great conversation with people from many parts of the world. The hotel is clean, comfortable and safe. i would recommend it a person traveling alone or with a family. Gwen Hendrickson Anchorage, Alaska

Reviews.Title: “Excellent experience”
Reviews.Author: DSuttonRN
Reviews.Content: We returned to the Hotel Lancelot ( recommended by Rick Steves years ago) after having a great experience there 8 years ago. We were so happy to see that the hotel has maintained high standards and retains that quiet, personal feel. The rooms were very clean and modest but charmingly decorated. The breakfast was plentiful and varied and the service by front staff was extremely accomodating- making reservations, calling taxi's and making recommendations, all appreciated. We started our italian vacation there, were in short walking distance to the sights around the forum, (could see the coliseum from our balcony) and quick access to metro, buses and taxi's. We returned at the end of our vacation and again, were given excellent service and accomodations were great. This is a great little hotel in a great location with reasonable prices and accomodating staff. It will be my "go to" recommendation in Rome for my friends! Very reliable!

Reviews.Title: “Very good location, very good service”
Reviews.Author: Rolando030
Reviews.Content: We are a family with two young children and spent a few days at the hotel Lancelot around new year's eve. We had a excellent experience and we would absolutely recommend it. The main highlight is the quality of service. All our requests were quickly taken care of, the staff always smiling, available, yet very discreet. Employees are versed in different languages and prepared to help with your trip. For example, the reception helped organizing visits to museums, giving us useful tips, making calls and reservations. We looked at a few rooms and they were of a reasonable size with tasteful interiors, with the exception of the "annex" which we didn't like. We recommend the top floor suite: albeit pricey, the terrace offers the possibility of romantic breakfast with a clear view of the Colosseum, only a few hundred yards away. Breakfast was abundant and of a good quality, although the offering did not change for the five days we spent there and made it a bit monotone. We had dinner in the hotel only once and it was fine. The menu seemed well selected although less inspired by local cuisine than what we'd have hoped (but I guess you can pick one of the neighboring restaurants for "trippa" and "abbacchio"..). Ambiance of the dining area was pleasant. The hotel is located in a quiet neighborhood with plenty of restaurants and a handful of shops, including a small but well furnished wine seller. We felt very safe at any time, for example walking back alone to the hotel at one in the morning. As a matter of fact, we found downtown Rome to be very safe.

Reviews.Title: “Charming, family run hotel”
Reviews.Author: Chita44
Reviews.Content: Charming tastefully decorated hotel in an elegant house built in 1942; has front garden and 6th floor terrace with Colosseum views. Rooms are immaculate. Buffet breakfast was luxurious and bountiful, included fresh oysters, smoked salmon, walnuts, almonds, and dried fruits to add to yogurt, cheeses, Italian cold cuts and fresh fruits. Hotel has a 25 euro prix fixe dinner daily at 7:30 pm with menu changing every day. Diners sit at round tables so you get a chance to meet and chat with other guests. Food is excellent. My one dinner there was probably one of my best meals in Rome. Very friendly, helpful English speaking staff. They seemed to have a lot of repeat guests.

Reviews.Title: “A Happy New Year at Hotel Lancelot”
Reviews.Author: Katy264
Reviews.Content: Delightful stay at Hotel Lancelot. They put on a wonderful New Year's Eve show: the meal lasted all evening - exquisite gourmet dishes - was punctuated by opera arias and belly-dancing, and ended with us all watching the fireworks over the Coliseum from the hotel terrace. We especially enjoyed the informal and very welcoming feel of this family-run place. The staff are friendly and very helpful - Michael the barman's ginger tea rescued us when we were going down with colds! We'd recommend it to anyone visiting Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hospitality”
Reviews.Author: esims04
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay at Hotel Lancelot. The location was prefect, it is only a stones throw away from great restaurants, and about a 5-7 minute walk to the Colosseum. In our room, we actually could see the Colosseum from our window! The hotel was very nice and cozy. Their breakfast meal was very good with assortments of pastries, cereals, fruits and juices. There is a terrance on the 6th floor with wonderful views of the city available all the time. The manager Mrs. Kahn was so helpful in making our stay great. I sent multiple emails and changed our plans many of times and they showed great patience. Francisca at the front desk showed us how to get to places, called taxis for us, and printed out the train schedule for us, she was great. There was not much to complain about, only that the walls are paper thin and the beds are really firm, but that's usually everywhere. If you do stay here, a bunch of the taxi drivers didn't know the hotel by name, but just mention the street "Capo d'Africa" they will find it easily. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Splendid New Year”
Reviews.Author: margsalady
Reviews.Content: Hotel Lancelot gave its guests a fantastic start to New Year. A pre-dinner glass of champagne whilst we were entertained with music and song from a soprano, pianist, accordionist,jazz singer and guitarist. This was followed by a gourmet meal accompanied with Frascarti and Chianti. As midnight struck we were whisked to the hotel balcony terrace to watch a wonderful firework display and more champagne, then downstairs for partying and dancing. The Khan family and their staff onced again made this visit a super experience.

Reviews.Title: “A nice hotel near the Colessium”
Reviews.Author: EP1229
Reviews.Content: Spent 5 nights here in Nov. 2011. Location is great if you want to be near the Colessium and Roman Forum. If that's not your thing, there isn't much else nearby. Hotel is very clean and the front desk staff is extremely friendly and helpful. We had a terrace view of the collessium and the terrace was HUGH! It had plants and flowers in addition to a table and chairs. EXCELLENT! My only complaint is the bathroom...there are no shelves on which to store toiletries, which got annoying after a while. Buffet breakfast was nice, although the coffee should be better than it is.

Reviews.Title: “Good experience, good location”
Reviews.Author: ksudduth
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located up a quiet street near the Coloseum and a Metro stop. Walking distance to many of the sites around the Roman Forum. Rooms were clean and bathrooms were very modern. Breakfast was very good for our family of four - three adults and a teen.

Reviews.Title: “What a great place”
Reviews.Author: Bob P
Reviews.Content: A pure find in Rome. Well located, beautifully maintained, a kind, helpful and generous staff and terrific breakfasts. The owning Khan family are true hoteliers who have run this wonderful place for years. They are tremendously, and, as importantly, accurately, helpful regarding any site, location, restaurant, etc. You couldn't find a better place to stay in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Authentic Italian courtesy and character in the heart of the city.”
Reviews.Author: littlerazz
Reviews.Content: Not a modern chain hotel - much better! Very helpful front desk people. Walk to colluseum and many other historical landmarks. Spare but nice rooms with small standing shower. Yummy round table breakfast. Not really a place for kids but lovely for adults

Reviews.Title: “Great location and staff.”
Reviews.Author: srbentley
Reviews.Content: The location is ideal... quiet side streets, great restaurants within walking distance, and the Colosseum is a very short walk away. The staff was extraordinarily friendly and helpful. They surprised us with a bottle of champagne since we checked in on our 19th anniversary, which they brought to our 6th floor terrace view of the Colosseum. If we go back to Rome, I can't imagine staying anywhere else.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Washington, District of Columbia, United States
Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: ShaikhChilli
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel! Its a 5-10 walk from the Colosseum and the adjacent Colosseo metro station. Located on a quiet side street (47 Capo D'Africa) with a quaint little courtyard, the hotel really makes you feel like you're in Rome. We had initially booked a single room (erroneously) and the hotel quite willingly accommodated our request to switch to a double. The room was quite large (on the 4th floor) and had a nice window which opened up onto the street. The bed was comfortable (a bit hard but that seems to be the case all over Rome). In any case, we slept very well. There was no street noise (none that we noticed anyway), so we left the window open for most of the time that we were in the room (the weather was cool and comfortable in November). The bathroom is a bit small but the pristine cleanliness more than makes up for it (we would prefer a clean bathroom over a large bathroom any day). Like most hotels in Rome, there is no carpeting on the floor, which has wooden parquet flooring. This adds to the charm and authenticity of the hotel. The heater was a bit noisy, so we ended up switching it after the first night since it otherwise kept us awake. The customer service is outstanding at the Hotel Lancelot. The folks at the front desk were super helpful and always cheerful. My wife has a gluten-free diet restriction and once we informed the hotel, they made sure that she always had gluten-free alternatives available at the morning breakfast (which, by the way, is superb - salmon, cheese, croissants, sweet rolls, excellent coffee, the list goes on). Each time we asked reception for a taxi, we only had to wait 3-5 minutes (although this seems to be the case everywhere in the old city in Rome). The hotel reception was accommodating in other ways as well, happily checking city restaurants for gluten-free menus and giving us directions and other tourist information whenever we asked. The hotel has free WiFi Internet but we couldn't access it in our room. However, we were able to connect quite easily in the corridor outside our room. Our friend who stayed on the third floor had no problems connecting from her room so it may just have been an issue with our particular room. Not a problem anyway, since they also have an Internet workstation in the lobby which guests can use for three euros per hour (we used it for 15 minutes and were only charged one euro). This seems to be a hotel which thrives on repeat business. Many of the other guests seemed to have stayed here in the past, which says something for the place since it isn't the cheapest hotel in Rome (quite average in terms of price). Our room had a safe which we used to store our valuables, although this doesn't appear to be the kind of hotel where you would have problems anyway. The hotel has been run by the same family for decades and they seem to have made it a point to keep their customers happy. Certainly, we would stay here again. Location wise, its walking distance to many of the Roman ruins (Colosseum, Palantine Hill, Forum, Circus Maximus, etc.). One night, while walking back to the hotel after dinner, we stopped and watched a fireworks display celebrating a saint's birthday at the Basilica of San Clemens, which is just a couple of blocks from the hotel. We stayed here for three nights and then moved to a hotel near the Spanish Steps, not because there was anything wrong with the hotel, but because we wanted to spend a few days near the Steps and also because we got a good deal at a hotel there (significantly cheaper). Overall, there are cheaper hotels in Rome which are also in nice locations. However, we didn't find the warmth and authenticity anywhere else and left this hotel with fond memories. One caveat - the restaurants around the hotel can be a bit pricey and are clearly targeted towards tourists. Since they're so close to the Colosseum, they focus more on the view rather than the food. We typically ate dinner at other locations around Rome (which allowed us to get a flavor of the city). The one night when we had dinner at a restaurant next to the Colosseum, the food was quite good but definitely not worth the exorbitant price (six euros for a Coke) That said, we would definitely recommend this place, particularly if you want to really "feel" that you're staying in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, very friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Dayvaux
Reviews.Content: A quiet location (so quiet the taxi driver had not heard of it)., handy for the Colosseum. Several small restaurants within 5 mins walk. Good breakfast spread, nice bar area. Staff very friendly and helpful, they even gave us a bottle of sparkling wine to celebrate a birthday. Room on 1st floor had a patio area which we used even though it was November.

Reviews.Title: “Great location friendly atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: harissa47
Reviews.Content: I almost always stay here as its a great deal and great location. The rooms are a bit on the small side but who needs a big room anyway. Clean and friendly more than make up for that. Stay here and you will not be disappointedc

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommend”
Reviews.Author: spinardo
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights based on reviews we read on Trip Advisor. What a wonderful hotel! Can't wait to go back. The hotel is located a block or two from the Colosseum, ona quiet street, in a lovely little neighborhood. Lots of good restaurants within walking distance. Hotel is owned by a wonderful family who made us feel very welcome. Someone was at the front desk 24 hours/day. They were very professional and attentive to the needs of all their guests. Everyone staying at the hotel raved about the wonderful service they received. We felt very safe there. The hotel is gated, and access is by key only. Rooms were small, as is the case in most European hotels, but very clean and beautifully decorated. Dinner is served nightly and was quite popular with the guests. The breakfast buffet was fabulous as well. They put out quite a spread each morning including breads, meats, fruit, cereals, coffee and juices, cheeses, and much more. They also have a small bar that was packed with the guests each evening. We met people from all over the world who stay here each time they come to Rome. It is about a 10-minute taxi to the main train station. We absolutely loved this hotel and would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “outstanding service and charming elegance will keep me coming bac.”
Reviews.Author: lynette_cypress
Reviews.Content: I just took a small travel group to Italy and spent 4 days in Rome, staying for a second time at Hotel Lancelot. From the beginning of our email reservation process months ago until the day we departed at 4:00 a.m. for the airport, the staff there was exceptionally courteous, helpful and responsive. The property has elegant sitting rooms, a nice outdoor bar area, a fabulous breakfast (included) as well as dinners available every night. one of my group members had a birthday during our staty and the staff made it a special evening, complete with cake, candles and "happy birthday" on the piano. My next group will stay there without question.

Reviews.Title: “The place ot stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Neal M
Reviews.Content: We just spent 4 days in Rome and stayed at the Lancelot. We originally found it and decided because of TripAdvisor and it was all that was advertised. Great English speaking staff that provided maps and suggestions about getting around Rome and seeing all the sites. Rooms clean, beds comfortable, had the patio overlooking the Colosseum that was fantastic. Bountiful breakfast and close to all transportation and many sites. We will be back to this Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Gem of a Place”
Reviews.Author: cruiselady55
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Hotel Lancelot was perfect. The location is about 3 block from the Coliseum and the Palatine, Roman Forum Ruins and the Metro. It was very clean and our room (#6), tho small, had an absolutely wonderful private balcony with an Italian flair. The beds are very comfortable and the room does have a small closet safe so you can tour Rome with peace of mind. The continental breakfast (which is included) is marvelous and will easily satisfy the hardiest of appetites (variety of yogurts, toppings, cereal, juices, pastries, smoked salmon and other breakfast meats, cheeses, breads, and coffee, tea, cocoa). The Front Desk attendants go out of their way to assist you in any way they can from call a cab to giving directions to anywhere you wish to go in Rome. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: James H
Reviews.Content: We returned a few days ago from a trip to Rome and Sicily and we stayed at Hotel Lancelot for our Rome visit. We could not have picked a better place to stay. The hotel is comfortable, very clean and conveniently located. It is a good 5-10 minute walk to the Metro station, but the metro system in Rome is limited to where it can take you. Buses are better suited to getting you to where you really need to go and this is close to many of the stops. The staff is gracious, knowledgeable and very helpful. And they all speak English which is a big help when you are trying to get important information. The breakfasts are terrific and there is a cozy lounge to relax in during the evening (with bar) as well as comfortable sitting areas. They offer a fixed prix dinner (a bargain by Rome standards) which we did not try, but heard very nice comments. We would not hesitate to return to Hotel Lancelot or recommend to friends

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful family-run hotel”
Reviews.Author: COCory
Reviews.Content: This hotel is exactly what I imagined when I booked it for one night (wish I could have afforded to stay here for all four nights in Rome): simple, classic architecture; great view from a small terrace on the third floor; friendly family owners; cozy bar/library area on the first floor; beautiful furnishings; and only four blocks from the Colosseum on a quiet street. If it's in your budget, I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “"Good central location in Rome"”
Reviews.Author: BRW73
Reviews.Content: Really a good value for an in-city, centrally located boutique hotel in Rome. The location is excellent and close to so much.......the Colosseum, the Palatine, Trastevere, the Vatican, etc. Friendly, helpful staff, bountiful breakfast and the hotel itself is European stylish. Not inexpensive, but easily worth it due to the location, breakfast inclusion and the service and staff. Our only complaint was that we had two double beds (had requested a queen). Overall, we would recommend this hotel to any of our friends and acquaintances looking to visit Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and baby friendly”
Reviews.Author: kelznz
Reviews.Content: This hotel really is just a stones throw from the Colosseum. The location is fantastic and the hotel staff exceptionally friendly and helpful. We had a nearly 8 month old baby with us for our long weekend and Rome and this hotel was perfect for us. The rooms have a bath, although we ended up showering with our baby. Lancelot provide a travel cot all made up and go out of their way to be of assistance. The rooms are nice, basic but cleaned every day and comfortable. The air con is only on for the summer months which was a shame as we were there in October and it was still very hot for us coming from Ireland :) But with the window open it was fine. There are loads of great trattorias close to the hotel and the breakfast is a good selection, there is a highchair for babies as well. Cost was around €600 for 3 nights stay, expensive enough but for the location we thought it was good value. Would recommend to all.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay at Hotel Lancelot”
Reviews.Author: GT3Jeff
Reviews.Content: My wife and stayed at Hotel Lancelot for 5 days in October. We love the hotel and of course Rome, and we will be back. The hotel staff are friendly, helpful and completely fluent in English. The location is perfect and is among the closest hotels to the Roman Forum and Colosseum. The self served breakfast served at the hotel was great. A good selection of meat including smoked salmon and various cured meats. Also some fantastic jams including an incredible Orange marmalade (best I've ever had) and some of the freshest nuts I've ever had. There was a wide array of cereals, breads, and croissants. The fresh squeezed apple juice from green apples was unique and very good. Now, this is not a cheap place to stay. We paid 195 Euros per night. I think it's worth the money though given the typical high costs for hotels in this area. Being so close to all the sights and being able to walk everywhere justifies some the added expense. There are cheaper places, but you would need to either take a bus or taxi to get to where you really want to be in Rome. If you can afford it, I don't think you will be disappointed. Be sure to visit the terrace on the 6th floor. Its a great spot to drink some wine in the early evening.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent All Around !”
Reviews.Author: sorrisa
Reviews.Content: This was my ninth visit to Rome and for this occasion I decided to try a new area of the city to stay in and chose Hotel Lancelot based on the Trip Advisor reviews and the fact there were some lovely rooms available with private terrace. It was a special occasion, one of the reasons being my daughter's 21st birthday and my niece's first trip overseas. We stayed in rooms 60 , which is the corner suite and 61 which was the next room. Both of these have a lovely view from the terrace, the suite having a view of the Colosseum and Parco di Traiano and at night one could see all the way up to St. Peter's. We arrived early evening after a very long series of flights and immediately welcomed by the receptionist and by Mrs. Khan . Everyone was very helpful in getting us settled and explaining how things worked at the hotel. Our rooms were comfortable - the suite was spacious and the double room was small , as most rooms are in Rome. The bathrooms were well appointed, the suite having a bath tub. The mattress in room 61 was new and too firm for the girls but the linens were of very good quality. Both rooms had TV, free wi fi and spacious storage for belongings. The breakfasts were buffet style and there was a wide selection of foods ranging from breads, cheeses, meats, fruit , juices, tea and coffee. If one wants a cappuccino or other than straight american coffee one only needs to ask at reception or to one of the staff . Each night dinner is served at the hotel either in the enclosed patio area or breakfast room. The menu is offered at the reception desk and at breakfast . If you do not chose dinner included in your room rate you only have to let them know by 4pm that you wish to join for dinner- which is served at 7:30pm. The food is prepared by Mrs. Khan's son who is marvelous and very interesting to talk with also. We very much enjoyed our one meal there. There is also an extensive bar offering a selection of standard drinks plus liquors unique to Italy. There is a lift if one wishes to use it but I chose to walk the 6 flights each time which is how I could justify eating so well each day . A truly special thing they do at the hotel is serve something special if it is a celebration, like a birthday . On the evening of my daughter's birthday before we went out to dinner they brought up to the rooms drinks in which the glasses had been decorated with colored sugar and Happy B-day and my daughter's name was written on one of the glasses. It was such a sweet little special touch that really emphasized how personal the hotel is and how Mrs Khan and her family feel about the business they have. The only draw back was in my daughter and niece's view and that was that the location was too far away for them to just go out at night and wander the hang out areas, like Campo di Fiori and Piazza Navona. As I am a big walker I did not find the location a problem and actually enjoyed staying in a totally "new" area . I highly recommend this hotel and the hospitality of Mrs. Khan and her son (sorry- forgot your name ! ) and all the rest of the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great atmosphere but really too pricey”
Reviews.Author: carlop_oOo
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, great location but ... should be much better for money they ask you. Upon arrival we had a "bad" experience with a clerk... we booked parking and arrived very late, the clerk had no driving licence, so we had to move 3 car ourselves to park our one, this after 6 hours of flight from edinburgh with children sleeping in the car... well... this is not so nice for an hotel like this one. Bad Service this time ! Pros: The staff: really kind, polite and helpful, (except maybe for the previous nigh-clerk !) The atmosphere, the hall is very very good Good breakfast Cons: too much pricey... we payed EUR 240 /night for a 4 bed room. furnitures (expecialy bathroom) are somewhat too old bathroom was really awful air conditioned does not follows the temp you set. If I set 24 degrees I want 24, not 27 ok ? after all I pay 240 EUR/day !!!

Reviews.Title: “Believe what you read on Trip Advisor - it's the place to stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: david s
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel exclusively based upon Trip Advisor recommendations. I had never been to Rome, so with hundreds of Hotels scattered around the city, it was a gamble choosing somewhere. I needed to visit the Vatican and Colloseum, so rather than risk somewhere in between, I chose to stay near the Colloseum due to the rather more peaceful surroundings that appeared to be around there. Trip Advisor rated this Hotel as within its Top 20 Hotels, but it was one of the cheapest - sub 200 Euros - in that Top 20. The rest were 400+ Euros. Ideally I wanted to pay 120 Euro for a Hotel for one night, but these all appeared to have indifferent reviews and locations, so I decided to pay the extra for the reassurance. It was worth it. The pictures on the Net and the actual Website of the Hotel don't do it justice, and the impression I got before arriving was of some posh version of 'Faulty Towers' run in a B&B style with quirky Courtyards, Terraces and strange staff going overboard to please. This wasn't the case. The Hotel is just a regular Hotel, in a city, with friendly staff - but not overbearing friendly if that makes sense - and helpful receptionists. It is not a crappy Travelodge or PremierInn affair, as us Brits know. The clientele on my night was almost all American, and this was the night of the Rome demonstrations and small scale riots. We could see the burning cars from our windows, with black, choking smoke pervading the terrace. We felt safe inside the hotel and ventured out later in the eveing. We found a few lovely, cheap Pizza / Pasta restaurants within one block walk, with meals from 7 Euros, all with dining areas and Gas burners on the pavement - a typical lovely Mediterranean feel with cars drifting by behind us (not burning thankfully). Go two blocks further to the Colloseum and the price for food doubles - so avoid.! It aint worth the view of the Colloseum for the extra cash. Stay withing two blocks of the Hotel for good local dining. There is nothing for at least 1/2 a mile in any other direction if you want other food. You'd have to walk in the direction of the main Banking area / Trevi fountain for more food or different variety. If you're there for more than 1 night, then do both. The Hotel placed us on the 6th floor which had a view of the Colloseum, which was an added bonus. You could even see the ancient structure whilst on the toilet seat through the bathroom window.! Result. The only complaint is that a bottle of 660ml beer from their bar - no draft beer - is 6 Euro. But to be fair, the Irish pub one block away was the same price for a pint so I guess Italy is just expensive for drink. 90% the residents of the Hotel were English speaking, mostly Sceptics, but they were all genuinely very friendly and we all shared a good laugh about the riots and the hooliganism of the demonstration - but then again we're British and from London so know all about bloody riots.?! In summary, the price of the hotel is steep but worth the extra, the location is peaceful (ish - riots permitting), great for walking everywhere, and the Colloseum is just jaw dropping to look at from the Hotel. The Hotel was ever so clean, the bathroom small but who cares, the staff nice, the safety and security faultless, so all in all, highly recommended. The hotel will tell you it'll take 50 minutes to walk to the Vatican - I'd say nearly double that.! But what a picturesque walk it was and apart from the blisters, I'd do it again and again. Believe what you read here on Trip Advisor, it is the place to stay, you'll have no regrets, and if anxious about believeing what you read, if you do not know Rome, then trust me, just book it. You won't be dissappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel in the heart of Rome”
Reviews.Author: Prest0s
Reviews.Content: We spent 8 nights at the Hotel Lancelot this Fall. It is located near the Colosseum and the sites of Rome are easily accessible from this location. The Metro is within short walking distance and the front desk will call you a taxi that arrives within a couple of minutes. The front desk is very knowledgeabl and helpful. They can arrange for tours and guides and even direct you to some local shopping areas. The staff were very professional. The round table dinning is a good way to meet people and share touring tips. We had a terrace room on the first floor. Our stay was an extended one so it was very nice to come back to the hotel and have an outdoor space to relax in.

Reviews.Title: “Most Excellent!!”
Reviews.Author: Gudava
Reviews.Content: Our group of four stayed at Hotel Lancelot (near the Colosseum) for four nights in late September, 2011. Couldn't have had a better location or a nicer hotel. The owners of the hotel were wonderful, the optional dinners were superb, the breakfasts were great, and the rooms were quite nice. The owner of the hotel was very helpful with suggestions for places to visit in Rome as well as giving us some great ideas for touring Tuscany, our next destination.

Reviews.Title: “Spent two wonderful nights at this charming hotel”
Reviews.Author: NewYorkCathy82
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I spent two nights at this lovely hotel pre-cruise in Rome. We loved the location near the Colosseum and walked to all of the main sites. The staff were very helpful. Our twin room with terrace was very comfortable and clean. The shower was fine for us, but a heavy person might find it a bit tight to squeeze through the door. The staff was very helpful. The highlight of our stay was dinner on the second night when we decided to eat at the hotel where the seating puts you with other guests. We met some great people and had great conversations. In fact, we were having such a good time that they had to ask us to move to the next room so they could clear the dining room. I will definitely stay there again when next in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Jerry, Lynn, Casey, G Our First Trip to Rome”
Reviews.Author: JerryG9644
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Lancelot is a perfect place to lay your head down after a long day visiting the sites of Rome. We stayed there from August 4 through August 11, 2011. The breakfast buffet was always well attended to and contained very good breakfast items. The different juices each morning was excellent and the coffee was always good to the last drop. The staff is very friendly, attentive and most helpful. They provided us excellent directions to the bus stops, which train to catch and which bus to catch on our return, best place to catch a taxi and excellent places to eat in the immediate area. I am sorry to say that we had dinner there only one night. When we did, it was excellent food, wine and we were lucky enough to sit with the owners. We enjoyed their company and conversation. Rooms were larger than we anticipated and worked great for the three of us. We all thought the beds were very comfortable. Being on a quiet street was nice because you were not bothered by a bunch of traffic noise as we experienced later in London. We have informed several friends about Hotel Lancelot and if we should return to Rome, we plan to stay here again. We felt very safe while staying at the Hotel Lancelot.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location!”
Reviews.Author: sactomike1
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Lancelot is a small hotel with a terrific location, just a few blocks from the Colosseum and the Roman Forum. The hotel sits on a quiet street; which makes for a very restful oasis after a day of sightseeing. The staff is very attentive and friendly and the rooms were clean and well maintained. The included breakfast provided something for everyone. Also, try to schedule at least one dinner at the hotel; it was delicious and the evening we reserved was served by candlelight in the hotel courtyard.

Reviews.Title: “Returning to the warm heart of Rome”
Reviews.Author: boywandering
Reviews.Content: This is the third time of staying at Lancelot Hotel. A family business in the quiet heart of Rome. Close to anything you ever dreamed of seeing in the eternal city and yet tucked away on a quiet side street in a charming area. There are still local family run stoes in the area, great and reasonably priced restaurants. The staff are friendly, helpful and even remember you after returning a few times. The rooms are simple, very clean, mine has always had a little balcony. There is a fabulous rooftop terrace with stunning views across ancient Romes centre.

Reviews.Title: “Nice quiet hotel”
Reviews.Author: CALRtravel
Reviews.Content: This was definetly a good hotel choice in Rome. The hotel is very nicely decorated, clean, and close to the main sites in Rome. We had a very lovely room with a balconey overlooking the main street. The nice part about this hotel is that it is in a quiet location and we had no trouble sleeping at night. The local restaurants down the street had great food and were easy to walk to at night. The staff was polite but I would not say overly friendly. The breakfast in the morning was adequate with a nice dining area.

Reviews.Title: “outstanding gem”
Reviews.Author: jewelsw
Reviews.Content: We (three couples) spent one nite at the Lancelot after returning from a cruise. The Hotel arranged for transportation from Civitavecchia to the Hotel and then to the Airport the following morning. Upon arriving at the Hotel we were warmly greeted and two of our rooms were ready (it was 11 a.m.) and we had to wait only one more hour for the third. We were offered coffee and relaxed in the bar area. The rooms were spacious and clean and the location is fantastic. The breakfast was delicious and we were impressed with the presentation...in fact my husband said that this breakfast was better than the breakfast we had on the Cunard. We can't say enough about this Hotel. True value for your money. An intimate quaint hotel run by a family who cares. Thank you for an enjoyable nite.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad but certainly not outstanding either”
Reviews.Author: OzJohnno
Reviews.Content: Like many we booked and stayed here because the vast majority of the reviews have it as an outstanding Hotel in Rome. Whilst it wasn't a bad place to stay it certainly fell well short of of being outstanding. I agree that it has a good location with only a 10 min walk to the Colosseum and that the staff are very friendly and knowledgeable. There are quite a few reasonably priced restaurants very close to the hotel. The hotel decor although starting to look it's age is always clean and well decorated. The room size was quite adequate with room to move around and the bathroom although small was quite functional but that's all the pro's we could find. The room has very little hanging and storage space - especially when you stay for 7 nights as we did and there is no room to put your bags under the bed. The room had no clock. In every 3 star hotel we stayed in during our European Adventure there was a clock or clock radio. Although liking or disliking breakfast is very subjective we found that for a hotel that caters almost exclusively to overseas visitors it had absolutely nothing hot on the menu for breakfast - not even a piece of toast and the the pastries tasted like they were made yesterday. The dinner appears great value at 25 Euros per person but there are no choices and that can make a meal you've booked before arriving a bit hit or miss. For around 200 Euros a night we found the hotel didn't represent value for money to us and if we ever save enough to visit Rome again we'd look for another Hotel to stay in.

Reviews.Title: “Very conviently located hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: ProfessorBob
Reviews.Content: As mentioned by others, the location is great for the Colosseum and other historical sites. Although our room was very plain, it was one of the two handicapped first floor rooms, although that was not in our request. The lobby, bar and dining area are very attractively decorated and it is my understanding that some of the other rooms are as well. I was very impressed by the quality of service and helpfulness of every staff member I had contact with. I also thought the complementary breakfast was excellent with a wide variety of food offerings. I would certainly consider staying there again. The location while convenient is a little difficult to find. I thought the room prices were a little on the high side, but this is Rome.

Reviews.Title: “When in Rome.....”
Reviews.Author: SallyEnglish
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel whilst on a study tour of Rome. It involved a lot of studying and a lot of touring which meant that the group were so tired at the end of the day we would probably all have slept very comfortably on a pavement, so the finer details of the hotel's comfort etc were perhaps wasted on us. However, the brief time we did spend in the hotel revealed it to be clean, well-appointed and very welcoming. The bedroom was spacious enough for one and would have been fine for two. It was adequately furnished with a good-sized wardrobe and a comfy bed. The bathroom was clean, a fair size and the towels were generous too. The tiled floor would be very cooling in summer and came in very handy during our trip as it rained so much that any carpet would have become sodden right through from raincoats, shoes and umbrellas dripping. The breakfast was a very generous buffet of pastries, breads, cheese, ham, cereals and fruit. The coffee was excellent! The bar was very welcoming (and also very tolerant of a load of frazzled mature students in need of a pick-me-up). The location is superb: very close to the colisseum and some super restaurants and yet on a quiet, residential street - still accessible to taxis and mini-buses though, which is not always the case in Rome. As a little tip - a pocketful of the sweets they have in a bowl in Reception can come in very handy when dashing round all the sights in the rain, especially if the group leader does not share the group's feelings on how frequent the coffee-stops should be!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location which provides tranquility yet only a stones throw from Ancient Rome!”
Reviews.Author: DM7UTD
Reviews.Content: Wonderful location. Tucked away a couple of streets from the Colosseum, with all the bustle of Ancient Rome, yet this quaint little hotel manages to provide everything you need in a warm and welcoming environment, with the added benefit of peace and quiet where you need it most. Even before our arrival, Mrs Khan, her daughter and the team were very helpful with arrangements. Upon arrival the welcome is warm and friendly, respectful of privacy yet offering the feeling that nothing is any trouble. Rooms are simple, well appointed, nicely styled and clean. Very comfortable large bed and good pillows, all help rest those aching limbs after a full day of Rome's cobbled streets. Ours was on the 6th floor, with views of the Colloseum and St Peter's in the distance - albeit a slightly cluttered view over adjacent roof tops. Still, nicer than seeing nothing of any significance. Breakfast is a decent continental affair. Missing a little variety and the odd boiled egg, but generally it's a good start to the day. The round tables are a nice way to interact, something we Brits aren't always accustomed to but it certainly adds a little flavour to the proceedings. We were provided with complimentary drinks to help celebrate my partner's birthday. A very nice and welcome gesture. All in all, I would say the fantastic location, warm welcome, good rooms and relatively affordable pricing (for Rome) - make this hotel a definite shortlister. If you prefer a hotel to provide the simple things simply, and leave you to enjoy the vast array of delights that the city offers for the most part, then you would do well to find a better offer.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: trip-a-daygirl
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel because Rick Steve's had recommended it. The reception staff was nice but there is nothing exceptional about this hotel. Our room was large and clean for a Rome hotel. The breakfast was disappointing because absolutely nothing was made on the premises except for the coffee. For a hotel that offered dinner I expected for them to make the breakfast they provided. The location was convenient to the Metro and Colosseum. I guess it comes down to the price we paid did not commensurate to the hotel quality.

Reviews.Title: “Helpful and friendly service second to none”
Reviews.Author: MarianWriter
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my daughter for a second time in this lovely centrally located Roman hotel this week and found the staff to be very helpful and friendly, willing to help us and advise us on any queries we had. A few examples will show what I mean. We wanted extra pillows but forgot to ask for them after breakfast so asked quite late at night but within five minutes of our request, they were brought up to our room with a smile. We used the hotel's taxi service to bring us to and from the airport and found it efficient and punctual, with very pleasant drivers. We wanted to plan a trip to Ostia Antica which involved both metro and train travel and were able to do this with the help of the hotel staff who gave us valuable and practical advice and we had a fantastic trip there thanks to this advice. The hotel's location is superb, beside Rome's major ancient landmarks and close to the metro and the buses and the hotel is run with pride and pleasantness by the lovely Khan family. This is the secret of this hotel's success - it's not just an impersonal hotel, it's a family business and guests are treated very well, better than any othe hotel I have ezperienced in Italy and I have travelled extensively there, from Sicily to Venice, Milan and Florence and from Naples to Rome. It is Mrs Khan's 40th year in Rome and her experience in the hotel business shows! Long live Hotel Lancelot!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful romantic hotel”
Reviews.Author: Poppit-harvey
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Lancelot for two nights post cruise,I had found the hotel on trip advisor and was definitely not disappointed. I booked the hotel via email and all correspondence was very fast and efficient I upgraded the room to one with a garden terrace and it was just so beautiful. We arrived early at the hotel around 10.30am and reception was exceptionally nice and friendly we even had breakfast (our second of the day) there was a nice continental selection of bread,cheese,smoked salmon,cereals etc which was all lovely. Our room was ready about 40mins after arriving the security man escorted us up to the room,showed us how to work the shutters and then brought our cases. Our room which was on the 1st floorwas lovely and cool and airy and quite quaint the terrace was just beautiful was a mosaic table and chairs and lots of plants and shrubs. I was so glad I had booked it! The terrace was great for drinking wine on and it also was good for socialising we had 2 couples on either side from New Jersey (hello if u are reading this we hope u enjoyed ur tour) and we really enjoyed chatting with them! I also went up to the terrace on the 6th floor which has stunning views and had a lovely chat with another American couple and a French lady. The hotel is in a great location very safe and only 2 mins walk to the colosseum we walked everywhere during our stay there are also lots of nice restaurants near the hotel so an abundance of places to eat. The hotel do offer dinner which I heard was good and we would probably have booked it to try if we had stayed longer they even offer to make you something different if the set menu does not suit so very accommodating! I also loved the owners little dog that wandered in the reception it was cute and we even seen it being transported in a backpack on a scooter with the owner which was a sight to see. You will not be disappointed if you book this hotel it's beautiful and the staff are very friendly we just wished we could have spent longer but having just came from a cruise we couldn't complain.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location-Would Return in a Minute!”
Reviews.Author: Liverdoc
Reviews.Content: This was a wonderful experience for our family of 4. The front desk staff was superior, and helped us with all we needed. The check in was easy, and the rooms were very good. As usual for Europe, small, but they worked fine for us. The breakfast kept us full throuh the day, and the selection was very good. The location was equally excellent. On a side road, we were able to walk just about everywhere. Close to the Roman Forum and Coloseum, the location was very good.

Reviews.Title: “Always the Best in Rome”
Reviews.Author: marynbryce
Reviews.Content: Returning once again to this exquisite "Italian Hotel". We had to return after our last trip in 2007. Hotel Lancelot exudes the Family Flavour of hotels in Roma. The welcoming atmosphere, the food is 'Par excellance".... never had a bad dinner! Great presentation and soooo tasty! 3 course with coffee and liquer to follow. Hotelier Mrs Khan and her family take exceptional care to meet and eat with their guests which makes it a real family affair. Rooms are very comfortable...ample but simple and clean, TV in every room and even if you don't manage to get a Balcony... there are several terraces you can relax on. A complete example of the best Rome can offer and such a great base to explore the eternal city, 350 metres to the Colloseum..... Ciao Bella... we will continue to Return ... Mary and Bryce Jones... Mandurah Western Australia

Reviews.Title: “carino!”
Reviews.Author: joanixNy
Reviews.Content: Great location right behind the coliseum The building is very nice and has parking for an additional 10 eur/night; the staff is very helpful; the rooms are large and clean, all different with nice simple furniture and mini bathrooms. Nice breakfast Overall very good value for money. will certainly return!

Reviews.Title: “We recommend this hotel absolutely.”
Reviews.Author: magdalen D
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Lancelot is such excellent value, so well located and beautifully run by superb staff, it's easy to overlook the building itself - a small work of art , an Art Deco gem, very subtle and understated but gorgeous in every detail. If you want something overstuffed and glitz, this is probably not for you. If you want a hotel that clears the head (it's just round the corner from the wild and chaotic Colosseum - on the wonderfully named Via Capo D'Africa), it's a jewel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but a few chinks”
Reviews.Author: Varunnayyar
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is fabulous. 5 mins walk from Colosseum and rest of ancient city... The hotel was good till one night we realised that water was dripping continuously from our AC. Next day we found out that our friend had water coming out from shower cublicle and making the bathroom wet. We complained and issues were taken care of. But then i met couple of other families (a Chinese and American) who had issues with their toilets... The breakfast was decent but lacked eggs which we had gotten so used to eating at every other place we stayed at across Italy. They dont have tea/ coffee kettles in the room and for your bed tea i had to go all the way to breakfast room... The staff were good but i think they need to do periodic maintenance of this place and change a few things around.

Reviews.Title: “location is great”
Reviews.Author: wtravelerAtlanta
Reviews.Content: we stayed in this hotel for 4 days and we found the staff very friendly and helpful. The location of this hotel is very good and walking distance to the coloseum and many other sites.

Reviews.Title: “Very personal feel to this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: MrsT2005
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights and loved this "hotel". While it is considered a hotel, the service made it feel more like a bed and breakfast. The owners and staff were always available for directions and recommendations. We booked a room on the 6th floor and had a huge balcony with lush foliage and an amazing view of the colosseum! When we weren't touring the city, we spent our time out there. Breakfast was delicious. Very fresh and plentiful. Location was an easy walk to the colosseum and other sites. Would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel and location!”
Reviews.Author: Megan M
Reviews.Content: We had a spacious room, with a view of the colosseum, for our family of 5 - children aged 14, 12 and 8. The staff was very helpful and the breakfast was delicious. Location was excellent, surrounded by parks, and just steps to the colosseum and great restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Deserves its rating..”
Reviews.Author: KAKABURA
Reviews.Content: We booked on the basis of the high rating in TA. Warm welcome, very professional staff. Excellent service, Decent rooms and perfect location. one really cant ask for more. The staff was ever helpful and perhaps the main reason for their high rating, particularly thank Micheal for his excellent advise and promptness. Will stay here again next time in Rome

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: birdwlfd
Reviews.Content: We stayed here at the end of a two week trip to Italy. We arrived with a rental car which we intended to turn in as soon as we got rid of our luggage. We found the hotel but there didn't seem to be any parking. There is a lot in front but it is gated and locked. We parked on the street and hauled our luggage a couple of blocks. If you wanted to bring a car you would have to make sure they do allow you to park it in the gate as there isn't much on-street parking. The hotel is very nice. Lots of American's staying there. We had a room that accommodated our family of four. We had a nice balcony with a view of the Colosseum. We found the staff to be very nice and accommodating. The room was air conditioned which was nice given that it was extremely hot. We ate at the hotel one night. The food was good. Our daughter has a nut allergy and could not ate what was on the set menu so they made her a separate meal which was very nice of them. The staff was very good about getting taxis and answering questions. We did have a problem that the people in the room next to us kept banging on our wall and telling us to be quite and then called the front desk to complain about us. It was only 8 o-clock at night and we were only talking at a normal volume. We could hear any of our neighbors so I don't think the walls were thin. The location was good. You could walk to the Colosseum and the forum and there were a number of little cafes around to eat at.

Reviews.Title: “Quite the treat on a quiet street!”
Reviews.Author: Nhiker
Reviews.Content: Hot shower, great air conditioning, friendly and kind owners and staff (so patient with my questions and so helpful in their answers), a personal atmosphere, good food (breakfast buffet and served dinner). The hotel is located on a quiet street within easy reach of the metro, many bus lines, the Colosseum, and some very good gellato.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mangustena
Reviews.Content: I stayed 4 nights at Lancelot in June 2011. The rooms are clean but tiny, especially the bathroom. You could basically sit on the toilet, wash your hands and have a shower all at the same time. For the price I expected more, but maybe this is the Rome standard. I haven't been at other hotels in Rome to judge. Someone in the previous review mentioned that her husband couldn't fit in the shower cabin and I laughed - what an exaggeration! Well, when I saw it with my own eyes, I knew the woman was not kidding. I am a size 6(US)/40(EU) girl and I had to be very careful in there not to bump my elbows against the walls when taking a shower! The breakfast was OK, nothing special. The location was good, but it is a little bit out of the way from the main attractions other than the Colloseum and the Roman Forum. In the mornings I would take a bus to wherever I needed to go, because time was of the essence but I would usually walk back in the evening. I think it took maybe an hour or a little bit more to walk from most touristy places. The staff is helpful in letting you know which bus to take and you can buy a bus ticket at the reception. The view was to the inside courtyard in my room, and this is the same for most room, from what I could surmise. What came as a surprise to me is that there are no facilities for Ironing at this hotel. You have to pay a laundry service to do it for you and the prices are not small, either. I don't remember exactly. I think it was something like 3 Euro for a shirt. And then you have to give your stuff for ironing no later than 6 pm or something and, of course, they are closed on weekends. Ridiculous. I found out later that ironing is a problem in Italian hotels generally. Apparently having irons in rooms is prohibited by law, but in all other hotels I stayed at in other Italian cities, the hotels allowed you to do the ironing yourself for free at a designated "ironing room". In some, they even brought the iron and the ironing board to the room, so I think Hotel Lancelot could also arrange at least something, if they wanted to. As for noise - I could hear everything that was going on in the hall like it was happening in my room, so if neighbors were noisily returning - I heard all of it. Usually not much noise was coming from the courtyard. I could also hear water running in the next door room

Reviews.Title: “I loved the terrace!”
Reviews.Author: Daniel R
Reviews.Content: Very friendly staff and a goof location. We have stayed at more central locations in Rome but the room we had here beat everything I've ever stayed at. Comfortable, clean and cozy. Best of all were our balcony though. We stayed at the 6th floor and had our own terrace with .a view of the colosseum. The breakfast was good too, not perfect but certainly above average.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay with a great staff”
Reviews.Author: James D
