Reviews.Content: Stayed at Hotel Lancelot with my two children while visiting Rome. So much to say, bottom line - great location, clean rooms, and an awesome staff!! Will definitely stay there again when we return (our coins are in the Trevi fountain). Highly, highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “re review by soalandyR”
Reviews.Author: margsalady
Reviews.Content: I was amazed to read this review and the comments about breach of security. I have been a regular visitor to this hotel for nearly 20 years and have never had any reason to question the security of the rooms, honesty of the staff or cleanliness. What puzzles me is the fact that this so called breach of security does not appear to have been reported to the management. There is always a member of the Khan family on the premises, who I am sure would have called for an immediate investigation of a complaint of this nature. As for the dust in the room, again I find this too, difficult to understand as the rooms are thoroughly cleaned every day. It's such a pity that instead of writing negative comments on Trip Advisor the person concerned didn't feel able to take the matters up with the owners. My experience at the Lancelot has always been one of a very warm reception, staff who are more than willing to go the extra mile and food that is a delight to the palate.

Reviews.Title: “good value and friendly atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: harissa47
Reviews.Content: always stay here when in Rome great hospitality free working wifi good breakfast depending on which room you get they are good size. small bar

Reviews.Title: “Felt very comfortable here.”
Reviews.Author: Dianaleeb
Reviews.Content: Great location a block from the Coliseum in a nice neighborhood. Hosts were personable, hospitable and helpful. Breakfast was great. Enjoyed the dinner as well. Large room was comfortable for our family. Bathroom was adequate. The pillows were flat but I slept well. I wouldn't hesitate to return. Enjoyed the bar, garden, and lobby areas as well.

Reviews.Title: “Warm, terrific, highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: regmorrow
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Lancelot is warm, friendly, helpful. During the breakfast (included) we felt relaxed, invited to visit with other guests, and ate delicious food until we were fully charged for a day of adventure. There were several sitting rooms of various sizes off the main lobby including a lounge and garden patio. We were able to spread out, read books available to guest and browse through the guest book full of compliments. The staff was very knowledgeable and helpful. we felt safe and secure. While we were invited to have dinner there, we also had wonderful choices of a variety of establishments within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and would highly recommend it”
Reviews.Author: regmorrow
Reviews.Content: The cozy atmosphere was terrific. The breakfast buffet setting invited guest to relax, mingle with other guests and eat until full. There were several small and medium sitting rooms off the main lobby nicely deocrated; books to read, guest book to sign, a garden to have a cocktail in. Security was terrific. While guests had a choice to dine in for dinner or not, there were close great places to eat and taverns to visit. The staff was very freindly and helpful. There wer three of us yet the room was spacious. All this for a great price. It was a warm retreat during a very hectic vacation. Lots to see in Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Nice, convenient, good staff - getting a bit dowdy however”
Reviews.Author: phrank
Reviews.Content: I booked two rooms with the Hotel. It is very quiet even though it is ca 10 min walk to the coliseum. The staff was mostly friendly, the rooms of reasonable size. Parking was available which was good as we are doing a driving trip. It is near some good restaurants (avoid the Irish bar down the street however due to mediocre food and bad service). The hotel probably needs some renovations to cover pealing paint and some faded exteriors. The price was a bit high but not extreme compared to higher end Roman Hotels. Really a bit of peeling paint and a wee bit pricey are the only things that knocks it down from a low Excellent to a very solid Very Good.

Reviews.Title: “OK but not great.”
Reviews.Author: VQC
Reviews.Content: This is the end our 26 days in Rome. Many positive reviews are deserved for service and public rooms. The location is not bad, but after 6 days in Rome, next time I would prefer stay closer to the middle of the main attractions. There are bus lines and Metro near by, so you can get around OK. Our room was very small and need some updating. I guess the antique dresser was nice, but the bath was very small and only one night stand and one trash can for 3 people. No small refrig in the room (bummer!), but this was actually the first only hotel to offer us a bucket of ice which is standard in USA. Breakfast was pretty good, but I didn't care for their yogurts and they need to offer more of a variety of breads. Great almonds and walnuts! Flower and candy baskets were delivered to us from back home celebrating our 25 wedding anniversary during our stay. The hotel did acknowledge and sent up champagne! I can understand why many people like this place, but when we return to Rome, I plan on find another place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel: location, staff, service. Definitely went above and beyond for us.”
Reviews.Author: NYUGatorG
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to Italy for a wedding, and it was a nightmare of a trip...except for the Hotel Lancelot. We stayed here the day we arrived to Rome and they had our room ready late morning, which was perfect because we needed a nap after our red-eye flight. The breakfast was nice in that it was the typical Italian/European breakfast but with healthy options (e.g., a Fiber One like cereal!). We enjoyed our stay and decided on the spot to re-book the hotel for our last night in Italy. I wish we would have realized our first night just how helpful this hotel could be. We arrived for our second stay and told them about our nightmare trip, and they told us to go to our room (which had a terrace) and they sent us a bottle of prosecco. They then recommended a great restaurant that was around the corner, which was perfect because we were exhausted and just wanted good food that was close by. What was our nightmare you might ask? Read my blog post as you may want to be prepared when you go to Italy. (www.secondtuesdayusa.com I skipped a few details to not publicly upset anyone!) Anyhow, the hotel staff also parked our rental car in their tight parking spot because we were so afraid of getting into another accident. They also said they had a GPS we could have borrowed. If only we knew on day 1. Anyhow, I am so thankful for this hotel. We really felt taken care of.

Reviews.Title: “Stone's throw from the Colloseum - small and very comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: ABZPT
Reviews.Content: Friendly and helpful staff always smiling and ready to assist. Very central. Clean and comfortable rooms. Nicely decorated. Only drawback I can think of is the smallish breakfast and the price level which can be on the expensve side (but this depends on what price you can land it for). Overall highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Down the street from the Colosseum!”
Reviews.Author: wloo_andrew
Reviews.Content: What a great location -- the Colosseum at the end of the street! The hotel is on a very quiet sidestreet with a gated entrance. Within walking of the Colosseum and the Forum as well as the metro and the Monument to Vittorio Emanuele II. It's a charming hotel with a tiny lift. The windows and shutter blocked any noise from the street. Staff were very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent hotel close to the Colosseum, with great service”
Reviews.Author: Flenser
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Lancelot for several nights during a very hot week in Rome. The air conditioning and comfortable beds made it a joy to return for a siesta after a morning of touring. We had planned on having two rooms, but an illness in the family necessitated changing to a single quad room. The staff were very understanding and switched our reservation without any hassle. The quad is quite large and comfortable, with a nice balcony and a partial view of the Colosseum. The staff was extremely helpful in the usual things like summoning taxis and recommending restaurants, even steering us away from one that was known to have ripped off tourists in the past, but they went above and beyond in helping us retrieve an iPhone that we had left in our Florence hotel. The only downside was that we once had to request that our tub be cleaned, as it clearly hadn't been, and the tub drain is very slow so you end up in shin-deep soapy water at the end of a shower. Those are minor issues, however, that don't stop me from highly recommending the Lancelot.

Reviews.Title: “Good place close to Collisseum”
Reviews.Author: shvarz
Reviews.Content: Pros: Decent size room and bathroom, very friendly and helpful staff, excellent breakfast with yogurts, croissants, smoked salmon etc, safe in a room, electrical outlets fit american plugs. Cons: bathroom could have been a bit cleaner, a bit noisy at night and can hear your neighbors.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for Americans!”
Reviews.Author: shirley61
Reviews.Content: Everyone at this hotel is fluent in English, the rooms are of decent size, breakfast includes American coffee and fresh fruit. Close to metro, closer to colosseum and within walking distance to nearly all sites.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay for our first visit to Rome.”
Reviews.Author: GreekamericanMom
Reviews.Content: It is NOT so easy to find a quad room (for our family of 4) in Rome. I had been on TA to find a hotel for our stay in Rome and found the Hotel Lancelot. Later, I also found it in Rick Steve's Rome guide. We are currently staying here and check out tomorrow. We are in room 10 which would be the second floor (for the Americans). The best thing about our room after the cleanliness of our room, the excellent water pressure of our shower, the nice huge towels, would be our huge terrace. We face a quiet street (and don't notice the mentioned garbage trucks), and our terrace is a wonderful place to go and enjoy a glass of wine. Our family would absolutely stay here again. The front desk staff is always very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant overall, breakfast inconsistent”
Reviews.Author: greenrock7
Reviews.Content: The rooms were not flash, but adequate in size and clean with reasonably comfortable bedding. My only surprise was that our toilet had a large crack right across one section of the seat. The front office staff are just lovely and extremely calm under pressure, despite the constant flow of travellers in and out of the hotel each day with their multiple questions. The service staff however, looked slightly harassed. Perhaps a little overworked and they might benefit from having more hands on deck. The breakfast was a bit hit and miss. On our first morning, the majority of guests came down at once, ready for their day tours and the breakfast room was chaos, hard to find a seat, slow to clear breakfast plates and low on food choices. However, on other mornings it was a much more pleasant experience with a good selection of foods. As we found often in hotels in Italy, the coffee was not great. The local coffee bars are better if you prefer a proper cappuccino. But, I did like that plain hot milk was available on tap in the breakfast room to mix into the coffee or chocolate to make it more to my liking. The location of the hotel was close to the Colloseum and Roman Forum which was good for sightseeing. Via Capo d'Africa is a quiet one way street even though it is very central, and it is was nice to retreat to the hotel at the end of the day's activities. There were some very nice restaurants in the area and the staff made some excellent suggestions for our dinners. As our trip went on however, we seemed to gravitate more toward Piazza Navona and Campo di Fiori because we were attracted to the bustle there. These places were only a 25 minute brisk walk. We might consider looking at accommodation over there for a different experience next time. Overall, I liked this hotel. It is a good solid middle of the range hotel with a warm feel.

Reviews.Title: “Great towels, clean rooms, fantastic service!”
Reviews.Author: vanaenae
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Lancleot on the recommendation of friends. I was worried that it would be too far from other attractions except for the Coliseum and we would be too worried about safety walking home from the metro late at night. We ended up loving the place. The rooms were a good size and they put us right next door to each other - almost as good as adjoining rooms. The staff was extremely helpful and courteous. We liked the breakfast - took my teenage daughters awhile to get used to all of the meat and cheese at breakfast, but everyone was able to find something they liked. The round tables were nice to be able to talk with other guests about their travels. We had dinner one night at the hotel and it was excellent. We sat with people fom ireland and Seattle, WA. You really glean a lot of infomation from other travelers this way. My only complaint was the fan in the bathroom took awhile to turn off after you turned the lights out. The Lancelot is about a 10 minute walk to the metro station - right by the Coliseum. Lots of restaurants, a couple of beautiful churches, small grocery store, bank, shoe repair - all close by! Take the hotels recommendations for restaurants as we went to one that they didn't recommend and the service and attitude was horrible.

Reviews.Title: “a great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: islandervne
Reviews.Content: +excellent service. good recommendations for restaurants and eager to give detailed answers your questions. +3 grocery stores nearby. +automatic laundry a 15 min walk (you can ask the front desk for directions) +5 min walk from the Coloseo subway stop +great italian style breakfast with a nice selection and fresh juice! +free wifi in your room +good size room for what we've seen in italy only slightly negative thing is that the soundproofing is not great between the rooms. the service is fantastic and i highly recommend staying here if you want to be near ancient rome!

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back at end of July”
Reviews.Author: jfoshed
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hotel Lancelot at the beginning of our six-week summer in Italy. The hotel is lovely, clean and comfortable, and the staff are so welcoming and helpful. The location is terrific - walking distance to the Colosseum and Forum (and the metro station) and steps away from a bus stop to take you anywhere in the city. The breakfast is delicious, varied and plentiful. And the tea is pre-brewed and comes out scalding hot! (Might seem like a small thing, but for a tea drinker used to putting lukewarm water on Lipton tea bags - this was a huge plus). We also ate dinner at the hotel our first night, since we were tired from the long trip over. The food was very good and the courtyard is a lovely place to eat. We're coming back at the end of our trip with the kids this time, and we can't wait!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: cz2
Reviews.Content: Everything you read is true and then some.....This is a wonderful hotel. We ended our trip to Italy with two nights in this hotel and it was truly a wonderful way to finish a trip. The staff and family who own the hotel are gracious and accommodating (from restaurant suggestions to arranging transportation to the airport). If you have an opportunity to have dinner here you should plan on this for at least one night! The food and conversation was excellent. Our room was on the 6th floor and we had an amazing terrace with a view of the city and the Coliseum. Thank you to the Khan family for such a wonderful hotel and your hospitality. .

Reviews.Title: “The secret's getting out!”
Reviews.Author: Charla
Reviews.Content: This is the best sort of "find" - one that the "regulars" regret is becoming widely popular. (We met some of them at the hotel's complimentary, extensive breakfast!) No wonder - this place has it all - great location; large-for-Europe rooms; shiny, updated bathrooms ; and a welcoming staff and owners who made us feel totally at home. FYI: there is a Carrefour Express, which is a small grocery store, located two long and two short blocks from the hotel. The prices are very reasonable, especially considering you're shopping in an urban center. We bought enough wine, cheese and crackers to put together a very nice "Happy Hour" in our room.

Reviews.Title: “This is a WONDERFUL hotel!”
Reviews.Author: KellyDH01
Reviews.Content: My sister, myself, and my Mom took off on a Mediterranean Holiday (leaving husbands and family behind). Our first stop was Rome. We corresponded with the Lancelot Hotel via email from the US for many months prior to our trip. Our emails were answered quickly and everyone was very helpful. When we arrived at the hotel we were shown our room and had a great view of the city. The room was very nice and the bathroom was a nice size. The hotel is within walking distance of the Colleseum and the city bus. The hotel also offers a great breakfast in the morning as well as a dinner at night (dinner is an added cost, but well worth it). The dinner meals were delicious and allowed for lots of great conversation with other guests as well as the owners. Dinner and the conversations were a highlight of our stay at Hotel Lancelot and Rome. We would definately stay here again if we ever get back to Italy.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay!”
Reviews.Author: Cubsgirl1
Reviews.Content: We stopped in Rome on our honeymoon and splurged on the honeymoon suite with the incredible view. I almost didn't want to leave the room, it was so great. They brought us champagne and a welcome note upon arrival. They helped us with countless questions about the city. The service here was great. Breakfast was also great, a little something for everyone, and last but not least, I loved the location...walking distance to most sites. We were only there for 4 days, and given there are 60+ rooms, I was amazed at how it felt like I knew the staff when I was there. I would definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: ALF069
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this lovely hotel for three nights in May 2011. There is nothing to dislike about this hotel. The rooms were comfortable, spacious and clean. The staff were friendly and helpful and spoke English which was useful. The location just behind the Colosseum was excellent and handy for walking to most sights in Rome. The breakfast was fantastic too. Highly recommended hotel and if we are ever in Rome again we would not hesitate to return.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy hotel, fantastic location!”
Reviews.Author: Nisha14
Reviews.Content: This hotel is down the street from the colosseum in the ancient city. We dealt with many people at the front desk and all were very helpful, suggesting sights and booking tours for us. The breakfast was tasty but took forever to be replenished once eaten by the hordes of people that were always in the breakfast room. The rooms were a decent size, although the bathrooms are tight. The cleanliness is a bit questionable, I made a bit of a sandy mess on the floor the first day and it was there during our whole visit.

Reviews.Title: “So very happy with our choice!”
Reviews.Author: gracieTucson
Reviews.Content: We selected the Hotel Lancelot based on the recommendations made in the current edition or Rick Steves' Italy guide. We went to their website and fell in love with the detailed photos of rooms and lists of not only what they offered, but what could be accessed within their vicinity. The guidebook and their webpage did not disappoint! Mrs. Khan and her amazing staff offered great communication prior to our trip and kindly set it up so that a driver would pick us up at the airport and deliver us to our oasis. Every question we had about getting from here to there (Vatican, Borghese Gallery, etc.) was warmly received and answered. They even have bus/metro tickets for sale to reduce your worries. One of the great things about the location of the Lancelot is that it is close to everything. It was right around the corner from various bus stops, metro and within 5 minutes of the Colosseum. A better location could not be had! The rooms were amazing. Bright, beautiful rooms, super comfy beds, lovely bathrooms. All kept impeccably neat and clean. The entry to the hotel has a lovely living room area for guests to gather, there is a lovely patio and the list of wonderfulness goes on and on. A very well stocked continental breakfast is included within your stay, providing much, much more than your average sweet roll and coffee. If you would like, there is also a delicious round table dining experience for a very reasonable charge (my husband and I took advantage of this on our first night in the city). We could not be happier with our choice of hotel! I highly recommend the Lancelot and know that you will encounter an amazing experience there!

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend!”
Reviews.Author: travelnut060
Reviews.Content: Hotel was within walking distance of the Colosseum and the tour bus lines, but on a quiet and safe side street. Excellent location! The rooms were clean and the staff was extremely helpful. Requested a wash cloth and it was brought immediately to our room. Although small rooms compared to American standards, we found them to be more than adequate since we did not spend our time in the rooms. The daily breakfast provided was wonderful and the company of the other hotel guests made it very memorable. The staff gave excellent recommendations for dining near by..we had wonderful homemade pasta and excellent seafood dishes. We also enjoyed ending the day in their bar or having a glass of wine in the garden. The bar staff was friendly and made us feel like we were family visiting. We did not eat dinner at the hotel, but the other guests were very complimentary of their evening meals. I highly recommend this hotel, and we would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: Nicolette1009
Reviews.Content: The Lancelot is ideally situated near the Colosseum, with nice restaurants in the area. The staff were very helpful and informative. The idea of having dinner available was very handy. The room was good size. The only minus factor is the fact that you could only get the news in English , considering how many English speaking guests stay in the hotel. After a long day of sightseeing, it is sometimes nice to come back and watch something on TV.

Reviews.Title: “Very Personal and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: dogwoodtravel
Reviews.Content: We loved the wonderful breakfast and dinners availabe at Lancelot. They were so helpful with guiding us to a travel agent to help arrange trains and other transportation. We will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel in heart of Rome”
Reviews.Author: cougpilot
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very homey, clean and has the most friendly staff. It is a five minute walk to the Coloseum. For a three star hotel, it is the best I have stayed in, and will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “It's not just the Location!”
Reviews.Author: emptynester5
Reviews.Content: Hotel Lancelot is easy walking distance to the Colessium, the Roman Forum and the Arch of Constantine with Metro, bus and taxi access to the rest of the great city or Rome. Built with the concept of the "round table" (hence the name), the small, family run hotel definitely caterers to travelors. Dinner is served nightly at 7:30 PM. Guests gather at several round tables where they share a delicious 4 course meal and wonderful conversation of their daily adventures with fellow travelors. The hotel is clean the rooms are attractive and the common areas are lovely and relaxing. For my wife and I, staying at this hotel made our visit to Roma that much more enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Classy elegance”
Reviews.Author: Phantom052
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Lancelot Hotel for three days in October, 2010 at the end of a Mediterranean cruise. The hotel was relatively small and located in a neighbourhood where ordinary people lived and was about five minutes walk from the Colosseum. We had our own terrace and each evening we would sit outside with a glass of wine and admire Rome's skyline and the Colosseum which was lit up at night. The room itself was typical for a European hotel (i.e. small) but it was quite cozy, clean and quiet. The owners were actually from England but worked at the hotel. The lady owner was very friendly and was a pleasure to deal with. The room service was great and the hotel offered a continental breakfast as part ot the room rate. The breakfast was quite good with lots of food choices. The hotel was situated where locals lived and we could walk outside to numerous restaurants to sample local fare. The hotel rate was not cheap (approx. $300 Cdn per night) but it was worth every cent and we will stay at this hotel every time we are in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Wonderful Staff”
Reviews.Author: brngckn
Reviews.Content: I picked Lancelot based on the reviews here on Tripadvisor. It's a very good hotel and the staff is genuinely helpful. They go out of their way to answer questions and give you information. You can even get your bus and Metro tickets at the front desk. The location is great! A couple of minutes from the Coloseum and bus stops; 10 minute walk to the Coloseo Metro station. The free wifi is so helpful when planning each days activities! Breakfast was fine, but I did find myself wishing for an egg after a couple of days. And, there seems to be only one person stocking breakfast and clearing plates in the breakfast room; it backs up some times. Our street side room had some street noise (primarily garbage trucks in the AM). We also experienced some noise from hallways and rooms above. Yes, some things are worn, but the room was bigger than I expected. Housekeeping was generally good. Room was quite clean. It was a little hit or miss with getting a full complement of towels and bath mat each day. Shampoo was never resupplied. Laundry service was pricey but done very well and very fast. The one thing I really didn't care for was the bi-fold bathroom door. It's really a pain to open from the inside if you have fingernails... There's no clock in the room, so pack one if you need it!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to stay while in Rome”
Reviews.Author: JandAEdmonton
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in the perfect location. It is walking distance from many of the historic sites. We chose a room that had a balcony and we are glad that we did. It had a wonderful private sitting area and a perfect view of the Colosseum. The staff are wonderful people and everyone spoke perfect English. We also chose the meal option and we where not disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Located close to Ancient Rome - Clean Inn”
Reviews.Author: garveyc
Reviews.Content: Although not a place that will blow you away, it provided a great breakfast with very clean rooms. Not a bad value for the money, and I definitely enjoyed the bars located along the street.

Reviews.Title: “Very Friendly and the location is excellent.”
Reviews.Author: Ricofisher
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Rome on a National Holiday. We had to walk from the Circus Maximus Metro which was quite a walk. Normally the Colliseum Metro is an easy walk but it was closed for the parade. When we arrived one of the owners had two glasses of ice water brought right out for us. Typical of their hospitality. For transportation they will call a cab and within 2 or 3 minutes one will pick you up for a fairly inexpensive fair. Buses and Metro are only a couple of blocks. Be careful on the Metro though, we were surrounded by gypsies and we were on the alert for the pick pockets but they still made a run at us. I suggest taking the train in from the Airport and catch a cab to the hotel. They have a small bar in the hotel and they do have a nice dinner at night for guests (7:30). We did not go but we heard that it was very good. Lot's of Americans at this hotel and everybody was quite happy with their lodging. Everybody looks forward to walking down to the Colliseum and Forum but also walk up the hill to a couple of the old churches in the Pilgrim area. They were very impressive and not nearly as busy as the major attractions. I used the close by ATM at night without a problem. It is a nice walk around the Colliseum as the sun goes down as well. Two grocery stores close by. Our room was very clean but only had a view of the courtyard. The bathroom and shower are quite small but overall we really enjoyed our stay. It is a safe area with lots of places close by to eat.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: macster03
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Lancelot on the recommendation of a friend and are so happy we did. The Hotel is in a fantastic location within minutes walk of the Coliseum and lots of great places to eat. The definite highlight of the hotel though is the staff and just how pleasant and accommodating they are. NOTHING is too much trouble. When we arrived there was a problem with the free WI FI in our room, a member of staff actually came up to my room to try to help me get the internet set up on my computer. It turned out that there was a problem with their server. I was phoned about an hour after they had first discovered the problem to keep me up to date with their progress on fixing it. I was offered to use their internet in the lobby free of charge while the problem was being fixed. They had the internet up and running within a couple of hours of me first raising it with them. Could not recommend this hotel highly enough. PS I paid extra to stay in a room with a private balcony and am so pleased I did, as we were in Rome for 4 nights it gave us a private area to sit and relax after a busy day sightseeing. However there are a lot of lovely sitting areas in the hotel

Reviews.Title: “Super hotel in Rome!”
Reviews.Author: Indysowners
Reviews.Content: The service at this hotel is excellent, so friendly and so helpful. Rooms are lovely, breakfast has enough choice to set you up for the day. We found lots of places nearby for food and drinks at reasonable value (unlike some of the places in tourist-ville). Great location. We would definitely stay again and recommend others to do so.

Reviews.Title: “If you are interested in Rome's history, you could't pick a better location”
Reviews.Author: TorontoEh
Reviews.Content: This was our 4th trip to Rome, and our 4 th hotel, and we would definitely return. We had a room with a terrace and a lovely view. The room itself was a little tired, although spotlessly clean, with every amenity in the washroom. There is air- conditioning, but it wasn't turned on when we were there as the government apparently regulates it's use in both May and October. There isn't a bureau, but that is pretty standard at non- chain hotels in Europe, and there are shelfs in the room you can use for your clothes. The staff were great. Breakfast was typical, and staff will brew you cappuchino if you ask.

Reviews.Title: “a comfortable and quiet stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: elbar
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to Rome and I picked this hotel based on reviews and location. I was very pleased with my choice. The hotel is located in a quiet, safe neighborhood within easy walking to the Colosseum and metro station. There are also bus stops within a few blocks. We easily got the hang of using the busses and could get anywhere in Rome with no problem. The neighborhood has quite a few decent restaurants as well as a small supermarket and a few gelato shops as well. The room we had was clean, good sized and faced a courtyard. My only problem with the room was that there was no dresser to put clothes etc in- only a closet which made it a little difficult to arrange our stuff. We had no trouble with noise and after being out in Rome all day it was nice to have a calm, quiet place to return to. There is even a small garden to sit and have a drink. The breakfast was good though not exceptional- rolls, cheese, cold cuts,yogurt, fresh fruit, cereal, and I happened to love the coffee. Most of the people we met at breakfast were like us, older retired folks having a wonderful time traveling . The outstanding feature of this hotel however is the wonderful staff. The front desk people were especially great. They are very helpful and patient with directions and helped us use the hotel computer to book tickets and tours. They made everything so easy for us. We enjoyed our trip to Rome very much and I would definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “It's almost like being at home, only better.”
Reviews.Author: Silverton_OregonKat
Reviews.Content: You can't find a hotel with friendlier owners and staff. We have been there twice and they have treated us like royalty both times. The hotel is very convienenty located, only 2 blocks away from the Colosseum, and most bus stops are only a minute or two away. we walked several times to the heart of the city and back. The staff is very knowledgeable about what busses and metro to take to get you anywhere, as well as reservations and special events. They will bend over backward to help you with anything. We originally found this hotel in one of Rick Steves' guidebooks, and he really believes in what he writes. Guess what? He checked into the hotel the day before we left. The rooms are nice and very clean, but not plush if you are so inclined. We love the wonderful dinner option and the continental-buffet breakfast is very good. We love this place and the people and would go back again and again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel and friendly staff in a great location”
Reviews.Author: MasonNHfamily
Reviews.Content: As we approached The Lancelot hotel via taxi, it was clear that we were in a great location - the Colosseum was just a couple of blocks down the road from the hotel. In fact, we could see part of the Colosseum from our room's balcony! The room was clean and neat, the hotel was nestled on a quiet side street, but the best and most memorable feature of the hotel was the exceptional staff. Annalisa, who usually was at the front desk, was just great at helping us get oriented, providing us with maps, bus passes, and advice - always with a friendly smile. We had the good fortune of also meeting Faris, the hotel's chef, who was very knowledgeable of Roman history and most graciously spent quite a bit of time with us, explaining local artifacts of historical interest, and giving us some great 'insider' tips on what to see and do. After long days of extensive walking around Rome's historic district, it was great to come back to the quiet and charm of our hotel. While we will certainly remember Rome for all of its historical features, we will also fondly remember the Lancelot, its wonderful staff, and the warm hospitality we experienced there.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in great location close to Colosseum”
Reviews.Author: OlgaandFrank
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with our families when we got married in Rome in August 2010. It is the perfect location for a group with children and for sightseeing as it is close to two parks and the Colosseum. It is in a quieter area of Rome yet it is still close to the main attractions and has plenty of restaurants nearby (including the wonderful Naumachia!). The hotel itself is great value and has a lovely reception/lounge area for guests to meet and chat. The staff are very helpful and friendly. We will definitely stay here again on our next trip to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Made our trip to Rome great!”
Reviews.Author: mckinfam
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed for 6 nights at Hotel Lancelot in a large quad room with our two children (ages 23 and 19). We arrived early on a Monday morning (utilizing the hotel's shuttle service from the airport for 50 euro) and although our room wasn't ready yet, they offered us their buffet breakfast (breads, cheeses, meats, cereal, yogurt, fruit, coffee, tea and juices). We bought our Roma Passes at the front desk (cash only) and were able to tour the Coliseum until our room was ready. Unfortunately, there was a mix-up with the previous occupants of the room we reserved and we had to stay in another room for a couple of hours and then switch to our room (quad with large terrace), but it was no big deal. The bathroom was a decent size in our room and there were always plenty of towels, soap, etc. for the four of us. Everything was clean and comfortable. Our room was air conditioned and quiet and we all agreed that the beds were comfortable. I agree with previous posters that the best part of our experience at the hotel was the helpfulness of the staff. We were also able to purchase bus/metro tickets at the front desk and they kindly made a dinner reservation for us also. We were always glad to return to the Hotel Lancelot after our long days of sightseeing and I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: Florida-Images
Reviews.Content: I booked all my Italy hotels based on location and Trip Advisor reviews. Hotel Lancelot is in a very good location if wanting to stay near the Coliseum and the Roman Forum. The room is clean, but generally average with the basic amenities. I did try the included breakfast but it wasn’t very good and the coffee was undrinkable compared to the espresso options you find all over the city. But where this hotel shines and impresses is in the customer service of the staff. We’re fairly independent when traveling and don’t ask for much help but the staff here went way above to provide information and help whenever they could. The unfortunate side is that this was our first stop in Italy, so my subsequent hotel reviews reflect comparisons to this higher standard. I would definitely recommend Hotel Lancelot primarily for location and staff.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Lancelot is perfect.”
Reviews.Author: sanritch
Reviews.Content: Hotel Lancelot is centrally located to the Colisseum, Roman Forum, Palantine Hill, Pantheon, and many other sights of Rome. We walked almost everywhere. It's close to the bus and metro. The owners and staff are wonderful as are the rooms and cuisine. There is a lift and many rooms have balconies. I very highly recommend this hotel to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Lancelot - A very special (k)night”
Reviews.Author: KristiJoe
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in swanky hotels, but none of them have provided the helpful, welcoming and special services that Faris and Lubna Khan provided. When we booked, we told them we were celebrating our 25th anniversary, and would like Room 62 with the garden terrace. Although they initially indicated the room was unavailable, upon checking in we were ushered into Rm 62, complete with complimentary prosecco chilling on the terrace. This was over the May 1 Pope John Paul beatification weekend, and I am sure they could have rented the room out several times over at a much higher rate. Dinner at the "round tables" was a hoot, and Faris entertained us ith funny stories about the hotel and his life in Rome. They did a special celebratory dessert for our anniverary, and the next day Faris insisted on giving us yet another bottle of prosecco.Room 62 is elegantly furnished, quiet, equipped with a good bed and the terrace was big enough for a small dance floor. However, be aware the bathroom is very tiny, even by European standards, but functonal. The room, terrace, location and service more than make up for the small bathroom. This was our fourth trip to Rome, and the nicest hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A Pleasant Place”
Reviews.Author: DandDToronto
Reviews.Content: The small, plainly furnished sixth-floor room with a tiny bathroom, was made attractive by the lovely balcony. The common areas, such as the reception and bar, were very pleasant in their decor and atmosphere. The hotel was quiet and the staff helpful and attentive; particularly Francesca and Annalisa. Disliked the breakfast (a matter of taste, I know) which was unimaginitively Italian. A few times, dishes had not been properly washed and coffee ran out. Sufficiently unattractive that we never seriously considered eating dinner there. Although the location of the hotel is a bit shabby, it's quite safe and, for Rome, quiet. No fine dining but lots of restaurants in the area that were fun to visit with excellent service.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific hotel choice”
Reviews.Author: tbbbnbab
Reviews.Content: We chose the Lancelot based on good guest reviews on this site (and others), and we were very pleased with our choice. The location is good, just down the street from the Colosseum and the Forum, with easy acces to bus routes and subway lines. The room was very nice for our family of four, with big windows and a modern bathroom. Wifi in the room was great. All areas of the hotel are attractive and clean. The best feature of this hotel was the staff..all very friendly and helpful, with great advice on restaurants, travel around town, and always eager to make reservations or other arrangements. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel - Will stay again”
Reviews.Author: lannacombe
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a Birthday and Anniversary treat and booked the Suite overlooking the Colosseum. From arrival the Staff were fantastic. Even got a free water(Ice and Lemon as well) as we checked in!! Went up to a fantastic room with a view (not Florence But???) Free bottle of sparkling wine then arrived. Great place..Great Location..Great people..Would stay there next and everytime we go to Rome. Restaurants in the area around the hotel were fantastic..Need to go back tomorrow!

Reviews.Title: “Very, very plesant”
Reviews.Author: Final-Focus
Reviews.Content: After some research (including Tripadvisor) we chose Hotel Lancelot and I'm glad we did! We had one of the larger rooms because we were traveling with our 9 yr old twins. The room was spotless, the common areas of the hotel were spotless, the food totally satisfying - we ate dinner at the hotel one evening and the food was delicious! A view of the Colosseum from our balcony, nearby restaurants, parks, the Forum, the Colosseum... very , very plesant. The staff spoke English and were very helpful. A five star experience.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel -- friendly helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: lynfo16
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed here for 5 nights with my college age child who is studying abroad in Italy this spring. Lovely room, helpful staff, and quiet location despite being very near to the Coliseum. Excellent breakfast and delicious dinner in a beautiful dining room.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel and Great Location”
Reviews.Author: LFeger
Reviews.Content: Hotel Lancelot was the perfect hotel to stay at in Rome. It was 2 blocks away from the Coloseum. It had a lot of great restaurants in walking distance from the hotel and we were able to walk to all the main attractions from the hotel. The staff was very friendly. The breakfast was good and the rooms were very clean. I really enjoyed this hotel and would go back here for sure!

Reviews.Title: “First Class Wedding Accommodation and Reception”
Reviews.Author: Afegan
Reviews.Content: On booking our wedding for Rome Dec 2010 a colleague was very quick to recommend Hotel Lancelot for our accomodation and reception, having had his own there. I couldnt recommend this hotel highly enough. From our first email of enquiry right through to checking out the hotel staff were truly magnificent, I have to personally mention Annalisa, who was very friendly, professional, she even booked a hairdresser for the morning of my wedding, by the end of the week spent in Hotel Lancelot Annalisa felt like a friend. No problem was too much for the staff, directions, booking taxis, advise on restaurants changing reservations etc. Our wedding reception was made very special by the hotel staff, food was amazing and the special wee touches to detail made it magicial!! The accomodation was perfect, the rooms were oldy wordly which we loved, exceptionally clean, attended to every day with new towels and bed linen. as soon as one of our guest arrieved at the hotle she said "this is really homely" which I think is a lovely compliment for Hotel Lancelot. I can not stress how much I would recommend Hotel Lancelot, its location beside the Colosseum, the staff, the rooms and general atmosphere are MAGNIFICENT!! it wil always have a special place in my heart having had our wedding reception there. We will definitely be back to visit.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for comfort, friendliness and value”
Reviews.Author: SKItourists
Reviews.Content: What a pleasure to stay here! Wonderful location beside the Colosseum. Excellent range of public transport on hand. Fine range of bedrooms -ours was on the 4th floor and cosy. There are bigger ones at higher prices, but cosy is not a criticism. Do try to avoid the front of the hotel if you prefer not to hear the 5 minute Roman refuse collections at 6am! BUT this hotel is not on a busy road and is otherwise really quiet. The Khan family and staff are kind, gentle amusing and helpful people -even when they are asked for the '000nth time how to get to the Vatican or wherever. We have rarely encountered such professional yet warm people in any hotel. Breakfast is excellent -as I gather is the dinner. We however ate out nearby at several restaurants well recommended by the Khans. Would we return -of course and now we don't ever have to look for another Rome hotel. For what it is worth, quite by chance the travel correspondent of the Irish Times (one of Ireland's premier newspapers) told me that she always recommends the Lancelot. What more do you need to know!

Reviews.Title: “Fab! Fab! Fab!”
Reviews.Author: IlikeEngland
Reviews.Content: Hotel Lancelot I a FAB place to stay! I have stayed in many hotels in Europe (good and bad), but this must be my most favourite. It's in a great location (walking distance to the Colosseum). Staff are very friendly and helpful, but best of all is the food. Wow! this is what Italy is all about! Rooms are clean and very comfortable after a day's sightseeing you need a touch of luxury. Lancelot has got it.. There's a grand piano, beautiful flower arranements, which give it that extra ambience of romance. Prices are good too. I've stayed in more expensive hotels, but this is a much better deal I've tried to think of any negatives - but can't fault it! I will certainly be visiting again. Thankyou Hotel Lancelot.

Reviews.Title: “Happy New Year”
Reviews.Author: margsalady
Reviews.Content: Arrived 31st December to be warmly welcomed by Mrs Khan and Lubna. Enjoyed an evening reception with champagne, singer and musicians in the salon, followed by a gourmet meal where the entertainment continued until we went on to the terrace to watch fireworks and welcome in 2011. The celebrations continued in the lower salon where we danced the night away. There is always a member of the family on the premises and many of the staff have been there for many years, and the serviced they provide is second to none. The buffet breakfast is an excellent start to the day. We stayed in for the evening meal eac h night, personally prepared by Faris Khan, the meal includes wines and coffee and I doubt you could get value for money like this anywhere else in Rome. A wonderful holiday break.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to discover Rome”
Reviews.Author: suzeq614
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Lancelot for six nights with a group of friends. Can't say enough about how much I enjoyed my stay. The location is excellent for sightseeing. At the end of the street is the Colosseum and the Forum. The Basilica of San Clemente is a block away and one of the most interesting sites in Rome. The staff is friendly, and most helpful with directions, restaurant suggestions and general information. I look forward to someday staying at the hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful staff& great service in an adorable hotel with the perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: SupreetS
Reviews.Content: Location, location, location Getting to the hotel was very easy with the directions I found on their website. I knew from the site that it was close to the Colosseum , but I didnt realize itd be SO close to it! Staying at the Lancelot made seeing the sights of Rome very easy. It is so centrally located that I coul easily go back to the hotel, rest up and have a macchiato (which they make perfectly!) at the bar and head out for another adventure. The rooms are perfect and each one is unique ( I peaked my head into a few!) It gives the hotel a real authentic feel and a lot of character. The street is quiet at night making it easy to get a good nights sleep. Service First of all - I have never felt such a personal touch in a city hotel. The staff was very personable and helpful. They really know Rome and essentially helped me plan my trip day by day! The round table dinners in the evening are quite a treat & the food was delicious. I feel as though I really fell in love with Rome because of this Hotel. I willdefinitely visit Rome again I will be staying at the Hotel Lancelot without a doubt!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, fabulous front desk staff”
Reviews.Author: JDFOttawaCanada
Reviews.Content: We were very happy with our 6 day stay. The location is handy for walking and buses but quiet at night for sleeping. It felt safe. We highly recommend getting a terrace room, somehow makes you feel more part of the city. We can't say enough positive things about the staff on the front desk. They gave excellent and thoughtful dinner suggestions and seemed to appreciate any feedback we gave them. They were always patient about maps and bus tickets and schedules and were just overall pleasant and good humoured. The hotel arranged airport pickup worked well as did in-room internet. Breakfast was fine although they seemed understaffed, eg table clearing was often backed up. Providing a place to put your dishes after eating would help. We ate 3 of our 6 nights at a recommended nearby restaurant called Naumachia. It had great food and atmosphere. However there were many other choices of places to eat in the are as well.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: Beesleyd25
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Lancelot in October. The staff was amazing. Very helpful. The hotel is 3 blocks from the Colosseum. Our room as on the 4th or 5th floor that had a balcony. The balcony had a quiet bistro table with two chairs. Sitting out there in the evening was amazing and relaxing. You have the view of the Colosseum lit up at night with the soft background noise of the quiet local street (mostly a person or car from time to time. The hotel staff were very helpful is informing us which bus or metro we should take to get to our destination. They were also willing to make dinner reservations for us but we wanted to wander the streets of Rome and pop into any place we felt look quant. The breakfast buffet at the hotel had a range of items including; cereal, yogurt, fruit with cheeses and meats. Overall, I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: Paula522
Reviews.Content: Stayed here the first week of November with my husband and a small group of friends. Hotel is close to metro and bus stops and a stone's throw away from Ancient Rome. We couldn't stop looking out our balcony to see the Coliseum! The staff is extremely helpful making our stay a pleasure. Had pleasant evenings at the bar, very comfortable. The room was comfortable one suggestion, a ceiling fan would be helpful, it is warm in November and the A/C with fan only works in the summer. Had to sleep with the balcony doors open which is quite noisy early in the morning when the trash pickup starts.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: ValueTravler3
Reviews.Content: Great location to Coleseum and Forum. Close to all types of eating places. Close to public transportation and wonderful access to taxi's and hired drivers. Had room with private terrace for nomal fee upgrade. Room very spacious, bathroom modern but small. Since injured leg on trip, elevator very helpful. Staff totally service oriented, greatly helpful and so patient. Arranged pick up from port and tickets for Borgese Museum, all by email prior to our trip. Staff responed to all of my emails within 24 hours and many emails due to changes in travel plans. Neighborhood a bit run down, but hey this is Rome. Locked gate to hotel felt very safe in hotel and surroundings. Great value!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Place”
Reviews.Author: Woodinville_Wally
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Lancelot was recommended to be by a colleague from work. She had stayed there a few years ago. We decide to try it ourselves and found it to be a wonderful place to stay. The location, just 2-3 blocks from the Coliseum, is magnificent. It was a relaxing way to end the day by taking a walk around the Coliseum after dinner. We also took advantage of participating in the evening meal at the Hotel Lancelot. While the food was good, not great, the experience of meeting other traveler from all over the world was exceptional. We met folks 20-30 minutes from our home in Woodinville, WA (North-East of Seattle, WA) and have some new good friends from Vienna Austria. The conversation was very interesting and enlightening. The rooms and hotel was very clean and well kept. The small bar was a cozy, but always seemed to have some place to site and relax. Our room was very spacious and the bathroom was a very nice size. I didn’t feel cramped anyplace in the hotel. Probably the best part of the Hotel Lancelot was the staff; they had folks from ten different countries and were always willing to help you with any need you had. The helped with everything from free WiFi to detailed directions on how and where to catch a bus to get to the Vatican City and back. There were always willing to go out of their way to help. One gentleman, named Michael, who spoke eight different languages fluently, told us that “knowing a foreign language was like having a weapon without bullets.” Michael would help you with directions, serve you a beer at the bar, serve you dinner and fix the air conditioner. This guy was ALWAYS moving and helping the guests. Michael looked at the guests as part of his family and treated us that way. You may be able to find a cheaper place to stay in Rome, but I think that you would be hard pressed to find a better place to stay. Thank you Hotel Lancelot for a wonderful time in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely”
Reviews.Author: marsha60
Reviews.Content: This small hotel is located in a great area near the Roman Forum and the Colleseum. The personnel were extremely helpful. The beds were comfortable, the rooms clean and the atmosphere charming.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly and extremely helpful staff, room spacious & tastefully decorated”
Reviews.Author: Bake10
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at Hotel Lancelot. The location was fabulous...we could see the Colosseum from our room. The hotel catered for our young children with high chair and cot. The breakfast was delicious. Room was spacious and tastefully decorated. The highlight for us would have to be the friendly and helpful staff. We received great tips on traveling around Rome, places to eat and all of our requests were happily attended to. We highly recommend this hotel for families with young children.

Reviews.Title: “great place...”
Reviews.Author: sean-carey
Reviews.Content: the hotel lancelot was excellent. first of all, I have wanted to see the colosseum since I was a kid and hadn't made it to rome until now. the hotel is just a couple blocks from it and that is the first thing we did upon dropping off our bags. so I had a heckuva first impression. the people were all extremely nice and very helpful. they even had two roma passes that we were able to buy. once we got to our room that night, we stepped out onto our balcony and had a pretty amazing view of the colosseum from there. it's a quaint little hotel to which I would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location and great staff”
Reviews.Author: TxTraveler054
Reviews.Content: Recently completed a 3 night stay at Hotel Lancelot. Upon arrival we were offered one of the terrace rooms with a view of the Colosseum. Location is ideal - just blocks from the Colosseum. Breakfast and dinner were very good. When our shuttle to Tuscany did not arrive as expected, the staff were most helpful in making contact with our guide. Would definitely consider staying here again if I were to return to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: bairbre74
Reviews.Content: Clean, central hotel a few minutes walk from the colosseum with a number of lively restaurants in the surrounding streets. While it is on the far side of the colosseum from the other major sights in Rome, staff are very friendly and helpful and the hotel seems to be very popular. Very clean, and good value for Rome. Internet coverage was a bit patchy.

Reviews.Title: “The Lancelot Hotel-Rome "Big Texas Size Heart"”
Reviews.Author: RoyalCourtQueen
Reviews.Content: This is an unusual review due to some unfortunate circumstances. My husband and I booked a five night stay at the Hotel Lancelot in Rome through a booking agency on line. I won't mention the agency unless the issue is not favorably resolved. When we arrived at the hotel through a lovely lush green gated courtyard we were informed that we had no reservation in spite of our printed confirmation in hand. Well, It turned out that the agency admittedly in err booked us into the Hotel Lancelot in Spain not Rome. There was no availability with the Lancelot in Rome or elsewhere in the city because of a big convention. We spent hours on the Lancelot's phone to the booking agency and all around Rome. The really phenomenal element of this story is the Khan family and their staff. They supported us throughout the whole emotional search process and Mrs. Khan, in a quiet but in control way, shuffled something around and provided us a beautiful double deluxe room with a stunning terrace for that evening. Refreshed the next morning, we spent even more frustrating hours in the hotel's well appointed lobby with bags in tow until the Khan daughter miraculously located an absolutely incredible leasable nearby apartment for us. They even allowed us a very substantial breakfast with them in the mornings. They could have turned us away and said it was none of their concern but they showed incredible compassion to two travelers in need from Dallas, Texas. We will never forget them and highly recommend their hotel. It is beautiful, clean and well run. It’s always good to find that a property lives up to its description of itself. We found the location great - within walking distance of the Colosseo, the Roman Forum, public transportation and many great restaurants. Two Texans found a beautiful hotel in Rome run by a family with a heart as big as Texas.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location, pretty standard room”
Reviews.Author: DPT1
Reviews.Content: This hotel's biggest assets are its staff and its location. It is just a few blocks away from the Colosseum, Arch of Constantine, and the Forum, as well as bus and metro stops. The staff was exceedingly helpful in pointing us to the nearest ATM, making dinner reservations, and calling taxis, and they now sell the Roma Pass as well. They also coordinated our transfer from the airport to the hotel for €50; our driver was a pleasant man who pointed out several sights once we got to the city. They were also able to get us into our rooms early, which is such a bonus after a long transatlantic flight. I can merely imagine how glorious the sixth floor rooms with Colosseum views must be, because we stayed in a standard room that was truly nothing more than average. Ours overlooked the front courtyard/parking area, which meant that we were exposed to street noise such as garbage trucks and supply trucks and scooters at all hours of the night and morning. The bed was fine - I must like firm mattresses! - but the bath was a touch dingy. The water pressure is outstanding, I should point out. The rooms could stand to have an upgrade, to match the wonderful common areas. That being said, we didn't visit Rome to stay in our hotel room. It was a more than adequate place to rest and clean up before and after hours-long rambles throughout a magnificent city.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Dolphannut1313
Reviews.Content: We staying in this hotel for the last leg of our honeymoon just a few days ago(oct-6-9). It was a wonderful stay! Although I am not a fan of Rome the city, this hotel made the crowded and dirty city seem serene and peaceful. The staff went above and beyond for us during our honeymoon and the 6th floor double room terrace with a view of the Colosseum was spectacular. I can not recommend this hotel enough! There is no where else in Rome anyone should ever stay!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Golfer_Girlie
Reviews.Content: Location was the best part about this hotel. It is literally 1 block from the Colosseum and Forum. Very easy access to Metro and buses or you can walk to all the sites. The rooms are just okay - the bathroom was TINY but it was clean and the staff was very helpful. Considering the prices of other Rome hotels, this one is a great value. Just don't expect a luxurious room.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel in Great Location”
Reviews.Author: TexasYorkielover
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent hotel, within walking distance to the Colosseum, Forum, and Circus Maximus. The front desk staff speaks excellent English and all were very helpful. Dinner is wonderful, and we enjoyed visiting with the other guests at our table. The room was larger than others we have stayed in in Europe, with a very comfortable bed and an air conditioner that worked great! This was our first trip to Rome, and we depended on Trip Advisor reviews when making our hotel selection. As always, Trip Advisor was right on the money!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel Located near Colosseum”
Reviews.Author: JEMJNewJersey
Reviews.Content: If it is not your first time to Rome and you are revisiting. Lancelot Hotel is a great place to stay. I say this because it is near the Colosseum but not that close to other frequently visited sites. The rooms are spacious, clean and there is a lovely terrace with views. Staff is friendly and hotel common areas are lovely. If you call ahead they are likely to let you in if you have an early arrival.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Rooms; So-So Breakfast; Outstanding Staff”
Reviews.Author: KeithVA
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our 4-night stay at the Hotel Lancelot. We selected a room upgrade to a 6th floor terrace room. The bed and room were very comfortable but we particularly enjoyed the terrace. It was large and full of plants and if you looked down the street to the left you could see the Coloseum, the dome of St. Peter's and a small piece of the Vittorio Emanuele memorial. The only drawback to the terrace was that there was a terrace available to everyone in the hotel that was located between ours and the next room. Ocassionally, there were people sitting there smoking when we used our terrace. I didn't care for that. For the most part, the hotel and our room was clean, but there was a small carpet in our room that could have used vacuuming. The breakfast included cereal, breads, fruit, cold cuts, cheese, and cornetti. There was nothing great about the breakfast. It met your basic needs without any of the culinary excitement one normally finds in Italy. The front desk staff at the hotel were outstanding. They were friendly and went out of their way to help you with restaurant reservations, touring suggestions, and calling taxis. It certainly helped that they all spoke excellent English which allowed me to give my poor Italian a rest.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, amazing service”
Reviews.Author: cherrygrrl
Reviews.Content: I treated to my boyfriend to a trip to rome for his 30th and used trip advisor to select our hotel. I am glad we chose this hotel, it was centrally located whikst being down a quiet street. It was literally a stones throw away from the colessuem. The rooms where basic and grand at the same time and the matress was wonderfully firm. The hotel staff bought us a birthday bottle of proscetto which shows how this hotel goes for the personal touch. defo go there again

Reviews.Title: “Lancelot Staff Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: dcarefoot
Reviews.Content: Staff was one of the highlights - very accommodating and their command of English helped ease us into our first couple of days in Italy. Reasonably close to Metro and major bus stops and a short walk from the Coliseum, although everything wihtin ancient Rome we found was an easy walk. Rooms were clean, tidy and comfortable. When we returned to Rome a day early we opted to stay at the Lancelot again. It was a great first experience for Rome and Italy.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and easy stay”
Reviews.Author: GatronomicDelight
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel allows you to walk to the Collosseum and access the metro. In addition there are several small restaurants in the area. A small, delightful hotel tucked away on a small street. Excellent service during the booking on-line - friendly, helpful and responded very quickly. The breakfast included in cost of room was fine - basic, good options and convenient. We took a cab from the airport - arranged by the hotel for 50 Euro. Excellent service throughout our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Repreive from Chaotic Roma”
Reviews.Author: mrskChicagosuburb
Reviews.Content: We read reviews and chose the Hotel Lancelot and I am so happy that we did! We were 2 families traveling together and we began our journey in Rome. Our kids were so happy to see each other that they were loud into the early hours and may have disturbed guests (which we apologized to the LAncelot staff for)! We loved the staff, rooms were clean, food was good, we were in a safe environment. Next time we visit, we will be quieter! Thanks to the Hotel LAncelot staff for patience w/us.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and service!”
Reviews.Author: kimmat
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great! The location was excellent, within a five minute walk to the Colosseum and the metro station! The staff was very helpful and accommodating to our needs, they had no problem recommending restaurants and calling to make reservations. They helped us out in getting our clothes dry-cleaned, they were able to get an express job done for us over the weekend so that we would have them back on the day of our departure. The rooms were a nice size for being in the middle of Rome, and to the hotel's credit they had a properly functioning AC unit (very helpful in the middle of a heatwave!). The dinners were a good value and the round table service was a fun way to meet new people. I feel that the breakfasts had left a little to be desired, the fruit was not very fresh, the selection food was limited. It was really the only issue I had with the hotel. Hotel Lancelot was a great value and wonderful place to stay in the middle of Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel & staff”
Reviews.Author: CAdaytripper
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Lancelot after reading several positive reviews. The hotel staff are very helpful & courteous. Our triple room with corner terrace was nice but simply decorated, very quiet, comfortable, clean & had a lot of natural light from the large windows. The bathroom was small but functioned well. They had a universal plug which was nice for charging camera batteries, etc... We enjoyed the common areas & small library as well. The breakfast assortment and morning room was a perfect way to start our day. The hotel is very close to the Colosseum, cafes and markets. We bought a 2 day pass for the hop on/hop off bus to get to the other major sites easliy. We loved Rome's drinking fountains that we used to refill our water bottles.

Reviews.Title: “People in the know stay at The Lancelot when in Rome”
Reviews.Author: JMBR77
Reviews.Content: Myself and my Wife have stayed at the Lancelot many times and will continue to do so. It is right in the centre of Rome and just a short walk to the Coloseum, we always take a leisurely stroll to the main shopping centre, The Forum, Fountain of Trevi and Spanish Steps every time we visit. The Hotel is family run and reasonably priced. It has a lovely atmosphere and you are also made to feel extreemely welcome. The food is to die for! The Chef (the owners son) trained in France and Switzerland and it shows in the food. Every night the Menu changes and wine is included in the price of the meal. No one need feel alone in the Dining room as all the large tables are round, so everybody speaks to everyone (we have spoken to people from all over the world and have formed some lovely friendships). The rooms are spotless, all with ensuite bathrooms and the views from our balcony was lovely as we could see the Collosium. We always have such a lovely time and we would not hesitate to recommend the Lancelot to anyone looking to stay in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Arringtons
Reviews.Content: We found Hotel Lancelot in Rick Steves "Italy" and are so delighted that we stayed there! We were driving Italy, and the staff was so helpful in giving us directions--we drove directly there and parked right in the courtyard of the hotel. It is within sight of the Colosseum on a little side street--there is a great little reception area and a patio, as well. Especially I would commend the wonderful staff there--Mrs. Khan has hired the BEST people! Annalisa, Max, Francesca--just to name the ones we got to know. Rooms were spotless, comfortable. Breakfast was an occasion! We already know that we didn't have nearly enough time in Rome, and when we return, we will definitely stay at Hotel Lancelot.

Reviews.Title: “OMG”
Reviews.Author: jansjournal
Reviews.Content: As per every other review, this is such a find. Perfect in every way. Be sure to ask for a room with a flower terrace as its worth the supplement. Plus points, Location, staff, its clean, comfortable, its far better than the pictures would have you believe, high ceilings, decor, staircase, bar, outside dining... do you want me to go on? Negatives, as other reviews the bathroom was a little small and I loved it! TIPs Do book your first evenings meal at the hotel, for 25 euros you will have a treat (and wine) and get to meet other travellers. We picked up hints and tips that saved us time and money as well as having a wonderful evening. Do book the Vatican tour online. DONT JOIN THE QUEUE FOR ST PETERS IF YOU HAVE TICKETS FOR THE VATICAN A policeman told us to as he said everyone had to for a security check. YOU DONT. If you have already got your tickets online walk thru the city wall and up to the entrance to the museum. Our ticket was for 11.30 but they let us in at 10.15 and we went right to the front of the queue. The lines are crazy. I must repeat, do get your ticket online. We did ours the night before from the hotel. Once in the Cistine chapel leave by a door to the left NOT right. this will take you into St Peters and save more lines. Do go to the Colosseum early, dont bother with the audio guides take Rick Steve's book instead. Do buy the 48 hour pass on the 101 open top bus to get around. Do take a map, YOU WILL GET LOST. Do try the local restaurants/trattorias near the hotel. Great food and great prices.

Reviews.Title: “Third time here and we will be back”
Reviews.Author: Henruy
Reviews.Content: This was my third time bringing a small group to the Lancelot and it will not be the last. Quite simply there is no other place to stay in Rome. The location alone makes it ideal, but the staff closes the deal. Add to that the great breakfasts and charming rooms, and you have the only place to stay in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Best Service Ever!”
Reviews.Author: SchafG
Reviews.Content: Hotel Lancelot is a fantastic hotel. The service was phenomenal. The rooms were nice and the common rooms were really beautiful. Both the breakfast and dinners there were amazing. It is in walking distance from the Colosseum and the staff will help you use public transport to get everywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “I wouldn't stay anywhere else....”
Reviews.Author: Cmurphy17
Reviews.Content: We stayed in their top floor suite. It was fantastic. The room was good size for a European Hotel. Our 4 children had the Quad room and it too was perfect. We loved everything about the hotel, especially how helpful and pleasant the entire staff was. This was Hotel was one of the Highlights of our trip to Rome. While the location is not in the middle of Rome or some of the "action", it was only a few blocks from some of the major attractions and 5-10 minutes to anything else. There are plenty of bus stops 2 blocks away, so the peacefulness of the location was also a plus for a nice break. I can not recommend this hotel more.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Hotel in Great Location”
Reviews.Author: racheve
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hotel Lancelot in June with my parents and in-laws. The staff is wonderful and tries to help in every way possible. The hotel has a charming breakfast room with a nice assortment of free food in the morning. There is a courtyard where you can have a drink at night or eat dinner (we did not eat dinner there). The staff helped us with transport from the airport in Rome and museum reservations. They even let us borrow a hair straightner! The hotel is located literally down the street from the Collosseum. We toured all of Rome from this location and highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Lancelot - book it, don't hesitate, you will not be disappointed”
Reviews.Author: martinkenney
Reviews.Content: We came to The Lancelot to celebrate our 50th birthdays, having all met at school all those years ago. The Hotel is amazing. The staff and very friendly & extremely helpful. We chose to have a meal in the hotel on our first night. I would strongly recomend this as we got some great advice about rome from a lovely american couple we ate with. We stayed in a triple room (3 single beds) with a garden terrace. It was absolutely lovely. The decor, furnishings & attention to detail make this hotel a must. You will not be disappointed. It is a few minutes walk to the Colessuem & I would recommend the open top bus (110, red) Get a 48 hr pass & use it to get around all the famous sights in Rome. I loved everything about the hotel & couldn't fault it at all. FANTASTIC

Reviews.Title: “Great location, excellent service, worth the value”
Reviews.Author: fcparma19
Reviews.Content: My mom and I stayed at the Hotel Lancelot for 4 nights in June 2010. The location is fabulous (it is 5 minutes down a quiet residential street from the Colosseum and you can see the Colosseum from the rooftop terrace) and it is close to both metro lines and many bus routes. The staff and service was excellent-- they were friendly and gave great advice about transportation and restaurants. The breakfast, which was included, had a variety of food (yogurt, cereal, breads, meat, cheese, fruit).

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel”
Reviews.Author: 4adventure
Reviews.Content: After reading many glowing reviews of this Hotel, I booked it because I guessed the location would be quiet, and because it was near the Colosseum, and easy to walk back to for rests between excursions. The hotel more than lived up to the reviews. The staff always responded to emails & phone calls quickly, and graciously. There were a number of families with children and as well as couples traveling alone. I think this was one of the most comfortable hotels I have ever stayed in, and certainly the most comfortable one I have ever stayed at in Rome. Some of the really wonderful things I liked about it: 1. Clean, clean, clean 2. Good beds, but not plush, A/C. Nice bathrooms, small but comfortable rooms 3. All the important amenities: lobby wireless service, library room, tv room (as well as in room,) bar, patio, great breakfasts --also accommodated people with dietary restrictions, helpful staff 4. A warm atmosphere, friendly staff, that was pleasant to everyone, answering innumerable questions 5. The hotel is well staffed, but also very personal and unique 6. The option of eating dinner in the hotel at round tables with other guests 7. They also have a fantastic car service partner with wonderful drivers that speak English, and other languages. The service, for a trip outside of Rome is a bit expensive, but very comfortable, stress relieving, and time efficient. 8. Reasonable rates & one of the few quiet hotels in Rome Only small complaint: - the coffee was not Italian, kind of weakish The next time I need to stay in Rome, it will be at the Lancelot

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful experience!”
Reviews.Author: heretodaybut
Reviews.Content: My husband, college-age daughter and I spent a week in Rome at the Lancelot Hotel. We had a large triple room with a private patio that was spotlessly clean and comfortable. I had read some comments about the "small" bathrooms but we found ours more than adequate with great water pressure and big, fluffy towels. The best part of our experience was the warm, helpful staff who all spoke excellent English. They helped us with any request including airport pick-up, restaurant reservations, and scheduling a tour to Pompeii (which I recommend). They even went out of their way to provide us with an early breakfast on the day of our tour. We also enjoyed the beautiful public spaces available. This hotel is within view of the Colosseum, a lovely and safe area. Although it is true there is not a great deal of shopping or good restaurants close by we did find one excellent restaurant within walking distance, Ostaria Da Nerone, and ate there or in other areas of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing find ...”
Reviews.Author: gemgem76
Reviews.Content: As others have said, this is an oasis. We traveled with 3 kids (ages 4,6,15) and all were happy. Family Room was comfortable for all of us, breakfast was great (contrary to other reviewers!!) and the walking distance to great pizzerias, the Colosseum AND a neighborhood farmers market could not be beat. Staff was amazing and a delight.

Reviews.Title: “A gracious retreat in Rome”
Reviews.Author: deckyria
Reviews.Content: Mrs. Khan and staff provide a friendly gracious retreat at Hotel Lancelot. This in an "old world" hotel with nice accomodations just blocks from the Colloseum. The hotel is comfortable and filled with antiques with clean and spacious rooms reached by lift. Several peaceful parlors are provided to sit and read the many art books Mrs. Khan has provided and there is a small bar, as well. An enclosed indoor courtyard was available that our family used for get togethers before dinner. We understood it was used for dinners in fine weather and the menus looked appealing, but we did not take dinner at Hotel Lancelot.
