Tasty complete continental breakfast (Great cake and pastries, yogurts, fruit, cheeses, some meats and cereals) with very good coffee and brewed tea in silver urns in a nice large room. Quiet neighborhood with nice morning walks nearby to Colloseum area and two expresso bars. Be sure to visit the local churches! We took buses and taxis to other areas of Rome from two blocks away. I did walk to other areas of Rome from this hotel, but most would want a bus or taxi. Highly recommended and reasonable rates for Rome. Would stay at Hotel Lancelot again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, very friendly and helpful staff, good location.”
Reviews.Author: Sripev
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely and well presented hotel in a side street close to the Colosseum. It is a quiet area and felt very safe. We had a standard room which was spacious and clean with a comfortable bed. The public spaces are beautifully laid out and relaxing. The staff at the hotel, both the family owners and other staff were all friendly and attentive. The breakfast arrangements are welcoming, with round tables for sharing conversation and ideas about places to visit. We have already recommended this hotel to friends and will return here the next time we visit Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Decent... for Italy”
Reviews.Author: Canucdude
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Lancelot was a decent hotel in Rome. Nothing super special, but probably better than many hotels in Rome and Italy where the quality is generally poor, so expectations are low. In North America, this hotel would be at best 3 very, very average stars. But as I said, when in Rome... this is pretty good. Pro's: 1. Location: Well sort of. If you want to visit the Colosseum and Forum, this is a good location. But it is a bit remote in the sense that you are not going to go out to the street and join the locals in an evening walk - the neighborhood is pretty dead and it is a ways to the "heart" of Rome. That said, the metro is a 10 minute walk away, and a taxi stand is 5 minutes away. There are some restaurants in the area too. Like 90% of restaurants in Italy, the food is fine, but never, ever good or great. 2. Room 60: This "suite" is located on the top floor and overlooks the rooftops with a clear view to the Colosseum. Beautiful. The terrace itself is cute in a simple, rustic and somewhat untended way. Too bad there is no room service option as it would be a great place for breakfast or dinner! That said, the room is expensive and the decor... well see below. 3. Service: Some people are drooling about the service here. Not our experience. Nothing bad, but nothing overwhelming. "Pleasantly neutral" is how I would describe it. 4. Breakfast: Decent enough - most all people should come away satisfied, although the coffee and tea would make any Italian and Englishman, respectively, cry from the poor quality. Con's: 1. Location: See above. 2. Rooms and decor: The hotel decor looks like something from a 1970's museum, something you would find at your old Italian aunt's place in Anytown, Italy. Or a set from a Fellini film. Like the vast majority of hotels in Italy, the Lancelot does not invest in capital refurbishments. Cracks, stains, mold, windows don't quite close, rusty patio furniture and the like abound. Why does this seem so prevalent in Italy? Economics 101: supply and demand - little of the former and a lot of the latter! Too bad - it leaves a bad taste. Some people have commented on the Internet - I think it works fine, even if it is pretty unique to set up. Overall: A relatively decent option for Rome. But be warned, "decent" in Rome and Italy would not make the grade in North America! But if there is a next time (Rome itself is disappointing), I'll consider something else.

Reviews.Title: “Just what we needed”
Reviews.Author: ButimeTraveler
Reviews.Content: Great location, just a few blocks from the Coliseum and its Metro stop, and they’ve got a nearby bus stop that gets you to the Vatican. Rome is manageable and fun. The Lancelot’s breakfast is very very good, and the front desk people all speak English, are eager to please. Francesca was the greatest help. Our travel agent had us originally at a $700 per night place- that’s not our style so we found this place on the basis of recommendations from family and it was great (and a good value) Very secure, fun to come home to. We had a balcony, big room. Bathroom and beds were great. We were blessed with great weather.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel with no major drawbacks”
Reviews.Author: wosurupi
Reviews.Content: The hotel was okay; it was a 5 minute walk to the Coliseum and just a few minutes more to the metro stop there.. so it was convenient to get to other parts of Rome. The location suffers from a relative shortage of restaurants in the immediate vicinity. The area was pretty quiet at night, though. Seating for the morning breakfasts is at tables of 6; this encourages you to meet fellow travelers. We met different people each day and universally had good conversations, including gaining some valuable tips about Rome and its sights from return visitors. The hotel advertises free in-room wifi, but the system was down most of the 3 nights we were there. They put up a notice that the problem was being worked, but we were unable to connect for all but a couple hours. The room was clean and functional. Our king bed was a combination of two full size beds, but other than being very firm it was fine. We didn't get quite the same sense of hospitality as other reviewers.. the staff at the hotel was friendly but not to a noteworthy level.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful small boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Molly7433
Reviews.Content: From the minute we walked into Lancelot, we felt at home. We were tired from travel and couldn't check in immediately so the staff told us to go to the dining room and enjoy some breakfast and coffee. By the time we came back, our room was ready. My husband got a bad cold and was sitting in the lobby blowing his nose when one of the staff approached him and said "you don't look well, can we help you". He told my husband to go to his room and rest and he would send some ginger tea and biscotti which they did. It doesn't get much better than that. The rooms are of adequate size for Europe and we had a wonderful private terrace. They have a pre-fixe dinner each night which is really good and you can meet other guests. It was great for our first night since we were really tired. We would stay again in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “THE place to stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: NfldTripper
Reviews.Content: We loved the Hotel Lancelot and when we go back to Roma, and we will, we will stay here. It is walking distance to most major sites. It's clean, bright, friendly and reasonably priced. The staff are great and helped us with everything from directions, to restaurant reservations, to helping us get the right train to our next destination. We had a view of the Collesium from our window! The breakfast was good and because of the large "round tables" we sat and chatted with other guests. The neighbourhood is safe and a five minute walk to the collesium. Without hesitation I would reccomend this hotel to anyone I know heading to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel for our 10days in Roma”
Reviews.Author: sznelson63
Reviews.Content: I almost hate to give away this little gem of a hotel. It is directly across the street from the MUCH pricier "Capo D'Africa" (also the name of the street.) By the way, for 10Euros a day you can use the little gym of the pricier hotel if you have the energy after walking all over Rome! We have been a lucky family in that we have been able to work and travel around the world. We LOVED this hotel. Not only is it clean, spacious and bright for European standards, but its best quality is its staff who will bend over backward to help you with anything you may need. Let me not forget it is around the corner from the Colloseum and inexpensive! It was the price that almost had us going elsewhere, we thought it could not be as nice for the $$, but this was one time we were pleasantly surprised. They arranged a private car (new Mercedes sedan) to pick us up at the airport for 50 Euros total and we had the same driver later in the week take us to Pompeii and Amalfi coast for as much as you would pay a tour, but you go on your own schedule. Make sure to make reservations at the Borghese Gallery (The Lancelot will do this for you) before your trip. It is often booked a week in advance and it is almost everyone's favorite. My 17yr old daughter who is not that interested usually in museums was transfixed by the sculptures of Bernini.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding friendly service”
Reviews.Author: NC_Hiker
Reviews.Content: Servvice at this hotel was outstanding especially in this price range. I contacted the hotel Lancelot by email several times during the planning stages of my trip. All emails were answered courteously and promptly. I arrived before check in and was shown promplty to my room with a balcony and a view as requested. Room had adeqate closet space with an in room safe, significant drawer space, adeqate bathroom facilities, table and chair, small outdoor balcony, TV which I assume had English speaking channels but I never turned it on during my one week stay. Adequate toiletries were provided as well as a small packet of tissues - important for those freqent public restrooms without TP. There was a laundry bag in the room and laundry was returned promptly a the end of the day. No self serrvice laundry and no easy place to string a clothes line. No mini frig in room. Room was extremely clean. Breakfast was more than adequate with multiple cereals, dried fruit, nuts, yogurt, fresh fruit, fresh juice (the fresh squeezed apple was outstanding), pastries, rolls and meats. More breakfast options provided than the hotel I stayed at on Capri (but Capri's hotel was significantly less expensive) , less than the hotel I stayed at in Sorrento. There was an evening 3 course dinner at the hotel but I was too busy to participate so I am unable to comment. I either ate dinner at restuarants all over the city or brought food back to my balcony. Whenever assistance was requested from front desk staff it was provided promptly and courteously - from taxis arriving at the front gate in minutes, directions to sites or food recommendations, stamps, printing email confirmations for tours etc. I witnessed front desk staff loaning an older edition of a Rick Steves guide book to another couple for their entire stay. Hotel definitely withing walking distance to many sights (and geocaches if you are interested). Less than 5 minute walk to one metro line and less than 10 minute walk to the other line. I understand that bus stops were close by too. Hotel lobby access was behind a locked monitored gate. I spent much of this trip traveling as a solo woman and never felt unsafe at this hotel. My only complaint would be noise. One night there was what I think was a wedding party in the courtyard below my room. Noise from their party kept me from going to bed at the time I had planned. Another night I could hear the enitre extended conversations of the woman on telephone in the room to my left. On another night what sounded like teenage giggling girls were going up and down the hall on the sixth floor knocking on doors after midinight.

Reviews.Title: “A Most Brilliant Experience”
Reviews.Author: Speak2Man
Reviews.Content: We will return, once again, to this marvelous hotel. It was such a comfortable, well-maintained respite from a day of touring in beautiful, historic Rome. Our room was clean and comfortable with a lovely terrace view of the Coliseum. The helpfulness of the staff, regarding directions and the sale of tickets for public transport, made each day just a bit easier. We enjoyed the breakfast buffet along with lively conversation with fellow travelers. Although we boarded a cruise ship, shortly after our stay, many fellow guests were unable to return home, due to the volcanic ash. The Khan family and their staff kept those travelers apprised of airport openings and directions to train stations. We were most impressed! Thank you to every member of the staff at Hotel Lancelot!

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in Roma”
Reviews.Author: natnordy
Reviews.Content: There isnt one thing we did NOT like about the Lancelot. The location, the hotel, the staff was outstanding. We actually cancelled our reservations on the other side of town to stay here again during our stay. If we ever get back to rome, we will be staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Fab place, fab owners and staff, fab location - Elegant but homely”
Reviews.Author: Leighsus
Reviews.Content: This hotel is wonderful. It is beautifully decorated and furnished, impeccably clean and at the same time, feels very homely. The atmosphere is very welcoming, thanks to the wonderful owners and staff, who make sure that guests feel comfortable. The owners Mrs Khan and her daugther and two sons are very friendly and make it a priority to meet and greet as many guests as possible. Food is great too. Location: 2 minutes walk to the Colosseum (by the way, you can see the Colosseum from some of the rooms too!)

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Lancelot was our perfect base for a week in Rome.”
Reviews.Author: StygerTim
Reviews.Content: Hotel Lancelot was our perfect base for a week in Rome. The location is unbeatable : you can see the Colosseum and Nero’s Golden House from the hotel, magic St Clemente is literally around the corner, Trastavere and the Forum are easy walking distance – and local bus stops whisk you direct to the Vatican, St John Lateran and the rest of this extraordinary city. Our rooms were great, with plenty of space and full facilities, and a very comfortable bed. The hotel has loads of space in stylish lounge and bar, all with antiques and a gentle whisper of classical music. The dining room’s round tables are shared with other guests, who added to the magic of our stay by providing interesting and erudite company. Breakfast is to a high continental standard, and the optional dinners provide a relief from sightseeing and memorable companionship : we opted to dine in every second night of our 6-night stay, a sensible pace. The bar supplied us with good tea, fine wine, Scrabble and books, and the rest – plus a shaded outside terrace. And the whole place is spotless, well-maintained and clearly loved. But what really made Hotel Lancelot was the management and staff. Constantly helpful, great at organising and valuable advice (they got me by public transport to ipod Respighi on the Appian Way at dawn - a splendid experience), outstanding at going that extra mile with service – and interesting, too. You don’t often get the chance to talk Ethiopian history with a highly-educated barman from that extraordinary country, or discuss the politics of the Indian sub-continent with one of the owners, Mr Khan. And when we came to leave on Maundy Thursday, they arranged a Mercedes limo to Fiumicino at standard taxi prices Thank you, Mr and Mrs Khan and your team. You made a good week in Rome into something special. TripAdvisor found you for us. Here’s hoping TripAdvisor brings you plenty more guests who appreciate one of the finest small hotels in Europe.

Reviews.Title: “My first choice to stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: washbattle
Reviews.Content: What a delightful, freindly and hospitable place! It is run by a dedicated family with flare and imagination. It is like staying at home away from home, the best compliment one can give a place. Thankyou Mrs Helen Khan a real credit to you and your family. On top of this it has location, location location! The Hotel Lancelot is in a quiet secluded street, Via Capo D' Africa, 5 minute walk to the Colleseum

Reviews.Title: “A Super Little Secret”
Reviews.Author: City-Break-family
Reviews.Content: I hesitate to write this review because I feel I'm letting too many people in on a wonderful secret. We visited this charming, well-situated hotel for a quick weekend in February. The Hotel Lancelot sits in a lovely neighborhood so is very quiet, but you are basically next door to the sites of Ancient Rome. The hotel rooms are spacious by any european standard and ours benefitted from the most magnificent views - not usual for a hotel in the centre of town. The bathrooms were well-equipped, pristine and more than comfortable. The staff, however, is what makes this hotel extra-special. They make you feel so extremely welcome. There is no question that we have (finally) found our Rome hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: fordstreet
Reviews.Content: perfect location in a neighborhood near colesium. Very helpful staff. Their largest room accomodated my family of four, not a luxurious room, but fine for the four of us.

Reviews.Title: “We were family the minutes we walked in the door.”
Reviews.Author: Rick628
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent a week in Rome, with another couple, in January 2010. We picked the Lancelot through TripAdvisor, which rated it 17th out of 1200+ rated hotels in Rome, astonishing for a modest-sized 3-star hotel. We understood the rating the minute we walked through the front door, as we were greeted as though we were well-loved family members returning after a long absence. This level of attention, warmth, and service continued through the entire week, including the 90 minutes the proprietor spent with us our first night outlining things to see and do and how to get there, not only the major tourist destinations, but things a local knows about best. The accommodations were fine, althougn nothing extraordinary -- it was the service that won our hearts. We spent almost every late afternoon in the Lancelot lounge, taking well-prepared tea, and visiting with other guests and with members of the owner's actual family who apparently are always passing though town. The location is super, a few blocks from The Coliseum. Very convenient, not only for visiting the Coliseum and the adjoining Forum and museums, but because at any major bus stop in central Rome there is a bus or two that includes "Colosseo" among its stops -- making it easy to get home. We cannot imagine returning to Rome and not returning to the Lancelot. (Thank you TripAdvisor!).

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, room with patio and view and good location”
Reviews.Author: bertram31
Reviews.Content: We have stayed twice at Hotel Lancelot and enjoyed it. The best part was the patio and view of the Colosseum. The staff was very helpful giving directions and instructions on how to use the metro and the buses. It is a quiet area with some good restaurants within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location to all the sights and very friendly.”
Reviews.Author: akameda
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had a great time at the Hotel Lancelot. We rented a room with a terrace and sat out as much as possible. It's has a charming atmosphere and broad age range of guests, which made it fun. They had a nice little bar area and the dinner they serve was wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Charming, adequate.”
Reviews.Author: BillieTravels
Reviews.Content: We were a bit spoiled staying in an agroturismo in the Tuscan hills for 8 days prior to staying here, so we were a bit shocked to return to small hotel rooms at high prices. This place is walking distance to the Coliseum and subway, but a bit of a hike when dragging luggage... seems not far enough to take a cab, yet just far enough away to be a huge bummer to drag your roller bags! My sister in law and her husband stayed in a little pricier room than ours (ours was around $200 american I think) and had a charming balcony... well worth the money in the end, to sip a bottle of wine on the lovely flower filled patio. Not sure what she paid... but it was pricey for what it was. Not really any place to walk at night (say, to go grab a bite or a leisurely dinner)... plan on taking cabs to somewhere a bit more lively. (Which is OK, because in turn, it's not noisy at night!) Overall, I'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable Hotel if you don't mind sharing your diner table”
Reviews.Author: Ellipoops
Reviews.Content: We found and booked this hotel after reading positive comments on trip advisor so here are our comments; We found the staff to be helpful & freindly, we moved from the first room due to lack of bath but were not charged for the upgrade (why upgrade I do not know as it was still a double). Arrived New Years day & booked on half board basis in case other restaurants were shut. Suprised to find that diner was strictly 7.30pm and the restaurant had around 6 or 7 tables seating 7 people. There was a fixed menu with no choice and you were expected to share with other residents, which was a new experience for us, fine except you sometimes just want to dine on your own. Food was fairly basic and my wife couldn't eat anything as stringy lamb was served preceded by undercooked sausage & polenta and followed by a seriously frozen baked alaska. As my wife rarely eats red meat, I had to eat hers to avoid embarrasment. Wine was served with the meal which was far better quality than the food and plentiful. We chose after the 1st evening to revert to B&B and had fantastic meals out at everywhere we ate for lunch & dinner. Breakfast was OK although eggs and a toaster would have been a nice option, which we generally find elsewhere in Europe, just the basic cereal, fruit, bread, small packet cheese and a plate of ham (if you are quick enough). I asked if more ham was possible when we arrived for breakfast at 9.00am but were told it was finnished. Aside from the food, the location is good & quiet, although our next trip would certainly be further North or central where you are a short walk to almost everything especially the shops and majority of the must do sites except the Collissium. We found several other 3 & 4 star hotels in central locations that were cheaper than we had paid but overall our first visit to Rome was very pleasant at the Lancelot

Reviews.Title: “An excellant hotel”
Reviews.Author: ynapa456
Reviews.Content: My sister stayed there 3 years ago and I must say this is a very friendly hotel. I agree with everything else that's been said except we had no complaints about our room. By all means, go to the web site and down load the walking tours of the neighbor hood churches. Room were not large, but neither was it small.

Reviews.Title: “A gem! Possibly the best 3star hotel we have stayed in anywhere in the world.”
Reviews.Author: Bamse64
Reviews.Content: Superb central location in a pleasant quiet street. Our attractive well equiped Italian style room had a tiny balcony with a view of the Colosseum .(at the end of the street, as was the Forum). Service from friendly English speaking staff in this family owned Art Deco hotel was second to none, even though they were always incredibly busy. Taxis appeared in minutes at the courtyard gates. Information, directions and maps were personal, detailed and helpful. There, is a tiny lift, always a bonus, fits 2 or 3 at a pinch. Breakfast is generous continental style. You can book a 3 course traditional Italian meal in the evening, joining a table of 10 fellow travellers. This is a long tradition and we could see was popular with guests judging by the level of conversation and laughter, though we had no time to participate during our few days stay. Don't miss fascinating St. Clemente church in the same street, built in several layers from 2ndC Mithraic and 4thC Christian .In a couple of blocks you will also find lots of trattoria and restaurants, a bank and ATM and a friendly informative very good barber. Lancelot - we'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: ice_rider
Reviews.Content: Hubby and I stayed at this hotel for five nights in late September 2009. I had booked well in advance, and arranged for a sixth floor terrace room with Colosseum view. The hotel also arranged for a shuttle to pick us up from the airport. Our driver was a wonderful, knowledgeable man who gave us a wonderful tour en route. Upon arriving, everyone was friendly and helpful. The room was fair-sized and well-appointed. But the terrace....just beautiful! It was 30 degrees celsius and sunny every day we were in Rome, and when it got too hot after lunch we would retreat to our shady, flower-filled terrace and eat lunch we had bought at the supermarket down the road before heading out in the cooler afternoon. Looking to the right, fortified convent, straight ahead across the rooftops Trajan's baths, and to the left, the Colosseum. It was absolutely magical. The continental breakfast was plentiful and always had a wide selection. The family-run nature of this hotel makes you feel as though you are stepping back in time, to an era when politeness and grace was the most important element of hospitality. The only small criticism is there is no mini-fridge in the room, and with the heat we kept water & juice and pop in our room and we wanted to keep it cool. They very helpfully supplied us with repeated buckets of ice, which worked out fine. We spent five days in Rome and there is still so much to see. We will definitely return, and when we do we will go back to this hotel, and back to the same type of room.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful warmth and hospitality”
Reviews.Author: SkiKing01
Reviews.Content: this was our 2nd time to stay at the Lancelot so maybe we are a little biased but we know what to expect - fabulous staff who were extremely helpful and a warm and inviting place to stay. Guests are encouraged to speak with each other at meal times and this only helps. We had a large double room which could easily accommodate a cot and decent sized bathroom. Good quiet location close to the Colosseum with good restaurants, shops and a few pubs and pharmacies close by. For us this was "old school" type hotel and we will certainly return.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful family-run hotel”
Reviews.Author: someconcerns
Reviews.Content: This was the gem hotel of our trip through Italy. We stayed on the 6th floor in a room without a terrace, but with access to the terrace at the end of the hall and a direct view of the Coliseum (four blocks away) from our room. Staff speaks better English than I do; they are friendly, warm and as noted in other reviews, very helpful in working up your itinerary in Rome. They suggested ordering our visits to attractions in ways that almost eliminated waiting in lines. Quiet residential neighborhood appeared to be safe throughout our 4-day stay. Small discount off the price if you have the Rick Steves guide to Rome. It was so incredible staying so close to the Coliseum, Palatine Hill, etc. While I recommend getting a "Roma Pass" for free admission to two of your most expensive attractions, and free metro (which we didn't use) and bus rides (which we did extensively), make sure you visit two expensive venues first as the first two are free and you almost get the full cost back from those two. Subsequent attractions (not everything participates, like the Vatican museum) give only a discount. Hotel convenient to many bus routes and only cost 10 euro for a cab from main train station to hotel (Only use a white, metered cab!!!), including baggage and tip. Fixed price for cabs to FCO airport is 40 euro. The desk will call a proper cab, but the funny thing was that our cab had its seatbelts disabled and the driver hit over 150 km/hr on the way to airport with maximum speed limits of 100 km/hr. Translates to 93-94 mph. Certainly not the fault of the hotel. Also be aware that the driver may drop you at Terminal 3 and many international airlines fly out of Terminal 5. A free shuttle will take you from T3 to T5. They offer a delicious dinner at extra cost. We loved the one we had, but ate out in neighborhood restaurants the other three nights when we only wanted to eat lightly. You can prepay for dinner with your room, or pay a higher amount for dinner on an ad hoc basis. The hotel posts that evening's menu during the day and you have until about 4-5 pm to let them know if you want to opt-in. They make recommendations on restaurants which I felt to be reliable. Without hesitation, I would recommend this hotel to family or friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at the Lancelot”
Reviews.Author: TexasZuggie
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at the Lancelot. Again, we were very pleased. A few rooms have terraces, but cost 20E more. There's a community terrace on the 6th floor, and if you ask for a room on the 6th floor, it's just down the hall. Breakfast was good, staff is excellent. Room very nice, but bathrooms are small. We like the location as the Lancelot is located in more of an apartment residential area - about 3 blocks from the colleseum. The restaurants cater more to a local crowd and are very reasonably priced.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: 2531kit
Reviews.Content: A five minute walk to the coliseum and most of the sights are in walking distance too. We were vry lucky to find this hotel. although the our reception was a bit perplexing. Inspite of the hotel not being too busy - we were given a tiny run down room which had wall paint coming off; the furniture was old. After a request for a bigger room from a different receptionist - she very helpfully changed ours to one which was better furnished as well as had a balcony. A great relief since we were traveling with a small child. There is an old world charm about the place. Majority of the guests seemed to be older travelers. The complimentary breakfast did not offer a good variety. And bathrooms are so tiny that you can barely fit in. When we tried to put the shutters down for the night, they were jammed and could not be used. But the location made up for all the shortcoming. Since we hardly spent much time in the hotel, its proximity to all that is wonderful about the city is definitely a big plus in its favour.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Choice”
Reviews.Author: Tasha47
Reviews.Content: We wanted to stay near the Coliseum and this was the perfect location. It was also quiet and convenient to metro. The staff was friendly and the room was great with a nice patio. There are many sitting areas in the lobby and free wi-fi. They have staff at the front desk 24 hrs and they'll arrange for a cab if you're catching an early morning flight. When in Rome, this is a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel on our whole Italian Vacation!”
Reviews.Author: PirataViator
Reviews.Content: This hotel has the best of what every traveller needs. Fantastic knowlegable staff. They really make sure you have eveyrthing you need or want. They help with bus schedules, metro, tickets to the Vatican Mueseum, all of it. Good dinner each night though we only ate once (I wanted to get out and find local restaurants, etc). At dinner and breakfast you pick your own seat from round tables and its a fantastic way to meet other travellers. While there we met people who lived 50 miles from us in the States, a couple from the UK, another couple from Australia, and a few Germans. Absolutly relaxing stay. We had a beautiful terrace that we came back to each night with a few bottles of wine and enjoyed the view off the balcony and the perfect weather. Couldn't rave more about this hotel. I WILL be back! :)

Reviews.Title: “Our home away from home”
Reviews.Author: justkate8382
Reviews.Content: I could not have been happier with Hotel Lancelot. I chose it based on reviews on TripAdvisor and everyone's advice was spot-on. We stayed in Room 47 and found it to be very comfortable. Having a safe for our valuables in the room was also much appreciated. The thing that makes Lancelot, though, is the service. Everyone who works at the front desk speaks English and is extremely helpful. The reception staff helped us with directions, made reservations at restaurants, recommended which buses to take where, and arranged a private car service to take us to the airport. Any question or problem we had, they took care of it immediately. One caveat: We did eat the hotel dinner in the dining room with other guests one night. Terrible, overpriced food. Skip it and just ask the hotel for a restaurant recommendation. Would definitely stay here when in Rome again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with great staff”
Reviews.Author: az_hawk
Reviews.Content: So before I write this review I need to add a disclaimer. I am a frequent business traveler who is traveling more often than not. I am accustom to staying in nice hotel chains like the Westin, Sheraton, Marriott, etc. In order to write this review I need to change my typical expectations from a large US hotel chain to a small boutique hotel in Rome. Location (3.5 stars): This is a quaint little hotel located within a five minute walk of the colosseum. The location is quiet which is something you'll come to appreciate in a city that does not sleep. You'll find plenty of restaurants and bars within a couple of blocks although the better places are closer to Trevi Fountain, Pantheon, or Spanish Steps. Just to give you an idea it's a 30 minute walk to Trevi Fountain and other attractions. A cab will run you approximately 10 Euros to Trevi Fountain and perhaps a little more to the Spanish Steps, Vatican, etc. There is a bus line within an easy walk although it's a little too crowded at times (which is to say you might be fine with it). If I could do it all over again I might give more consideration to being closer to the Spanish Steps or Trevi Fountain, but then again the miles and miles of walking is a good way to burn off those Italian meals. Value (3 stars): I found the hotel to be priced in the middle of the road for central Rome, but it's unfortunate the US Dollar has fallen so much versus the Euro. The typical room rate is 186 Euros which converts to $280 USD which makes this hotel a poor value for Americans. Room Size (3 stars): The room is a typical size for Europe which is my way of politely saying it's small (approx. 200 sq ft). The bathroom was even smaller with no bathtub and a shower similar in size to what you see on cruise ships. I understand some rooms did have a bathtub and a slightly larger bathroom. Beds (2 stars): We had two twin beds and I know the other option is a double. The beds are very hard which I believe is a European preference. The pillows are also hard, but I did find soft pillows in the armoire. TV (1 star): I have stayed at a few other European hotels and I know it's unlikely to find a large plasma TV in Europe. However, I was a little disappointed to come back to the room after a long day to what amounted to a 14 inch TV. The only channels in English are CNN and BBC. I think some people will say the TV is not a concern since they are there to sleep. Other: The room does not have a clock so don't forget your travel clock. Also be aware when you request a wake-up call the staff may not call you on-time. Breakfast (3 stars): Like most hotels in Europe there is a continental breakfast included with your stay. The breakfast consists of cereals, meats, croissants, coffee, and juice. The breakfast was fine and in line with expectations although I did get bored of the same exact thing every morning. Dinner (4 stars): We did try the hotel dinner one evening and we were pleasantly surprised. It might be a good idea on your first night to go with their dinner option for 25 Euros per person and it includes everything including wine. Cleanliness (5 stars): This hotel is well maintained and very clean. Our room was always kept clean and the maids were friendly. Staff (5 stars): You will not find a better hotel staff in Rome. Everyone who we spoke to at the front desk was friendly and went out of their way to accommodate us. Whether you need advice on attractions or restaurants these kind people will be more than happy to help.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: ElizaSF
Reviews.Content: We loved the location of this hotel in Rome. It was walking distance to the bus stop and sites of ancient Rome. The staff was so helpful with directions, restaurant recommendations and transportation. They even went out of their way to call and follow up on a missing piece of luggage! We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “2nd time at hotel”
Reviews.Author: Halls4
Reviews.Content: This was the second time that we stayed at the Lancelot. The second time was as nice as the first. The hotel is perfect if you want to visit the area near the Coloseum. We planned our vacation exactly like we did two years ago - pre-cruise at the Lancelot, post-cruise at the Hotel Santa Maria. This way we could do one end of Rome pre, one post. The cost of the hotel is very affordable when you compare it to other hotels in Rome. The breakfast buffet is very good - rolls, meat, cheese, danish, cereal. We will probably say there again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Nice combination of location and service”
Reviews.Author: ccl211
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Lancelot for 4 nights, and had a very pleasant stay. It is a smallish, family-run hotel just a few blocks from the Coloseum. It was a convenient home base for our explorations of the city. You can easily walk, bus or subway to all the sights from there, and the desk workers are very helpful with directions, suggestions, reservations etc. Excellent English was spoken by almost all staff. An excellent, large breakfast is included and they also serve a prix-fixe dinner in the evening, if you don't want to go back out. While not "luxurious", the public spaces were immaculate and nicely decorated. The rooms were quite adequate, but like most European rooms, small by U.S. standards and with only minimal air conditioning!

Reviews.Title: “friendly, ideal for larger parties, good value, great position.”
Reviews.Author: wigwagnorthwest
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with a large group pilgrimage/holiday,it has a gate closing hotel entrance off to the street, which made us feel secure,they had to buzz you in if you were late out at night, they know you by face very quickly, they are extremely friendly, helpful.cant complain about food if you wanted to eat in, but to be honest your spoilt for choice as it is very handy for all amenities, stroll easily to colloseum.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Liz56TorontoON
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel based on Rick Steve's review. We were not disappointed. We had a lovely room with a tiny balcony. The breakfast was very plentiful and tasteful. The bar and garden area were very pretty. The service is totally professional and helpful. The location beside the Colosseum is fantastic. It is a quieter side of Rome. There are lots of restaurants and bars and a beautiful park close by. I would definitely stay there again and I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Didn't want to leave”
Reviews.Author: Elizwannatravel
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Lancelot for three nights after traveling all over Europe for three weeks. We found a haven with Mrs. Kahn, Michael and other staffers who truly love working there. Our room was spacious and spotless with windows looking out on the beauty of Rome. We spent time in the little bar area talking to other travelers - fascinating! Dinners were delicious and our table mates were great to converse. Such a wonderful location we were off and about in a short time with the help of Mrs Kahn or her front desk crew, knowing bus numbers and such to help. Breakfast was an experience in itself with wonders of cereals and meats and COFFEE! We cannot speak high enough about Hotel Lancelot and will recommend it to all of those contemplating a stay in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Our favorite hotel in Italy!”
Reviews.Author: Caryres
Reviews.Content: My husband, 11-year-old daughter, and I stayed 3 nights at the Hotel Lancelot in Rome in mid-June 2009. We absolutely loved this hotel, and really missed it when we moved on. It was reasonably priced, with a nice room and bathroom. We were walking distance to the Colosseum and Forum, and around the block from several very nice restaurants, but best of all the street it was on was quiet and the hotel itself was set around an attractive courtyard. The staff at the front desk was friendly and always happy to help us with advice and directions. The lobby, breakfast area, a small bar (which we used every afternoon for a drink before dinner), and a sitting area were all very relaxing and cozy. You can't go wrong with this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “An Oasis in Rome with Outstanding, Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: IllinoisTravel4Fun
Reviews.Content: After reading many favorable recommendations about the Hotel Lancelot, I was, quite honestly, a bit disappointed when our cab pulled up to the entrance after circling the block looking for the hotel. My disappointment was short-lived. While I was not bowled over by our very simple but spotless room, the large attached terrace provided an oasis at the end of each of our five days of non-stop sightseeing. Our terrace was filled with fragrant flowers and had a table with chairs and a beautiful mosaic bench. With the terrace, our room was about as far from a cookie cutter hotel as one could imagine. It provided a great spot for reading, relaxing, sipping wine and enjoying the salads, cheeses and other foods we picked up at the supermarket we passed each day on our walk to the Colosseum station, which is about a ten minute walk from the hotel. The common areas of the hotel were very welcoming. I spent part of an afternoon watching guests come and go while reading in the lounge area, which is filled with overstuffed furniture and antiques. There is a charming outdoor patio near the bar for those who don't have a balcony or terrace to enjoy. Finally, the staff members we talked with were eager to help and very friendly, and there was always someone at the front desk who spoke English or understood my fractured Italian. We felt like the staff genuinely wanted us to have a wonderful time in Rome and cared about the service provided each guest. We got some good restaurant and tour recommendations from the staff and purchased our bus/train tickets at the front desk, which saved time at the station. I made use of the hotel's guest internet service several times, and it was very reliable. We did not attend one of the hotel's nightly dinner services, but I heard guests say how much they enjoyed the meal. Breakfast, served at round tables shared with other guests, was adequate--cold cereals, breads, cold meats, fruit and juice. We used the hotel's car service to get to the airport, which appeared to be much better value than taking a taxi. I recommend highly the Lancelot because of the friendly staff, welcoming feel and the wonderful outdoor spaces--terraces and balconies. Also, the area has a number of good restaurants and a delicious gelateria right around the corner.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel conveniently located, good value and nice service”
Reviews.Author: EAGIN
Reviews.Content: Very conveniently located close to the coliseum, I was amazed about this cozy and nice hotel we found. Very quiet, Good value, Great Breakfast Service, nice staff. The only flaw, rooms are very small. We were allowed to stay with our little Yorky dog. Would come back certainly.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely oasis in the heat (and heart) of Rome”
Reviews.Author: jrlooby
Reviews.Content: Located on a quiet side street just three blocks from the Colosseum. We had a family room for the four of us, and it was very roomy. The bathroom was good-size, also. It was a corner room, so there were large windows and doors that opened to a balcony that went around two sides of the room. Service was excellent, and everyone spoke English. They have a restaurant for those staying in the hotel and serve a free buffet breakfast and a set-menu dinner each night. We ate dinner there one night--it was expensive but excellent.

Reviews.Title: “A rare find: great hotel, great location, reasonable price and sleeps 4!”
Reviews.Author: IdRatherSpendEuros
Reviews.Content: Quad rooms in Europe are almost impossible to find, so we were thrilled to stay at the Lancelot with our 2 kids (10 and 14). Having just spent 12 days in houses in the Italian country side, this was such a welcome change: impeccably clean, crisp sheets, soft pillows, spotless modern bathroom, plus AC! Our room (with balcony) had a view of the Colosseum, a queen and 2 singles and was very spacious, with dresser, large desk -- we were not climbing over each other. At 220€ this was a great find. The included breakfast was typical European (assorted bakes goods, meats, cereal, coffee, juice) and a wide range of restaurants were all around the neighborhood. 5 min walk to Colosseum/Forum, passing San Clemente church on the way and then a couple more blocks to St. Peter in Chains. The 24 hr front desk staff were always kind and helpful and decent to perfect in English. The great little bar/lounge in the back was a bonus, but we did not get to experience (other than to view ) the outdoor courtyard with its solid canopy of wisteria vines. I would recommend the Lancelot to anyone

Reviews.Title: “Sunset over the Coloseum”
Reviews.Author: bob_wandsworth
Reviews.Content: Stayed in 6th floor room with terrace overlooking the Coloseum. Definitely worth that bit extra. Nice hotel, great helpful staff but the view while having an evening drink made the whole stay. We absolutely loved Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Room with a View”
Reviews.Author: angusfan
Reviews.Content: We were fortunate enough to have one of the rooms on the 6th floor (thanks Mom). Our room had a beautiful view of the colleseum. There was a thunderstorm a few miles away on our last night there. It was awesome! The location is very convenient to attractions and transportation. We did not dine in the hotel except for breakfast, which had a very good selection. There were several good restaurants nearby. The hotel's staff was very friendly and helpful. Everyone spoke English well. Easy subway ride from the train station - 2 stops on the B train. It was several blocks from the subway station, but we travel light in anticipation of this. Probably would have been less than 5 Euro for a cab.

Reviews.Title: “The terrace is worth the visit”
Reviews.Author: LuizTrip
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Lancelot for a long weekend and we loved it but not without a couple of kinks. There is nothing else to say about the location: a couple of blocks from the historical center but still hidden from the crowd; it could not get better than this. The staff is very welcoming (with exception of one person) and also very helpful. They pointed us to a couple of nice restaurants and were always ready to answer our questions. We stayed two nights at a double bed room with no terrace or balcony and two nights at another one with terrace, both located on the 6th floor. The first room was OK but we would be happier with larger bed and bathroom. The second room was more spacious and very comfortable. So, this is the first kink: if one is too large (not our case), he/she will have a hard time using the restroom or taking a shower. The second kink: we were disappointed with the breakfast: very frugal and not really in synch with the price we paid. A couple of toasters and some scrambled eggs with bacon would bring it closer to what we were expecting. That goes together with the lack of room service. Even though the hotel counts a nice little bar and a nice small garden, a regular room service would be one of those niceties that could make a difference, specially for those staying at a room with a terrace.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in quiet location.”
Reviews.Author: RBRBoston
Reviews.Content: I was very happy with this hotel. The location is great. It's within a couple of blocks of the colosseum. The location was perfect for beginning your sight seeing. You can start at the colosseum and work your way north. If you're looking to be more in the heart of ancient Rome, you may want to stay north of the colosseum. It's hard to tell when you've never been somewhere. But, I found this place to be ideal. The room was nice and very clean. It was also very quiet at night. There is great a/c in the room, which we used every day on our trip. The continental breakfast was nice. You share tables with people which was just okay. I never had the dinner, as it seemed a bit pricey. The recommendations for restaurants that we got from the hotel weren't that great. Overall I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location / Helpful, Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: bradnr
Reviews.Content: This was a wonderful hotel: great location (2 blocks from Colloseum, 12 Euro cab ride or 20 minute bus ride to Vatican, 2 blocks from LOTS of bus stops), staff was amazing (great restaurant recommendations and wonderfully helpful is advising us which bus to take to get to which landmark). We booked it because of the low price and were please with our room and the service. WOOHOO - Free internet (although not very fast). Did I mention the staff was amazingly friendly and wonderful and helpful and great? Advice to Americans travling in Europe - Europeans have a different way than Americans. Service providers (in hotels and restaurants) will give you the most amazing service if you are polite and gracious. If you are rude or demanding, they will more likely flip you off than try to "turn your frown upside down" Therefore, be courteous and understanding and gracious, and you will get treated like family. Also, note that hotel rooms and bathrooms are much smaller in Europe than in America unless you pay BIG BUCKS for your room - you didn't travel all that way to spend the whole time in your room did you?

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: WilsonMissouri
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Lancelot for 5 days during a vacation to Italy. We booked the hotel primarily for it's location and were pleased with the reviews on tripadvisor. The location was perfect, only 4 blocks away from the Coloseum in a safe neighborhood. We often came back late and were never concerned about the area. There is a metro stop near at the Coloseum that can be used to access other parts of the city and is a short taxi ride to Travestevere which has some of the best restaurants in Rome. We have traveled quite a bit in Europe and found the staff at this hotel to be one of the best. They could not do enough for you. It made our stay so much better to always be welcomed back with a smile. The breakfast had a good selection for European standards. We will stay here again on our next trip to Rome. Also, don't let the taxi driver charge you more than 40 Euro to take you to this hotel from the airport. They have an agreed upon rate and it seems the drivers usually attempt to take advantage of unknowing tourists.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, great location, overall great deal.....”
Reviews.Author: blondiemurc
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hotel Lancelot based on other traveler reviews on Trip Advisor. We were not disappointed. The best part of this hotel was the staff. They were so helpful in giving us ideas on how to get around, where to go, etc. We would recommend one of the rooms with a courtyard as it is worth the extra 12 euros per night. It makes the room so much larger, and it is a nice retreat after a long day of walking the streets of Rome. We would have given complete 5's across the board, except that the bathroom in our room (#6) was way too small, and the internet was horrible. Otherwise, it was a perfect stay. The location really can't be beat. We also decided to stay in one night and eat at the hotel and the food was excellent and reasonably priced given all that you got. We would absolutely recommend this hotel and if we come back to Rome, will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: 4Hfriend
Reviews.Content: My 3 friends and I stayed at the Lancelot April 19-21, traveled elsewhere in Italy, and returned for 2 nights at the end of our trip. We stayed in a quad which was set up with a double bed, a single, and a roll away. The room was large enough for the 4 of us. The staff was always kind and helpful and we enjoyed the daily breakfast buffet. There were a few common rooms to use as well as two outside terraces, which we did not take advantage of. If the weather had been a bit warmer, it would have been delightful to end the day with a glass of wine in either of these spots. The hotel is close to the Colosseum and to a metro stop. There are a number of restaurants close by. Each night the hotel offers a fixed price dinner for an additional cost. We took advantage of this on our last night and had an enjoyable evening dining with some of the other hotel guests. All in all, I would recommend the hotel for its exemplary service, cleanliness, and location and would stay there again on a return trip to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in the Eternal City!”
Reviews.Author: Brkln71
Reviews.Content: This review is posted very late, but it is still accurate! I booked the Lancelot for my honeymoon last May and we had a fantastic time here. They arranged to have a car sent to pick up my wife and I from the airport and had a bottle of sparkling wine waiting for us in the room. The staff is highly professional and courteous. They helped us many times with restaurants, sites, getting around etc... The morning breakfast is fantastic, and the bar offers a nice place to relax with a drink after the sights of Rome. The rooms are very spacious, larger than what I expected. The bathroom is very nice, the bed comfortable and we even had a nice little terrace overlooking the street. The stay was extremely pleasant and I will not bother looking for another hotel the next time I go to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, super friendly”
Reviews.Author: AnH0nestMan
Reviews.Content: Have stayed at Hotel Lancelot twice. Once in 2005 with two kids, and once just us two adults week before Easter 2009. Location to die for. Not only can you see the Coloseum, buses everywhere are 100 yards away yet the street itself is very quiet. Great info in response to any questions at the desk. Maybe too many of us British and Americans to feel like Italy but benefit is you get advice in perfect English. Restaurant recommendation from the desk of Ditirambo in the city centre was also perfect. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Yes, Really. All Fives. A wonderful hotel.”
Reviews.Author: DeanC
Reviews.Content: Wow. Not the most eloquent choice of words, I suppose, but this hotel was exactly what we wanted. Great food, beautiful room, excellent staff, great location, beautiful view from the upper floors. We stayed 10 days, starting with a fairly large group of seminary students and then a few days more with a small group of friends. The Lancelot felt like home. The bed was comfortable, the bathroom was clean and well-appointed. The room was oh-so-clean when we returned each day. The food is great. We actually looked forward to eating each night in the hotel. Half-board is well worth the cost. Wireless Internet worked well in the room. Nice sitting rooms, coffee bar, intimate environment. Classy and classic. Within easy walking distance of the coliseum. Great neighborhood with restaurants and gelato bars, grocery stores, etc. A bit of a hike to the closest metro station (Colosseo or Manzoni), but the bus stop is just at the base of the hill. Have stayed twice and look forward to staying again.

Reviews.Title: “Return Visit, Loved It!”
Reviews.Author: Monon
Reviews.Content: Great little English hotel near the Coliseum and Forum. Was there a few years back, returned for a 10 day stay and then overnight a couple weeks later. Staff is great, hotel is small but very nice. Stayed in room 66 as a single, loved it. Great view and very quiet. Stayed in a terrace room last time, room 62. Worth the extra money in good weather if you are a couple. If you love ancient Roman history, this is a great location. Perfect for me because I was there for the Roman ruins. If you are going for the Vatican, be aware the Metro is maybe a 6 block walk. Restaurants around the hotel were so-so but so many good ones in Rome it doesn't matter. I recommend the little bakery on via di San Giovanni in Laterano and a little wine bar around the corner, the Kottabos I think. The staff is great. Speak English, very helpful and friendly. I left my GPS device in my room and they fedexed it to me. I was surprised that it was noisy my last night. Come to find out it was Mrs. Kahn's (the owner) 80th birthday and the hotel was filled with relatives from all over the world. They were nice enough to invite me to join them, which I really appreciated although I didn't do so. I recommended the Lancelot to a friend who stays only in Marriott hotels. He loved it much to my surprise. But be aware that this is not an American hotel but a European one. The rooms, while very nicely done, may seem small if you've only stayed in American hotels. But for the price, location, staff friendliness, and value, you can't beat it!

Reviews.Title: “loved it, loved it, loved it!!!”
Reviews.Author: hur1eys
Reviews.Content: We loved the hotel lancelot!!!! We visited in mid- january and everything about the hotel was perfect. From the driver who picked me up at the airport. We had the best local red wine in the small bar every night before dinner. We simply told the wonderful staff at the front desk we wanted a drink and within 2 minutes we had large glasses served and we were left alone to chat. The first night we ate out at a local restuarant (you can not walk a block from hotel without hitting a wine bar or excellent restuarant. Then came back and had drinks and sat in the back library and talked while another couple from sweden played excellent jazz/classical music on the piano in the adjoining sitting room. the second night (sunday) we ate in the hotel. it can be quite full for dinner, but for our night it was us, a business man from south africa, a business woman from ireland, a regular women who stays in hotel when in rome, the owner, her son and the head of staff. The food was good and they were very generous with both food and wine (all included in the room cost with out package). We all lingered over drink well after dinner and felt like we knew each other when ever we meet for breakfast - i would not have traded the experience for any other hotel in rome. Breakfast is simple but fits the bill and the urns of coffee and hot milk (i still dream about ) was perfect. The front staff desk was great, from restaurant recommendations to a car for the ride back to airport to letting us stay in out room long after checkout on last day to sleep (jet lag wiped me out) I had read in other reviews the beds would be hard,but my husband (a chronic snorer) slept like a baby. The rooms were neat and clean (we had a small but cute balcony) but bigger than some i have stayed in europe and new orleans) - my only advice is bring ear plugs, the jet lag kept me up so i heard everything.on the street .while my husband who meet me after a week in verona slept like the dead and never heard anything. I do not think of rome with out thinking how wonderful mrs, kahn (sp?) and her family and staff were! I would return in a minute,

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel with wonderful family atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: Geri0
Reviews.Content: Loved the service at this hotel. Was very happy with the service in every way. Loved the driver that the hotel uses to bring tourists around Rome. He had such patience with us-a party of eight. Would stay here again in a heartbeat. Very classy with a family charm. If I had to make a single improvement-very minor-It would be an expansion of their continental breakfast. It could use some improvement in overall selection and quality.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel”
Reviews.Author: debar56
Reviews.Content: just spent 4 nights (28/1 TO 1/2) at this great hotel ,very central and in a very lively area with good restaraunts and pubs try the Camden Town Irish pub very friendly staff 3 mins from the hotel,come out of the hotel turn left and then take the second left its 20m up the street. The room was ok in size with a great bed and a balcony. the bathroom was small but it had everything and it had a great shower. Good breakfast with plenty food available and very friendly english speaking staff.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay at the Lancelot”
Reviews.Author: mountainflower
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hotel Lancelot for a couple of nights before going on a cruise from Civitavecchia. We booked direct with the Hotel via email and they were most helpful and polite in all their dealings with us before the stay. We booked a transfer from the airport through the Hotel and were duly met by their driver who gave us a very interesting commentary on the journey, pointing out all the main landmarks along the way. The location of the hotel is ideal, the Colosseum is literally at the end of the street. There is a Hop-On-Hop-Off bus stop just near the Colosseum where you can take a tour of the city on an open-top bus. We did that to get our bearings before deciding how to get around for the rest of our stay (we mainly walked). The staff at the Lancelot were friendly and willing to offer any help required in finding our way round, booking meals out etc. The room was comfortable and there was a small balcony just along the corridor from where you could see the Colosseum and look out over Rome. We booked evening meals at the Hotel and these were very enjoyable, they have big round tables so you just sit down and get to know people. Great if you are interested in that kind of experience - we are and we met some very nice people and enjoyed excellent conversation over dinner and (complimentary) wine. We had arranged to be picked up by friends who were staying at another hotel when we left for the port. There was a slight problem with this because the Lancelot is on a one-way street and their taxi driver didn't know the one-way system in that part of town. They stopped and waved from the end of the road and we had to walk down to meet them - not a problem in any way but worth bearing in mind if you are being picked up independantly. Overall we thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Lancelot and would recommend this Hotel to other travellers without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: rsm0329
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Hotel Lancelot over Christmas and enjoyed our four nights. The staff were extremely pleasant and helpful- they went out of their way to ensure we had a great time and enjoyed all Rome had to offer. The breakfast each morning was good- lots of options like cereal, cold meats and cheese, pastries and more. The property is in a cool neighborhood with lots of osteria's and wine bars in walking distance. It is a perfect place to be for all of Rome's sights. The rooms were very clean. A little smaller than we hoped, but we had a balcony and view of the Colosseum and we didn't spend too much time in the room anyways. We enjoyed a great Christmas dinner with impeccable service and at the end the owner invited us to enjoy a DVD with his family. He told us stories of Rome and the hotel and overall was extremely pleasant. I would stay again when we return to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Enjoyable Stay”
Reviews.Author: Philrdg
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Lancelot from 4th to 7th December. We arrived quite late the first night and booked the limo (a BMW 7-series with every mod-con) through the hotel. We were greeted by an elderly Italian gent, who was really friendly and gave us a nice commentary about monuments as we came into Rome. On arrival at the hotel they were extremely friendly. This was the case with all the receptionists and bar staff throughout our stay. They were quite happy to order taxi's and make reservations at restaurants. We ate at Sa Tanca Crostaceria, La Numanchie (close to the hotel) and Il Tempo Di Inside which I have written reviews on. We decided to book a Terrace Room. On getting to the room it was fairly basic with a double bed, desk and a small cupboard with a safe. The bathroom was tiny and pretty disappointing as it only had a shower cubicle, sink and toilet with room for one person only. However, what made up for this was the view from our peronal terrace over the Colleseum with St Peter's viewable in the background. The hotel had a small bar which was quite cosy but they were fine with us taking drinks to the room (to have on the terrace). We actually did see a couple bring a bottle of wine in and get the hotel to open it without charging any corkage! We were on the Bed and Breakfast option which was a typical continental breakfast of coffee, tea, juices, pastries, cold meats with various condiments. Did the job for us!!! In terms of location this place could not be better. It is 5 minutes walk from the Colleseum and from there you can easily get to the Forum and Monumento a Vittorio Emmanuelle II. There is also a Metro station right by the Colleseum so we got a 3 day pass and used that to get around Rome. The Metro is really easy to use and I would recommend this. There are also plenty of bars and restaurants around the hotel (the nearer to the Colleseum you get the more expensive) so you don't have to venture too far out too find something to eat. Overall, I would recommend staying at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Hotel Lancelot!”
Reviews.Author: eam12
Reviews.Content: Hotel Lancelot was WONDERFUL. It was by far our favorite hotel in Italy. Extremely clean, nice rooms, good location, very friendly staff. I highly recommend reserving dinners up front... Great food and wonderful value.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent All Around”
Reviews.Author: DMMoore
Reviews.Content: Just returned from an excellent trip to Rome. My wife stayed at the Lancelot as part of a work trip and we continued our stay when I arrived for our vacation. The staff was extremely helpful with every detail, from restaurant recommendations, to helping us arrange a tour of the Vatican, to logistics of catching a bus in Rome, to helping us find boxes at the last minute. The staff was a joy to work with. The hotel serves a family style dinner each night that you can join by letting the staff know the day you want to eat. The food is spectacular. A grand feast. The location is excellent and within easy walking distance to the Colosseum, the forum, Capitoline Hill, Palantine Hill, and more. Multiple banks nearby for easy ATM withdraws and excellent dining. The rooms are small as is to be expected in an older hotel in Italy but everything is kept immaculate. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Little gem behind the Coliseum”
Reviews.Author: CHN_GetAway_Guy
Reviews.Content: The name says England but the place is pure Rome. It's a great find on a quiet, narrow street, a four-minute walk from the Coliseum and Palatine Hill. Our group took about 15 rooms. The arrangements ahead of time went smoothly, and upon arrival, they were well prepared for us. The only surprise was that a motorcoach can only get within two blocks (but that helps with the seclusion). We encountered five different people running the front desk on the various shifts during our three days. Each was extremely friendly and quite helpful with typical tourist questions. There is a large sitting room adjacent to the dining room with a piano and plenty of reading material. There is a small bar off of which is a smaller library and an enclosed patio. On the top floor is a garden terrace with a postcard view of apartments, the Coliseum, and St. Peter's in the distance. The only things to be aware of (which are not really problems) are that the elevator covers six floors but only holds four people, and only cold items are served for breakfast. Regardless, this will be my hotel the next time I am in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “A piece of the British Empire in the heart of Rome”
Reviews.Author: ArtistJames
Reviews.Content: Step into a piece of the British-Indian Empire with the gracious Kahn family. It’ll make you stand up straight and smile. LOCATION: In a big city like Rome, you can either pay a fortune to stay in the pulse of the tourist center, or a little less to stay in a quiet, but accessible neighborhood. Hotel Lancelot’s the quiet neighborhood. The metro’s within walking distance, just make sure you use the rare set of pedestrian crosswalks and lights to get there. The traffic’s a bit crazy as you approach the Colosseum. Save yourself some trouble by purchasing your metro tickets at the hotel’s front desk—only one euro each. ARRIVING AND DEPARTING: We took a cab from Termini station to the hotel (with baggage) for a 15 euro ride. Our pre-dawn ride from the hotel to Leonardo da Vinci airport cost 50 euro. ROOMS: Our room was pretty small, but spotless and surprisingly quite functional. The tiny bathroom had a great shower, the little terrace a spectacular view. Honestly, our only complaint was the micro-sized single garbage can in the room. If you are feeling a bit cramped with your loved one in your small room, make use of the wonderful… COMMON AREAS: We loved the many comfortable sitting nooks on the main floor. Since the free wireless internet didn’t work so great on our fifth floor, I took my laptop downstairs in the evenings to catch up with friends and family back home. We purchased snacks and Diet Coke at a little neighborhood grocery, and hotel staff provided me with glasses and ice from their bar. BREAKFAST: A lovely space to fuel for the day with standard breakfast breads, yogurts, cereal, juices and coffee. Our English friends said the tea didn’t quite meet their standards, but to us it was all very much British fun. We never ate dinner at the hotel (too many great restaurants in the neighborhood) but the smells from the kitchen severely tempted us each evening. CONCLUSION: In the middle of the wonderful craziness of Rome, you’ll appreciate the quiet class of the Kahn family’s wonderful hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very Comforable”
Reviews.Author: inredondo
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed at the Hotel Lancelot the last week of October for 3 nights. We found the hotel very comfortable and accommodating. After a flight from Los Angles through JFK to Rome we arrived at 7:00 am in the morning. We had arraigned for the hotel to pick us up. We were picked up on time with no problems and were delighted that the hotel had our room ready for us! They even offer us breakfast on arrival. There is a bank around the corner which was very handy to get Euros. The only thing that was a problem is that our room faced the street which is very very noisy at night, with mopeds, people laughing and noise from trash pick ups. So, I would advise getting a room facing the inside court yard if you need quite at night. Even though they don’t have the nice patio terrace we had. We would absolutely stay there again if we get the opportunity.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent choice when in Rome”
Reviews.Author: PEIVisitor
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a five day visit to Rome, tagged on to the end of a Mediterranean cruise.I often rely on Trip Advisor for testimonials from travelers to help me in making traveling decisions. Having read such positive feedback on the Lancelot Hotel we booked our stay. Once again, your readers comments are bang on! This is a great little Hotel. Very clean, comfortable and very helpful and friendly staff. I think the best part was the option for eating dinner in the dining room in the evening. After a long day of touring in Rome, it was perfect. Wonderful food, service and the opportunity to meet fellow travelers from all over the world. This Hotel was a GREAT experience.

Reviews.Title: “Stay at Hotel Lancelot”
Reviews.Author: Fabi-JP
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Lancelot for four days in late september, on our first ever trip to Rome. We arrived in the morning and were invited to have breakfast before our room was ready. Breakfasts were plentiful and excellent. Our room was on the fifth floor, overlooking the inner courts of neighbor residences. The room was small but clean, comfortable and quiet. We chose the half-board option based on comments from other TripAdvisor members. Dinner was served every night at 19h30. The menu was posted earlier at the front desk, but we never bothered to look at it, so every dish was a pleasant surprise. In our opinion, the cuisine, wine and service were very good, excellent values. Dinners also provided opportunities to meet very nice people from Australia, England, Ireland, France and USA. Although there were many restaurants nearby, at the end of the day, it was always nice to come back to the hotel for a "family" dinner, which ranks among the highlights of our trip. The hotel is located in the southern part of the historic city, within walking distance of all major sights. For non-walkers, the bus stop is just down the street, from where the #81 bus line goes north to Vatican City, with many stops along the way. Tickets are available at the front desk for 1euro per ride. The staff at the front desk was friendly, helpful and efficient. They provided worthy advice on bus and train transport. We definitely felt welcomed there. Hotel Lancelot met or exceeded our high expectations. We would go back anytime !

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean hotel, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: anitajd
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Lancelot for 4 nights after the Easter Holidays. My friend recenlty asked about my experience there, and I realized I hadn't written a review. Our family of 5 found the hotel conveniently located to the Colleseum, Palatine Hill, and the Roman Forum, as well as the metro stop near the Colleseum. I like the fact the hotel was in a quiet neighborhood. Our room also had a street-side balcony, and there was no noise that bothered us. The room had a large queen bed, and 2 singles. The room was definitely large enough for our family. The shower was very small though. Breakfast was plentiful, but for the first time while traveling around Europe, we found the selection not really to our liking. On our 1st evening, we ate dinner at the hotel, and found it to be delicious. I can't say I *loved* the hotel, but it did provide good value and comfort and location for our trip to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “great holiday-lovely people”
Reviews.Author: we2Ireland
Reviews.Content: We have just returned home from a very enjoyable 6 day trip to Rome,where we stayed at the Lancelot.A number of our family and friends had stayed there previously and had recommended it very highly.We would also recommend it to other friends as we enjoyed it so much.Mrs Khan,her family and staff made us feel very welcome and were extremely helpful with our many queries about locations,bus routes etc.The location,near the Colosieum and St. John Laterans is good for buses and metro. Breakfast was good and was an opportunity to chat with other guests and to exchange experiences of different places to visit in the wonderful Holy City.We only ate dinner in the hotel one evening,as there are so many other places to eat in Rome.The dinner we had there was a superb meal and was made more enjoyable with the company of other guests at the table. When we return to Rome we will stay at the Lancelot again

Reviews.Title: “Good but not Great,”
Reviews.Author: Capthrash
Reviews.Content: The good: The hotel is located in a relatively nice area near the Colloseum with easy access to the subway. The staff were friendly and helpful, and the hotel is well maintained and somewhat charming. Breakfast is included, which is helpful. They have a computer you can use for a few Euros per hour. The bad: Like many hotels in Italy, noise is a problem. Other guests, mostly older Americans, can be loud and insensitve. Outside noise is also a problem if you stay at the back of the hotel as neighborhood residents chat in their back yards or on balconies. Rooms are cleaned to an Italian standard, so don't expect a spotless room at the end of the day.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing!!”
Reviews.Author: Harry1Melbourne
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel after reading Trip Advisor's favourable reports and were very unhappy! Yes the staff are pleasant and I guess helpful, but 3 times we reported a leaking toilet that was never fixed. The room we had was at the back of the hotel with the smallest bathroom I have ever seen, too small to even dry oneself in, and I am not a big person!! When we arrived in our room I noticed that the floor was dusty and the used soap from the previous occupant was still in the shower (which makes me wonder how thoroughly the place was cleaned). The T.V. screen was also tiny. Would have appreciated extras like tissues and glasses, not plastic cups! I had to request a change of sheets after 3 days. The worst thing though was the hotel was full of very, very loud Americans. So much for a quiet drink at the bar!We ate dinner one evening which was average, and breakfast was dreadful. I really am at a loss as to how people could rate this place so highly!

Reviews.Title: “A good choice”
Reviews.Author: FrandDa
Reviews.Content: We stayed for six nights in September. It is a very nice hotel. Very clean. Will come back!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic and very friendly hotel. coeliac's well catered for”
Reviews.Author: maria525
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for a week recently and hed a really pleasant experience. It is right by the colloseum so from the balcony you have that lit up colloseum as your view. The food was marvellous and very very reasonably priced. I am coeliac and they understood and dealt with my allergies and produced really lovely and safe food for me. That was just one good example of the way that the family run hotel dealt with people there. It seamed to me that nothing was too much trouble and I watched them look after all people (including diabled visitors ) beautifully , always going the extra mile to help out . It was clean in all areas and I would reccomend this hotel and the location

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: halsalltraveller
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a six day visit to rome staying at Hotel Lancelot in capo d'africa. The hotel had made the arrangements for me to be picked up at the airport by their recommended driver, so no worries about taxi fares,what had been quoted was the price I was charged, he was there on time and gave a very good commentary on the various sites we passed. I received the usual very warm welcome by the hotel reception staff and the desk formalities were completed quickly and efficiently. My room on the 4th floor overlooked the rear courtyard and was furnished with several antique pieces. It was complete with air conditioning, TV , internet connection, hair dryer. Breakfast at the hotel is buffet style with a variety of meats, cheese, cereals yoghurts and fresh fruit and the evening meal is three courses including wine and coffee. People with special dietry needs were catered for. during my stay five people celebrated birthdays and they were surprised at dinner with sparkling baked alaskas accommpanied with appropriate music and champagne for all guests!!! Ideally situated close to the Colosseum, the Forum, Domus Aurelius, San Clemente and San Giovanni in Laterano, Baths of Caracala and Circus Maximus. If walking is not your 'thing' there are excellent transport facilities, bus tram within two minutes walk and the Metro about 5 minutes away.
