Over the years that I have stayed at the Lancelot I have met people from all over the world, many of them like myself are return visitors, the visitors book is fascinating to read and makes the world so much smaller. Whilst I have been there this September The New English Orchestra and choir were staying there and the management arranged for them to give a free performance for the guests, what a bonus!! For me and I know for many the Lancelot is THE only hotel to stay at in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “So disappointed we moved”
Reviews.Author: CTHistprof
Reviews.Content: We booked the Lancelot for a six night stay in June. I don't have anything terrible to say about the place. I don't have anything wonderful to say about it either. And to be frank, I think the rave reviews it has received are very exaggerated. We are a married couple in our early forties stealing a couple of weeks away from the kids. We stayed at Ca' Angeli in Venice and in Antica Torre di via Tornabouni in Florence and loved them both. We expected to love the Lancelot too. We didn't. I'll start with the positive, to give the management their due. The room was clean, breakfast was good, and the library and TV lounge were pleasant enough. We had dinner at the hotel one night, and had a lovely time with a family that I ended up visiting in India a month later. The staff was highly professional, if very busy, and fixed a broken phone and a running toilet in our room promptly. The neighborhood has one good traditional neighborhood restaurant and there is an Indian place not far away (we were a bit sick of pasta by that time). So why did we move? First of all, whoever says this place is centrally located is just full of it. It is close to the Coliseum, but on the other side of it from the rest of the attractions of Rome. It is a long, and, in June, hot walk back home from anywhere else, even the far side of the forum. In March we might not have minded, but in June we definitely did. We ended up moving to the Albergo Santa Chiara, which was one of the most centrally located hotels in Rome, from which we could walk anywhere. Also, this is not a boutique hotel or anything like it. It is larger than that, and is patronized largely by tour groups of senior citizens who like the English speaking ownership and staff. Indeed, the tour operators are so familiar with the place that they will step behind the desk and try to help out when no one else is there. For these folks and for the families with children, the place is great. For us, not so much. Our room was quite small and in no way remarkable. It had a few pieces of beat up furniture and a TV. We had a balcony with two chairs, but it was hot out so we didn't use it. The bathroom was so tiny that it had a folding door. Forget trying to get more than one person into the bathroom. Also, the plumbing stack ran right through the wall between our bedroom and bathroom, which meant that we could hear a cascade of water every time the folks in the rooms above us flushed or took a shower. We could also hear every conversation in the hallway. Basically this meant that we didn't sleep for an hour after we turned off the light, until the folks at the bar downstairs went back to their rooms and settled down for the night. And we were awake with the first shower of the morning. But more than anything else, I remember wondering what exactly we were paying for. It wasn't location. It wasn't privacy and a romantic decor. There wasn't anything special about this place. So we paid a bit more and moved to the Santa Chiara, which had a bigger, quieter room, a much better location, more elegant common spaces, and where we felt like we were in Rome, not London.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: Masna
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just come back from a ten day stay at the Lancelot last Sunday night. We had a room on the first floor with terrace and fairy lights overlooking the street. Only downside was that at about seven each morning the bin and bottle men came to empty the containers in the street. This made a huge noise. Not the hotel's fault but it saved us using an alarm clock! Mrs Khan and staff very friendly and helpful. Receptionists are beautiful and friendly. We took a trip to Hadrian's villa and Tivoli and the receptionist ran off the times of the metro and trains there and back for us. They sell bus tickets at reception and as the stops are nearby we used the bus many times. Lots of places to eat nearby which meant that you could just walk back to the hotel. We were collected at the airport by Giovanni who was very proud of his city and told us a lot of the history. He also took us back to the airport and the fare each way was fifty euros. Bed and pillows very, very comfortable. The air conditioning in the room worked well and as the temperature was in the nineties all the time we were there we were very glad of it. Yes, the bathroom was small but the shower was a double one and all facilities worked fine. We ate at the hotel twice in the evening and enjoyed the meal and company of other guests. Mrs Khan's son does the cooking. Breakfasts were good with a choice to fit all tastes. The wine served at dinner was Lambrusco and it's been a long time since we had drunk this wine. Beward of pickpockets and conmen in Rome. My husband had a map pinched from his back pocket at the Forum and we had an interesting encounter with a Frenchman in a car who said he worked for Valentino and offered us a jacket each - worth one thousand euros by the way! He then said he needed money for fuel to get to Milan. He had worked hard on his story and it must work for him. We also heard of two people who had travelled in on the bus with us, one had a crutch with them. and then develped badly turned in feet when in place on the street and begging. If we go back to Rome we would stay at the Lancelot again, it has a family feel about it and is not impersonal like big chain hotels are. The flower arrangements in the public areas and bar are gorgeous too, beautiful. We loved our time there.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel for a Roman Holiday”
Reviews.Author: Maleficent84
Reviews.Content: Four of us stayed at the Hotel Lancelot for 4 nights in August 2008. It was myself, my fiancee and my grandparents who are in their mid 60s. The hotel went above and beyond my expectations. The rooms were small but nice, many of them having personal balconies with views of the Colosseum. The staff were soooo friendly! They would call for taxi's, help us find certain tourist attractions on the map and offered advice for good shopping. The location is superb! Only blocks away from the Colosseum with many pizzeria's and gelatto bars nearby. Or if you wanted to stay in, the hotel would serve a 3 course meal for 25 euro per person, which included wine. I am not a wine person, but fell in love with the wine they served. Upon checking out, Fabrizio gave us a bottle to take home with us as a gift. Now thats what I call good hotel hospitality! When we go back to Rome, we will definately be staying at the Lancelot! (The only negatives I found were the bathrooms were quite small, even for Europe.)

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: DandF68
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip outside the U.S. and we were a little apprehensive about being in a country where we could not speak their language. So we were very concerned about where we should stay. We chose Hotel Lancelot based on the reviews at TripAdvisor and the location. We only had one complete day a part of two other days. Being near the Colesseum made Lancelot a good choice. The room was very nice, clean, and cool. But the very best part was the hotel staff. They made our stay as good as we could have ever hoped for. They provided helpful information concerning places to see, places to eat, and how to get there. There was someone there 24 hours a day. Without a doubt, we would stay at Hotel Lancelot if we ever return to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great Little Hotel with a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: mmunson5
Reviews.Content: My bride and I recently stayed at the Hotel Lancelot. The hotel is a great hotel with a great location close the Coliseum and Palentine Hill. Upon arrival in our rental car, the staff quickly took our bags up to the room and parked our car in the tiny courtyard. The rooms are a bit small for Americans but we found most rooms in the big cities in Italy to be small. The room was clean, cool (it was 90 plus each day in Rome), and perfect location for our adventures into Rome. The staff is amazing and anwered all of our questions to include getting the most out of Rome's buses and subway system. There are bus stops just around the corner and we found them great to get us to the must see spots in Rome. The staff sent up a bottle of complimentary Prosecco since we were just married. A very nice touch from the staff. I highly recommend this hotel for its location, cleanliness, and the staff. I look forward to returning to the Lancelot in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Very Friendly, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: sbedard
Reviews.Content: We stayed here at the end of our trip for 4 nights. It was only 1 or 2 blocks from the Colosseum in a very quiet area. The staff was so friendly. The room was very clean, and the bed was the most comfortable of any hotel we stayed in, in Italy. The A/C also worked great! (which is a rare find it seems in Europe). The hotel sets up family style dinners each night. We ended up eating there 2 of the nights, and it was outstanding. I would stay here next time I am in Rome. On a side note to all travelers: beware of the taxis. We traveled from the train station to the hotel (under 10 min) and besides thinking he was going to crash after SPEEDING through the streets we were charged 40 euro for the trip. Not thinking my mother in-law paid for it. After the cab was long gone we realized we were ripped off, and mentioned it to the hotel owner. Had we told him while the cabbie was there he would have put a stop to the robbery. I found out later you MUST negotiate a price with the cabs prior to getting in. (We did not experience any problems like this in Paris or Florence).

Reviews.Title: “My favourite hotel in Rome.”
Reviews.Author: Ben20
Reviews.Content: Have stayed in Rome many times but this is the friendliest of all the hotels yet. All the other hotels were high quality (4 star plus) and the Lancelot matched them all. What was extremely pleasant was that the quiet evenings and nights were a great change from the usual noisy areas. The hotel was still in a good situation and within walking distance of all the usual sites to visit. On top of all this my husband had to spend an overnight stay in hospital (he is fine now) and the hotel could not have been more helpful and concerned and went way beyond what would be expected of them, even sending food to the hospital. I would recommend this hotel without reservation.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Spot”
Reviews.Author: hj232
Reviews.Content: Great location near the Colloseum and metro. Staff was very nice and the breakfast is good.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good, Still Some Opportunity”
Reviews.Author: Arunda01
Reviews.Content: We chose the Hotel Lancelot in Rome after reading the strong recommendations on Trip Advisor. Our first impression was that the lobby was welcoming - cozy, yet comfortable. Unfortunately, our first interaction with the front-desk clerk did not meet our expectations - after checking in, we asked him for restaurant recommendations, and he said he had none because most restaurants (in Rome) closed in August. He also then tried to push the hotel-group dinner on us, which we declined. I later asked other hotel clerks, and they enthusiastically pointed me to two restaurants in the area (Le Naumache was right around the corner and excellent)! I really don't want to let one hotel clerk dampen our review entirely, but it was disappointing after reading such compliments about the staff on Trip Advisor. With regards to our room - it was a bit 'Spartan' but the airconditioning ran very well (which won my husband over), and the room was cleaned very well every day. I also was satisfied with the breakfast spread - meats, cereals, fruit, etc. The location is good - right by the Colosseum and the Metro stop.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant hotel”
Reviews.Author: 25Irishgirl
Reviews.Content: I could not speak more highly of this hotel. It is very economical, near all the attractions and the hotel staff were extremely helpful and friendly. The hotel is literally a 2 minute walk from the Colluseem and there are loads of great restaurants nearby (Luzzis is the best) plus cash machines.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Lancelot”
Reviews.Author: PT77
Reviews.Content: We travelled to Rome in April 2007 with our 1 and half year old son. We spent 6 nights at the hotel. The hotel staff were very helpful from the time we made our reservations till we chekced out. They were very prompt in getting back to me on any queries I had before we got to Rome. We also took the Limo service that the hotel arranged for us. The hotel staff went the extra way to accomodate the needs of a toddler. We were able to buy some milk and save it on the refrigerator in the kithcen. They would warm if for us even at 9 PM in the night. The breakfast was good and filling. Very convinient location- near touristy locations, restaurants and bus stop.

Reviews.Title: “Great front desk & location”
Reviews.Author: butterflyHunter
Reviews.Content: Very helpful at the front desk, although did not respond the same day to a problem with the blinds. We were with a group, and the rooms vary greatly in size and layout. Ours had narrow twin beds and a tiny bath, tile floor. Very clean and quiet. A/C was slow to cool.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Rome hotel”
Reviews.Author: italygirlSeattle
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights at the beginning of our vacation to Italy. We had 10 people. We chose this hotel from Trip Advisor review but also for the location near the colisseum. The location is very convenient but also in a little neighborhood with nice restaurants and a gelateria 3 blocks away. We walked down to the colisseum and then you can catch the Metro or a tour bus to other destinations. Mrs. Khan and her staff were very helpful about using transportation and recommending close restaurants. The breakfast is good with cereal, yogurt, meats and cheeses but they only had coffee in urns - no cappuccinos. Because we had so many people we arranged for pick up at the airport and I would recommend this. It is a little more expensive than a taxi but the convenience after a 17 hour flight is worth it. The driver also gave us a lot of information about sites between the airport and the hotel.The rooms are nice with a small bathroom and we had a view of a little garden. This is the quietest hotel I have ever had in Rome - no road noise, sirens or party goers. The staff was very helpful and attentive to our needs. Internet is available for a small fee.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Public Areas”
Reviews.Author: Moonlily
Reviews.Content: The unique thing about Hotel Lancelot for my husband and I were the many areas that were available to sit and relax besides our room. There was a small bar for a soda, wine, beer espresso or simple mixed drinks. One night after a grueling day at Pompeii they provided us with a large bucket of ice, their suggestion. We were thrilled. There are small nooks with books and chairs for lounging, a vine covered garden patio with tables and chairs. There is also a small public terrace on the 6th floor that we used several times. The views were wonderful, but the profusion of patio plants made it necessary to stand to see the Coloseum. But I wouldn't change a thing there. They have one of the largest jade plants that I have seen that wasn't in a florist shop. There are several other alcoves that have books and magazines to look at...if one had the time. Great for people watching. There is ample opportunity to watch guests come and go. There was a mix of couples, families, and I saw one tour group while we were there. Our room had a queen bed with a comfortable mattress, the pillows and linens were all fresh smelling and crisp. There was a desk and chair along with an occasional chair. The floors were wood laminate and slippers were provided. While it was unseasonably hot for the last few days in Rome, our room stayed comfortable with the cross ventilation provided by having the windows in the room and bathroom open. I saw and swatted one mosquito. The bathroom while small, was very clean and quite adequate for our needs. Complete sets of towels were provided and the complemntary toiletries were nice quality. A hair dryer was provided. The Breakfast is served in a common dining area furnished with large round tables. We never had a problem finding a seat. And it was an enjoyable way to meet other guests. The breakfast selection provided was wonderful, seasonal fruits, yogurt, pastries, hard rolls, cereals. Several juices and very good coffee. They had sliced meats and cheeses and several interesting packaged meat spreads. You would have to be a very picky eater to not find something to satisfy. We had dinner one night and were very pleased with the set menu. For 25 Euros a person we had a pasta, main dish and dessert. That night it was pasta with black truffle sauce, Chicken Saltimbocca, roasted potatoes and chocolate mousse. A bottle of red and a bottle of white wine was provided for each table and was more than enough. After dinner espesso was also served. We noticed no reluctance of the staff to suggest places to eat. I do suggest being specific about what you are interested in eating as that will elicit a more specific answer. There are many places to eat in the vicinity. The Hotel Lancelot was a big change from the "matchy matchy" Hotel chains I am used to in the states. Even the upscale hotels here tend to look the same on every floor. The furnishings in Hotel Lancelot were well cared for but varied. The Buffet in the dining room had crystal and serving pieces you would expect to see in someones home. There were fresh flower arrangements and interesting dried arrangements. There were decorative knicknacks that seemed to be selected as a personal statement rather than by "design". Our stay at Hotel Lancelot was very enjoyable. The family that runs the Hotel seems to have found a way to provide a refined yet casual air that seems to be comfortable for a wide variety of travelers. It is not at all stuffy. You might see a couple leaving to go to the opera while another pair is arriving with backpacks and guide books in hand. Our stay was delightful and we would very much like to return

Reviews.Title: “One of our favorite stays in Europe”
Reviews.Author: Tripper101
Reviews.Content: We visited 5 cities in Europe, consulting www.tripadvisor.com all the way. This was one of our favorite choices. Small, but not so small to seem isolated. Close to Luizzi's, an excellent local restaurant. THere was always a long waiting list of locals there, so go early. Kind, helpful staff. Small intimate bar. We had room 10 which had a large plant filled balcony. We were within walking distance to the Coliseum, which we took the kids to at night to play and also got gelato around the corner. Nice sized room at a good price. Great atmosphere, really pleased with this hotel and would go again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice in Rome.”
Reviews.Author: Lindabird16
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Lancelot is a very nice place to stay in Rome. The area is safe and very quiet but is close to the Colesseum (sp?) and to the Metro and bus stops. There are many good restaurants within walking distance and a very nice grocery store nearby in case you run out of anything or just wish to "eat in". The staff were extremely helpful and friendly not matter what you need. They originally showed us a room not as requested and immediately changed it to one that was perfect. Would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great customer service”
Reviews.Author: melissa326
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights in April 2008 and had a great stay. This hotel is in a nice neighborhood within an easy walk to the Colosseum. Front desk staff speaks excellent English and is very helpful. They even lent us an umbrella on a rainy day. After we left this hotel and travel on to Florence, my grandfather died and we needed to quickly return home. We were stuck back in Rome for a night before our flight left and called Hotel Lancelot to see if we could return to the hotel. Though they were completely booked, they called around to other hotels in the area and a few hours later they found a room for us. Since we spoke no Italian and were trying to find a hotel room while on a train to Rome, this was extremely helpful! Great customer service! Our room was very clean and quiet and had a nice balcony. This hotel is on a very quiet street. The room was big by European standards. Breakfast was convenient and fine. We did not eat dinner at the hotel. Staff is somewhat reluctant to recommend restaurants because they want you to eat at the hotel, but we didn't have any problems finding good places to eat.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and staff!”
Reviews.Author: jkw2765
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights after reading all the TripAdvisor recommendations after a cruise. It was a little difficult to find, but once there it met up to its expectations. The staff goes above and beyond what I have ever experienced at a hotel to make sure you have everything that you need. They were extremely helpful and courteous every time we asked a question or needed directions. The hotel itself is very clean and the AC units work well. We ate dinner all 3 nights at the hotel and the food was excellent. At the end of a long day, it was nice knowing where we were going to eat, what we were going to pay and that the food was going to be good. Overall it was a truly wonderful place to stay and we would definitely stay there again if we are lucky enough to find ourselves in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Just book this hotel”
Reviews.Author: AliaBritishColumbia
Reviews.Content: This is quite simply a great place to stay. The hotel itself has a great location- is very charming and beautiful with marble everywhere and it has a boutique hotel feel without the snobby staff. The staff are very pleasant and professional at the same time. We felt very safe walking in the neighbourhood- there are a couple of inexpensive restaurants nearby that the staff will tell you about. We are a family of three and had room 65 on the top floor- no terrace as they were all booked but you can use the public one just down the hall- very tiny but cozy and beautiful with plants and flowers- get a glass of wine from downstairs enjoy.My only complaint was that we only had 2 nights- I would have liked to try the dinner downstairs...we will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Felt at-home at the Lancelot”
Reviews.Author: RunningTourist
Reviews.Content: Our family of three just returned from Rome, where we spent three nights at the Hotel Lancelot. Owner Farris Khan was one of the first of many hotel family and staff members who greeted us during our stay. We had a triple room with a terrace on the first floor, which was absolutely paying the extra 10 euros/night for. We paid 210 euros/night for the room and I have to say that it was well worth what we paid for. Farris and staff answered our many questions about safety, sightseeing tips, ATM suggestions, etc. Farris will give you an "orientation" of how to tour Rome on your own, which made our experience even better. One night, we bought some ham, fresh mozzarella, bread, vegetables and beverages at the nearby alimentari (grocery store) and had a wonderful meal out on our terrace. The room was simple and clean with comfortable beds and pillows. We enjoyed the fresh fruit (kiwis, pears, bananas) at breakfast, along with the meats, breads, cheeses, yogurts and cereals. My family is very mobile so we walked everywhere. We'd sightsee in the morning (walked to the Coliseum), go back to the Hotel Lancelot for a siesta (during the heat of day), and walk out again in the afternoon/evening (Palatine Hill/Roman Forum). Rome is a very walkable city and, while the drivers there may seem a bit crazy to us Americans, they will stop when they see you crossing the streets.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: DYK
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights at the Hotel Lancelot in the middle of June. We booked it based on reviews in Trip Advisor and we were not disappointed. The hotel is very clean and well outfitted, the staff is friendly and helpful, and the breakfasts were great. We had dinner in the hotel one night and it was very well done--the risotto was the best we'd had in a long time. The hotel is located about two blocks from the Coliseum (you can see it from the front rooms) and is very convenient for accessing buses. They also have a small room with a computer so guests can access the internet at a very reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “The most wonderful hotel in all of Rome”
Reviews.Author: EvelynZiegler
Reviews.Content: I found Lancelot hotel after visiting TripAdvisor website. Initially, we wanted to stay at another recommended hotel on TripAdvisor around the Trastevere area but we settled on this one instead due to its extremely good reviews. I called the hotel directly and the beautiful Lorena, one of the hotel staff, helped us secure a room for 2 weeks. We also asked for 2 separate pickups from the airport to the hotel since that my boyfriend and I would be arriving at different times, from different locations. Every email we sent was responded within 24 hours. So, we really had high expectations already even before getting there. My plane landed at 6am and 45 minutes later (after the immigration check point and luggage retrieval), I was greeted by the cheerful and friendly Giovanni, the suited driver who drove me to the hotel in a BMW. He was very amused when I tried to speak the little Italian that I knew. He drove around town, stopped at many famous places, and explained to me in details about the history of the places even though he didn't have to do that. All the tiredness from the 12 hour straight flight from Malaysia vanished after seeing how beautiful Rome was (though I noticed that Rome has quite a bit of graffiti on the walls of buildings, then again, I think that is a problem everywhere in major cities in the world). Giovanni's humour and friendliness made me feel very comfortable as I was traveling alone to a country that I have never been to. Later that evening, he picked up my boyfriend from the airport, arriving from United States. I arrived at the hotel around 7.30am and was welcomed by Michael, another staff of the hotel. I was told that I couldn't check in then because the room was not ready yet. It was peak time of the year for tourism in Italy, so I expected that they still had tenants in the room. I was given a complimentary breakfast while waiting for the room to get ready. The breakfast was good. A typical continental breakfast with bread, croissants, butter, cheese, different kinds of cured meat, yogurt, fresh fruits, different kinds of breakfast cereal, coffee, tea, 2 kinds of fruit juice, etc. It might not please everyone's appetite but it definitely wouldn't make you hungry till lunch time. The tables were round, and you share it with other tenants. I found this very interesting. You get to meet people from all over the world. I waited at the cozy lounge and by 11am, my room was ready. Michael escorted me to my room at top floor, saying that I was given one of their nicest rooms. Room #65 had a decent size and smelled fresh. The bathroom was slightly small, but it was not like we were going to spend most of our time in it anyway. The shower was powerful and there was a bathtub, if you preferred to take a bath instead. I have a problem with allergies and some hotels that I have been to would make me sneeze uncontrollably. But that was not the case with Lancelot Hotel. The whole place was beautiful and spotlessly clean. I didn't get an allergy attack at all. My boyfriend and I booked for a double room without a terrace and we didn't expect to get a nice view out of our window. It turned out that we've got a fantastic view of the Colosseum out of our window! And there was a public terrace that we could use on the same floor also, which was fantastic. The television had channels like CNN, Sky News, CCTV (China), a German channel, and some local channels. The personal air conditioning system really helped to cool you off from the heat. At first, we were really worried about laundry because we knew it could get very expensive. Before we got there, we searched for a laundry service in Rome on the internet and found out that it was located far away. We definitely didn't want to drag our dirty clothes to get there. We decided to use the hotel's laundry service. The price was affordable and freshly laundered clothes were sent the next morning. The price of each clothing can be found in the drawer with the telephone on top next to the bed. Another thing that we really appreciated about the room was that it was brightly lit. The shutters outside the window blocked out the sunlight in the morning in case we chose to sleep in. Also, our room was very quiet. No noise from the street below (if you shut your windows), no noise from the room next door. The hotel staff were very helpful. Lorena gave us suggestions where to eat around the area. The gorgeous Annalisa looked through the newspapers and internet to find a movie that we wanted to watch as well as theatres that showed English movies in its original version. Most foreign movies would be dubbed into Italian, in case you'd want to see one. Metropolitan Cinema is one of the very few cinemas who showed movies in its original language. I misplaced my phone charger once and Annalisa helped me recharged the battery in the office. The kind Michael helped my boyfriend with his tie before we went to the Opera. Everyone at the hotel helped us to get around and book for tours or visits. They also gave good suggestions. We had dinner together once at the hotel. The menu was posted at the front desk or in the lift every morning, and we had to inform the staff in advance should we want to have dinner there. It was a 3 course meal, complete with wine and coffee. The meal was fantastic. As usual, we shared the table with other people (2 couples from Norway and an Irish lady). It was a very pleasing affair. They also had a bar which we spent some nights drinking wines or champagnes. The hotel is located not far away from the Colosseum, and yet it has a very private feeling to it. We didn't find the place noisy or crowded at all considering its proximity to one of the most famous monuments in the world. The front gate was always locked, making us feel secured. The map that the hotel gave was very detailed, we never got worried about getting lost since the Colosseum would always lead us back to the hotel. We walked down the road to the very end (about 2 blocks away) and there was the Colosseum on the other side of the road! There was a taxi stand on our side of the road. But we usually called one from the hotel. Otherwise, we would just cross the road to the Colosseum and walked to the right side to get to the Metro station or the bus stop. The Colosseo station was just 2 stops away from Roma Termini (main station). We bought the bus tickets (can also be used for Metro and trams) at the hotel's front desk, otherwise we would buy it at a Tabacchi store at the station. There were many restaurants across the Colosseum, we tried some of them. The rule of thumb we found out about Rome was: The larger the store front is, the more expensive the food is, the more terrible the service is, the more horrible the food tastes. Honestly! Especially the ones directly in front of major touristic sites. There is an exception though. There is a cafe right in front of the Pantheon, directly on the left side of the fountain if you're facing the Pantheon. We went to this place just to sit around for a cup of tea, but we ended up eating. The food there was great! I was coughing when I sat at the table and the very funny and friendly waiter immediately brought me a glass of water. The service there was fantastic. I tried the chamomile tea and it soothed my throat. My boyfriend didn't hesitate to leave him quite a huge tip. Tips: 1. Taxis in Rome can be quite costly. We noticed that it's way cheaper to take a taxi in Milan than in Rome. Always take the certified metre taxi, otherwise you could be conned into paying more, unless you know how much to bargain. 2. Always buy your bus/Metro tickets at the front desk. Save you the hassle. 3. It cost 25 Euro per pax for a dinner at the Hotel. I can tell you that it is WAY cheaper with a better value than most classy restaurants. 4. Giovanni charged me 60 Euro for the pickup from the airport (night time charges applied because I arrived before 7 am). My boyfriend was charged 50 Euro. It was well worth the money. 5. Most shops close at 9pm. Some restaurants open until midnight. We found that the McDonald's inside the Rome Termini was open until midnight. Lancelot was our HOME for 2 weeks. Our stay at Lancelot Hotel made the trip the most wonderful time we have ever had. All the other good things said about this hotel are TRUE. The 180 Euro per night we spent was worth every single cent, in comparison to the more posh hotel across Lancelot. Lancelot is not one of those hotels which makes you feel as though you mean business to them. Lancelot really makes you feel at home. We absolutely definitely will stay here again. Evelyn from Malaysia and Mike from United States.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel is just a two star accomodation”
Reviews.Author: MarianaG
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Lancelot for a week. Pluses are the terraza rooms overlooking the coloseum, staff, and free WIFI. The hotel cost $300/ night. The breakfast is the same everyday and it gets crowded in the dining room. The hotel is used by as a departure point and return point for people on cruises and thus the ebb and flow of tourists. Our bed was a double and it was OK. It is not a bed you want to spend any time in, just sleep. The bathroom was small, like a sink, a toilet, and ultra-small shower. The room had a safe which was good. We left a computer in a dresser and never had any problems with theft. Laundry is cheap and done quickly by hotel staff. The room is not set up to work, there is no desk, just antique furniture and dressers. The neighborhood is OK. There are lots of restaurants but you need to watch out for tourist traps. One place had the audacity to charge us 6E for a beer. The gelato is great!!!! I liked the non-tourist neighborhood behind Via Nazionale. Walk to the taxi stands if you need one. The hotel did not impress us.

Reviews.Title: “We loved this place!”
Reviews.Author: heiho
Reviews.Content: I cannot recommend this hotel highly enough! This was the perfect place to stay in Rome - just a few blocks from the Colosseum and Roman Forum, and an easy walk to most other attractions. Mrs. Kahn and her staff were friendly and accommodating even from my first email inquiring about rooms. Our room was good-sized, very clean and new with a nice bathroom, comfy bed, and even a small balcony. Staff seemed to go out of their way to be friendly and helpful, whether it was to call a taxi, help us find a restaurant, decipher a map, or tell us the day's weather forecast. Before we arrived, they gave us detailed instructions on how to most easily get there, and even specified which kind of taxi to take from the train station (metered) and the approximate cost (we narrowly escaped being charged three times the price, so were very grateful for the information). Dinner at Hotel Lancelot was 25 Euros per person, which included a 3 course meal, wine, and coffee. We sat at "round tables" with other guests, and shared stories of our travels at the end of the day. The Hotel Lancelot was one of the highlights of our trip. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!!!!”
Reviews.Author: richsea
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Lancelot for 4 nights post-cruise. What a fantastic little hotel! The rooms are spotless, as is the rest of the hotel. It's located 3 blocks from the Colosseum & near public transportation. The management & staff cannot do enough for their guests, & all with a smile!. Breakfast is included, which consists of pastries, breads, cereals, coffee & tea. Each evening they have a 3 course dinner with a daily preset menu for 25 euros each that is great. Seating is family style which is a nice way to meet your fellow guests, & the food is excellent! We arrived early for our stay (before noon) & since our room wasn't ready, they sat us in their small lounge & provided free coffee, tea, & pastries; & just made us feel comfortable. If your looking for a well located, professionally run hotel that has not forgotten that they deal with people, this is the hotel to book!

Reviews.Title: “Lancelot! Excellent value for your money!”
Reviews.Author: shipwreck
Reviews.Content: After reading many reviews I selected the Hotel Lancelot and I can honestly say I wasn't disappointed! My friend and I spent 11 nights there arriving on May 30 and left on June 10th. Though the rooms are a bit small they are extremely clean and the beds are comfortable. We were lucky enough to be given a room with a balcony and very much enjoyed sitting out there in the evening! Everyone at the hotel is very helpful and friendly. One of the owners even took time to hilight on the map a two hour evening walk for us! Breakfast is plentiful with a good variety of buns, cakes, cereals and even a few different types of meats. Fruit is also available. The location couldn't be better! It is close to everything! Always be aware and on the lookout for pickpockets! Keep your purse close to you with your hand over the zipper when in crowded areas. It's harder to rob someone who is alert!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value and Location”
Reviews.Author: trendytraveler11
Reviews.Content: Best location we could pick for what we did. Bus stop is right there and you can walk to the Metro. The staff was helpful and nice. The rooms were nice and clean. We got a balcony which was beautiful. A little loud since the walls are thin, but nothing that bothered us. I would definitely pick this place again if I was staying in Rome and recommend it to all of my friends/family.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Lovely Place”
Reviews.Author: hamletjay
Reviews.Content: I read lots of Trip Advisor reviews before I chose The Lancelot. I couldn't have been more pleased. There is no better location in Rome than the Ancient City, and this hotel is 2 blocks from the Coliseum. I took a taxi from Termini Station (although you can take the Metro to the Coliseum stop-I didn't want to pull my suitcases that far). The Metro Station is 2 blocks from the Coliseum on the opposite side--and the Coliseum is Enormous. There is an elevator in the hotel, and the staff is amazingly helpful in obtaining reservations and offering suggestions for travel around the city. The breakfasts are very good, there's a bar up in front plus a nice sitting room, and my room was exactly what I needed. I was traveling alone, and felt very safe there, they have a locked gate and there's always someone welcoming you at the front desk. The area around the hotel is great for walking-lots of intimate restaurants and a couple of great gelato shops. In the ancient city, I strongly suggest a private tour--the 1/2 day I spent with a History/Art History Guide was worth the 3 other days of time spent learning my way around on my own. (and very worth the $$). The Vatican is another place I'd definitely hire a guide--there are 2-3 hour lines outside all the time, and even in a group tour it's very difficult to keep up, as they shuffle you thru like cattle. I'd recommend a Roma Pass, as you get right in to the Coliseum (one place you don't need a guide) and the Borghese Museum (although Definitely have the hotel make your reservation there a month ahead of time) plus your bus/train pass is included for 3 days. You can go anywhere on the buses without really being lost because the "Coliseo" stop is always going to lead you right back "home". Thank you to all the people at the Lancelot for taking great care to make me feel like a special guest.

Reviews.Title: “Glasgow to Roma May 2008”
Reviews.Author: Louisa67
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel purely on the basis of previous Trip Advisor reports. It was an excellent choice. Stayed for four nights. We were a party of four - one of whom was my 94 year old mother-in-law. Everyone gave it top marks. The rooms were spotless and our room on the first floor had a terrace. This was a boon in the evenings after a full day of sightseeing. We just sat and planned our next day with a bottle of wine. We enjoyed meal times immensely as the company round the table changed every time.... it was so nice to meet other visitors and exchange stories of our time in Rome. The food was excellent (but there was no choice) and a plentiful supply of wine and chilled water was included. Coffee was also included but no tea! Ah well I just had another glass of wine! Staff were wonderful at organising taxis and helping out with info. I would certainly stay at the Lancelot again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: kiwifamily5
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights in early May. We were delighted with this hotel, it is a gem. Right from our first contact with the hotel via email we found them reliable and helpful. They keep very high standards. We are a family of 5 and the hotel agreed to fit an extra bed into a family room. They expressed concern that we would be a bit cramped but in fact it was fantastic. We had a queen size bed, and three singles for our children on the 4 floor. The balcony was lovely, bathroom large and clean and even included a bath which we enjoyed. Location is great, staff very helpful and accomodating, breakfasts very good and plentiful. We also ate the hotel evening meal one night and thoroughly enjoyed the experience. The table were set beautifully with candles and flowers and the food was lovely. We had a car while we were in Rome and the car parking faciilities at Hotel Lancelot were great also. The hotel has a small internet room with a computer that you can access easily. It also has several guest areas with lounge chairs including a library of travel books. The bar is pleasant as is the outdoor garden where you can buy a coffee and enjoy a moments peace before tackling the inevitabel crowds of Rome. One comment I would make about the crowds. Use your mornings and evenings well. We arrived at the Roman Forum at 8.15am ready for it to open at 8.30am. We walked straight in with no queueing. If you go later in the morning you could queue for hours. First thing in the morning or late afternoon are good times for anything that needs queueing. For the Vatican I would definately do a tour - we used Angel Tours and they were fantasitc. Well worth the cost to avoid the queues and to give you some idea of where to start and what to see.

Reviews.Title: “Nice value in Rome's Ancient City”
Reviews.Author: Hi-H0-Silver
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights at the Hotel Lancelot. It is a small to medium size hotel about 3 blocks from the Coliseum. Rooms and common areas are nicely updated. Small but modern bathroom with excellent shower. Breakfast (included) was very good. We did not eat at their restaurant in the evening.

Reviews.Title: “World class service and a Great Bargain”
Reviews.Author: fllyover
Reviews.Content: This is a great bargain. A wonderful staff and excellent location, sparkling clean rooms. The rooms are clean and safe, and the service is as good as we have found anywhere. The staff speaks wonderful English, and is very helpful in helping plan your visit. We will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A nice, pleasant hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Atsa
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Lancelot for six nights at the end of April 2008. We were struggling to find suitable accommodation in a good location but luckily found the Lancelot. We contacted the hotel directly and they were very helpful in arranging our stay (we had to change room for the last night). We opted for the limousine pick-up which was great but make sure you ask for Giovanni - his son took us back to the airport and drove too fast and erractically for us. The location is excellent - a quietish street but only 5 minutes walk from the colosseum. There was absolutely no problem with homeless people or security issues. We had a quadruple room which was very spacious and with a nice balcony. The rooms are clean and spotless as is the rest of the hotel. Our room overlooked the street so we did find it noisy a few nights. On our last night we were facing the rear of the hotel in a triple room (a lot smaller than the quadruple) and this was quieter. Breakfast is all you could ask for and the service very efficient. Dinner looked great but with two young girls it seemed too formal for us. Instead we found restaurants nearby - the best by far in terms of quality and value is La Naumachie, 2 minutes away. For lunch head down a couple of streets to Via Annia and you'll find a great bakery which will make you sandwiches for about a quarter of the price you'll buy them at the tourist sites and they're so much better too! In summary, a great hotel with very friendly, helpful staff and good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Stay & Location”
Reviews.Author: spf0
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed 3 nights in October. The hotel was kind enough to arrange for a driver to pick us up at the airport after arriving from the states. This is an affordable option if you are jet lagged and don't want to deal with a taxi which would run you about the same. Our room was nice & clean and included a balcony which we did not use much. The staff provided us with excellent restaurant recommendations that were nearby. Very good gelato and pizza right in the neighborhood. We enjoyed the quaint hotel bar for a night cap and met some friendly guests. Loved the location -- close to the Colosseum and easy public transportation to get elsewhere like the Vatican. The hotel arranged for a taxi to take us to the train station upon check-out. Overall, a wonderful stay that will not be forgotten!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: Gerlinde8
Reviews.Content: We had just the most amazing time in Rome- and the Hotel Lancelot was part of it! 3 days- too short but long enough to want to come back. I stayed there with my 2 daughters and we all felt very welcome. The room was very clean and well kept. The Hotel has a great location about 5 min away from the Colosseum and everything else is walking distance - at least we thought so. We even walked back from St Peters and it was very enjoyable. I could recommend the hop on hop off bus we saw a lot.We also booked dinner there and we met some very intersting people every night. The food was very nice and the service very good and friendly. Overall I would recommend this hotel to all my friends-

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great staff, great everything!”
Reviews.Author: Lisa1446
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were at the Hotel Lancelot for 3 nights in April, we were able to book the 6th floor terrace room (definitely worth the extra money - amazing view!). The staff was excellent (missed one wake up call, but luckily we were up), and the food was great. The hotel is very charming and we had a wonderful stay. We did not experience the room noise in previous comments. We would definitely stay in this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: psu2kids
Reviews.Content: Extremely courteous staff. Fresh flowers throughout the lobby was a nice touch. We were bothered by road noise as well as noise from adjoining rooms. Convenient location to see Rome. Nice patio off our room--too bad the weather was a little cool to enjoy it. We arrived at the hotel about 10:10 a.m. and received a very welcome cup of coffee while we waited for a short while for our room. Breakfast had lots of choices.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: kezymc
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a 3 night stay at the Lancelot and it was a wonderful experience. The hotel is a little gem, the staff are very friendly and extremely helpful. The round tables are brilliant for meeting other guests and swapping stories. The Colosseum is at the end of the road and the hotel is in the ancient part of the city. It is still close enough to the other parts the Vatican was about 20 mins on a bus in rush hour traffic and we walked most other places. Lots of nice places to eat close by and the staff recommended a lovely little place just up from the Colosseum. Would stay here again and would recommend that you check it out.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Lancelot”
Reviews.Author: JoeVirginia
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Lancelot over Easter and it was wonderful. The staff speaks better english than most Americans :) and could not have been more helpful. They helped us get oriented, designed a walking tour of some places we hadn't known about (but glad we followed their advice) and made us feel more like guests in their home than a hotel. The lobby area is great with small bar and sitting/reading areas. The breakfast spread was simply perfect (coffee was fantastic). We had dinner one night in the hotel and it was very good. Thanks to Faris for passing on some of his great knowledge about Rome. We were traveling with Teens and we had one large room with a double bed and two twins...beds were very comfortable and the housekeeping service was very good. We really liked the surrounding neighborhood as well.

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: theblackhand
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent three nights here; it was a good choice. The hotel is in a small grid of streets near the Colosseum. The area has a good atmosphere despite being 2 minutes walk from a major tourist site. There are some 'local' trattorie and bars as well as some more touristy ones at the Colosseum end. Several fascinating churches are within a few minutes walk. The Palatine, forum and that sort of stuff is 5/10 mins walk, and the centro storico maybe 20 mins. The hotel is quiet and the staff friendly and helpful. The rooms are comfortable. Breakfast is probably as good as it gets in Italy; buffet with juice, cereal, fruit, croissants, rolls, cold meat. Not memorable but perfectly OK. We didn't dine in the hotel; why would you with several resaurants within 2 minutes' walk? We would certainly use this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - I'd recommend it”
Reviews.Author: jimsolan
Reviews.Content: Booked into the Lancelot on the strength of previous tripadvisor reviews. We weren't disappointed. We arrived in the middle of a torrential downpour and the staff recommended we should go straight to the room to dry before checking in. Room was fine, not huge but everything was clean and worked as it should. We had no bath but the shower was a hot and powerful. staff were really friendly although the waitress had a bit of a sulk when we came down for breakfast just after six am in order to catch our flight home, as we were advised to by recepion the previous night. She quickly brought a bowl of fruit out and we breakfasted on that. Other days the breakfast was superb, better than could be expected. We never ate dinner at the hotel, 25 euro pp was out of our range, and we preferred to eat in town. Hotel's in a geat location, near Collisuem but there's also plenty of good eating places nearby. I'd recommend it to others. Good Luck

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: CanadaMoomoo
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights in this hotel. We had a wonderful stay, The staff were very friendly and helpful and spoke perfect englisn, Michael was especially helpful. The breakfast was the best we had while in Italy, and we had dinner there one night , it was delicious. and they will accommodate special diet requirements. i did have one problem, i fell out of the shower, the tub was deep and the glass shower door, it is only a half door., it moves and i did not realize this i fell and actually really hurt myself but not seriously. we would stay here again,

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: Hoppie52
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel with charm. We stayed in a quad room with balcony and views of Colosseum. The staff spoke English and was very helpful, and the breakfast was great. The room was very large and clean and the bathroom was spacious with great water pressure and a large tub. I highly recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “I love this hotel”
Reviews.Author: K-boy
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed 9 nights at the Lancelot in late September and early October, 2007. We wanted to see ALL of Rome and you can't see the wonderful attractions of this city in a couple of days. We met up with friends who were staying at the Pantheon Hotel just off the square in the heart of Rome. They were paying 150 euros more per night than our 170 euros at the Lancelot. There was little difference in the hotels. Our friends said the staff at our hotel was friendlier than the Pantheon. Also our hotel was quiet while the Pantheon is in a very noisy area. We took a few more taxi rides than our friends, but the savings on the Hotel made the 6-8 euro taxi ride seem like a bargain. The hotel is clean, the food great, the staff the best. The Kahn family are native English speakers. They couldn't be nicer. They answered all our questions, arranged a side trip to Tivoli that picked us up at the front door, got us tickets for an Opera concert, recommended restaurants, everything. They even sent me to a dry cleaners around the corner that had everything done up nicely in 24 hours. By being just east of the Coliseum, I thought it would be a little out of the way. As it turned out, the hotels around the Piazza Navona and Pantheon are much more expensive and noisy. We were able to walk to St. John Latern church ( a must see), St Peter's in Chains, The Coliseum, The forum. In addition, San Clemenza church ws just one block away. It is famous for having excavations underneath of two earlier temples. You can visit for 5 euro and it is well worth it. The hotel has 60+ rooms and a small bar. There is a delux hotel across the street (Hotel Capo D'Africa) that is very expensive. It has a fine restaurant if you want to splurge. Dinner at the Lancelot was available for 15 euro. It was a set meal of salad,, pasta, entre, dessert. Very good and so convenient after a long day of sight seeing. Everything, including dinners, tickets, side trip, were all billed to the room and handled with a credit card upon check out. They even arranged for a driver to take us to the airport upon departure at the same price we paid for a taxi coming in. Breakfast is great fun. We sat at one of the round tables and others filled in the empty seats. Soon we were chatting with a couple from Indonesia on their way to a wedding, a dentist from Mexico and his family, a couple from Sweden who joined us on a trip to St. Peter's. This is a great value in a city that can be expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Great little family run hotel”
Reviews.Author: passepartout-tout
Reviews.Content: Myself and a friend stayed at the Hotel Lancelot while in Rome for the Six Nations game between England and Italy. The staff in the hotel were great and couldn't do enough for you. The rooms were very clean and tidy and this cleanliness extended to the general areas as well. (Even the lift was spotless) I really loved the place and am thinking of going back with my family sometime in the summer. I can see why this place is listed 11 out of 1134 in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “peaceful and helpful”
Reviews.Author: dawn5851
Reviews.Content: We arrived early and had a rough plane ride, the lady at the desk had our room made up early and we moved in. The whole hotel is quiet and gorgeous! Breakfast was convenient and fresh. The location is absolutly perfect. We walked just about everyplace and the metro is 2 blks- by the colosseum. I loved that it is a gated property and you are buzzed in and out. we didn't find it noisy even though our room faced the street (but we are city people). We had dinner here on our anniversary and enjoyed it very much. The lounge was calm and we met other nice guests. The staff was extreemly helpful with any questions or request handled immediatly. I didn't write names down and i wish i did. They held our luggage the last day while we did some more touring...very handy. We asked for a room with a tub and did get it, however it came with a hand held shower which was tricky and the floor got very wet so i wouldn't do that again. Overall a bit more pricey than our other 2 hotel on this trip but worth it, recommend for the beginning of your trip do to the location, helpfulness and quiet . Lovely little courtyard for a quick smoke or cocktail, although it rained when we were there alot. Perhaps not the best for families with toddlers and kids under 12. Good night life scene for the 20 something crowd 2 blks away. Tremedous pizza 2 blks down by San Clemete TRUST ME! Good for food on the go, which is tough in Rome. ATM 2 short blks as well. Any questions please feel free to mail.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect in Every Way!!!”
Reviews.Author: romanhols
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived at the airport to be greeted by the Hotel Lancelot's driver I knew this would be a special hotel. The staff are so friendly and attentive and nothing is too much trouble. We arrived at 7am and were greeted with smiles and told our room was available straight away and offered breakfast.....wow a great start that only got better when we were upgraded to the most incredible 6th floor terrace with stunning views of the Collosseum one way and the Cloister the other way (will try and include pictures!)...I still get goosebumps when I remember. The hotel is beautifully decorated and there are so many areas to access-the bar, the restaurant, the courtyard, the library and many more.Our room was a triple and we were surprised to find it very spacious and always spotlessly clean. Breakfast was included and there was a large selection of cereals, rolls, meat and cheeses, sweet rolls, fruit, juices, coffees....and the list keeps going...all this enjoyed in a beautifully decorated room under chandeliers....and we always had a table to ourselves thank goodness as we are not "morning people" and enjoy our privacy. The wonderful staff booked taxis for us and recommended local trattorias and they were all fantastic. Our 17 year old son loved the area as there were so many cafes and bars and places to explore. There is no way I could find one fault with this lovely hotel and the friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “I will happily stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: MarkaPolo
Reviews.Content: I first read about this hotel in the Frommers book. Then I booked through my travel agent. The Trip Advisor site had many good things to say about this hotel and I agree! The staff is professional and welcoming, and they try to help you whenever possible. We had the family suite as we were traveling with our two daughters. It was a very nice room with a balcony from which you could see the Colosseum. I personally enjoyed having a bathtub in the bathroom. The breakfast was very good and everything is clean and well maintained. We were in Rome over New Year's and while we didn't join the hotel celebration, we were invited to join the party when we returned from our engagement elsewhere. This is the fifth time I have been to Rome and I would stay here again without any hesitation!

Reviews.Title: “Loved It”
Reviews.Author: left_at_eaglecap
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I travelled to Italy for a few weeks this past summer. Fisrt destination, Rome. After the very long flight from Seattle we were greeted with open arms (even before regular check-in time) and given a room. The Lancelot has a great location and is central to everything. We opted for the full-board option which included dinners at the hotel. These were wonderful meals and we got to meet many other travelers from across the globe. We will go back to Rome and we will stay at the Lancelot again!

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: gbgg
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a diamond in the rough. It's a quant little 3 star property located just 2 blocks away from the Colleseum. As this was our first trip to Rome, I wanted to make sure we were near all of the attractions. Not only is it located close to all of the major ruins and the city center, it's also very close to several restaurants. Our first night there, we tried out the three course dinner, which is offered every night, and were completely WOWed by it. The meal was delicious starting with a pasta, then a main course, ending with dessert, fruit, and coffee. We found out halfway into our first course that our tablemates were the owners of the hotel. Kudos to them for being so involved with their patrons as they were delightful. I would recommend Hotel Lancelot to anyone who is looking for a spectacular location in Rome as well as good service. It was one of the best travel experiences I've ever had and I look forward to staying there again!

Reviews.Title: “Sweet hotel”
Reviews.Author: Glasgowborn
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel from 30 December until 4 January with my wife and two kids aged 9 and 12. It's worth mentioning at this point that I booked this hotel entirely on the recommendation of the reviews on Trip Advisor. I was not disappointed. However, I think it prudent to mention the following for the benefit of everyone in particular those of you who have kids. The meals are pre set consisting of one starter, main course and desert. Wine is plentiful throughout the service so if you drink a lot at meal times this arrangement will suit you. We booked dinner bed and breakfast due to the time of the year ( we were not sure what would be open) and after our first meal I changed to bed and breakfast as the kids did not eat anything, there was nothing wrong with the food it just wasn't to their taste. (During my stay I had dinner on 2 occasions and the food was lovely). I asked an employee if he would ask the kitchen staff to prepare something simple for the kids e.g tomato pasta or french fries but this was declined as it was late (after 8.45) so we did not get off to a great start I have to say but this was rectified the following day when Lubna, the owner, sorted things out. I found the desk staff to be very efficient throughout my stay. On the subject of food, breakfast was a simple affair, no hot food at all but this is a "continental breakfast" and I fully understand that. The only point I would make is that the croissants are all of the "sweet variety" and packed with sugar. Coffee, tea, rolls, jams and cereal are all in plentiful supply and I would recommend that some savoury options would be a much welcome addition. The guests I spoke to all made the same observation. I wouldn't describe this as a "kids hotel" as there were a lot of "older guests" but this could simply be down to the time of the year, I dont want to put anyone off going with kids, its just something to consider. The Hotel is well located in a quiet street just a couple of hundred yards from the Coleseum and its a great base if you want to be in the thick of things. Eating out is on your doorstep with several really good quality restaurants within 150 yards from the hotel so you do not have to go for dinner bed and breakfast, although if Lubna reads this I am sure she will be very unhappy with my comments. She does, after all, have a business to run. The bar is located in a small room at the rear of the reception area and is fine if you want a quick drink or just want to relax with a book. The New Year celebration was well organised and an opera singer was in attendance to entertain everyone before and during the meal. A belly dancer also entertained, this was a nice touch as soprano isn't to everyones taste so well done for considering something completely different. Dinner took a long 3 hours with the much awaited baked Alaska arriving at 10 mins to midnight, It was great but a wee bit too late as everyone scaled the 6 floors ( the lift only holds 4 people) to participate in bringing in the New Year on the roof top terrace. The fireworks over the top of the coloseum was a spectacle to behold. In conclusion, we loved the hotel and its location could not have been better. Would I go back, yes I would but without the kids next time. I have only made some minor observations (not criticisms) and my grading reflects our overall experience of the Hotel, its attentive staff and and its great location. Please feel free to e mail me if you have any questions...

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Roman Adventure”
Reviews.Author: WisMoulop
Reviews.Content: Our family of 6 visited the Lancelot for 5 days last July. The facilties were awesome, clean, comfortable, and well maintained. A classic hotel with all the current amenities required for business and/or family holiday. Located in the center of wonderful neighborhood within walking distance of the Colesium. Helen and her staff are totally dedicated to supporting and enhancing your Roman Holiday. They recomended the best ways to see the sights and navigate the city. We contacted them in advance of our trip and they helped prepare our itinerary and to sign up for the hard to get tours of the Vatican etc. The optional in house dinners were fantastic! It is great time to share stories and meet other travelers from around the world. The Lancelot enables you to visit Rome in the extreme comfort of a large hotel with a local flavor unavailable at larger hotels. There is no better way to see Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: aaaNewYork
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the hotel Lancelot for 5 days in November and absolutely loved it. The location is excellent...6 minute walk to the Colloseum but not in an overly touristy area. The staff are all extremely helpful with restaurant recommendations and transportation advice. The breakfasts have a lot of options to choose from - fruit, rolls, danishes, cereal, and yogurt. We had dinner at the hotel one night...great decision! The cook (Ferris) actually sat down at our table and ate dinner with us! Despite what he thought, the pumpkin risotto was wonderful...but the chocolate cake was the highlight. Everyone sits at tables of 8 people for meals so you really get to meet cool people from all over the world. The terrace was a nice touch but not worth 10 Euros per night. It may have been nicer if the weather was a little warmer.

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful weekend”
Reviews.Author: Bwgyite
Reviews.Content: We have returned home to Wales today after attending a family wedding in Rome. What a lovely weekend , made even more special by staying at the Lancelot Hotel. The staff were all friendly, courteous and very helpful with local information, organising taxi transfers etc. The only problem was that the weekend was over too soon. We would love to visit Rome again and will definitely stay at the Lancelot if we do! Ann Lloyd, Rhayader, Wales

Reviews.Title: “Looking forward to returning”
Reviews.Author: MandJ-Hawaii
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for four nights in Sept. The staff was very gracious and helpful with sightseeing and transportation needs. It is very close to bus and taxi stops. It's in a great location -- quiet neighborhood, short walking distance to Colloseum and Colloseum metro. The room was an average size, very nicely decorated with antique furniture and rugs. The bathroom was small with shower, but modern. All was very clean. Breakfast buffet had a lot of variety -- fruit, juices, rolls, cereal, cheese, meat, etc -- and was delicious. We opted for dinner at the hotel which was very good -- 3 courses with plenty of wine. We loved eating in the lovely dining room at the round tables for 6-8 people. We met so many very interesting, nice, and fun people. We have many fond memories from our experience at this hotel. It's a lovely place.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: SydLaika
Reviews.Content: Couldn't agree more with previous great reviews. Hotel is in a great location, charming, friendly, great service. Stayed with 10 friends and family and all had a great time. Ask for suite with large balcony overlooking the Colleseum-- amazing! Friendly bar for chatting with other guests. Hearty breakfast. Amazing value for the money. Will definitely go back. No sense in paying more at another hotel because you get all you can ask for here!

Reviews.Title: “Great Little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: patthebunny
Reviews.Content: realy enjoyed the hotel. Better than average breakfast with so-so coffee, liked the round tables for breakfast and dinners to interact with the other guests which made for a pleasant start of the day. Unbelivably nice and helpful staff!

Reviews.Title: “An Elegant Gem in a Quiet Neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: miscon2
Reviews.Content: This quaint hotel is located on a one-way street in a very quiet neighborhood, but within a 3-minute walk of the Colliseum! The staff is helpful, cordial and professional. The rooms are well-decorated, clean and quiet. Breakfast is served with a great deal of variety in choices, and all were wonderful. We highly recommend this charming hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Quiet elegance”
Reviews.Author: Ski_Maui_Hawaii
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this lovely hotel for only two nights. Upon entering the hotel property through a gated courtyard and into the lovely reception area, we were greeted most pleasantly by the reception staff and helped up to our rooms immediately. They were also invaluable with our transportation needs and other sightseeing information. The room was very large and very nicely decorated. We felt as though we were back in time with the lovely antique-style furniture. We had a nice large balcony that looked out onto the quiet street. The bathroom, although small, was very modern and clean. The breakfasts were great! We had fresh fruit, juices, coffee and tea, all kinds of rolls, cereals and meats. It was all very tasty and plentiful. After a long day of sightseeing, we had a very wonderful meal created by Mr. Khan who sat and ate dinner with us. Sitting at the round tables with the other visitors and sharing stories and experiences was another added treat to our stay at this fine hotel. The "icing to the cake" was the conversation we had with Mr. Khan at our table. He had so many interesting stories to share with us and valued tips for our sightseeing. The hotel is within a short walking distance to the Colloseum and the Palatine Hills/Forum. There is public bus transportation to everywhere else just around the block. It costs one euro for a one way trip. This hotel with its quiet elegance was just the perfect place for our visit to Rome. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “The Lancelot is great!”
Reviews.Author: HappyTraveler4848
Reviews.Content: The Lancelot is a great hotel at a great price. I arrived early - 9:30 a.m. and was checked in and given a room even though I was so early, which was also a pleasant surprise. I was also offered breakfast which I thought was very nice also. I was given a very large room despite having only reserved a single! I found the room to be especially huge after having stayed in other budget hotels around Europe. The room was very clean, the bed was comfortable, and there was plenty of room! The bathroom was clean and modern. The location of the Lancelot I thought was perfect. It is located in a nice quiet neighborhood yet the Colosseum is only a 5-10 min stroll away! There is a gate leading from the street into a lovely courtyard. The reception staff were extremely nice and helpful. They all speak English. In fact I believe all the guests were English speaking also, so if you prefer to be more immersed in a foreign culture you might not enjoy that. I thought it was fine, I was not in the hotel that much. The breakfast was fine, they have rolls, croissants, other breakfast breads, cheeses, meat, fruit, yogurt, and cold cereal. Plenty to choose from. I enjoyed my stay in Rome and at the Hotel Lancelot and I would certainly return and recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet respite in Rome”
Reviews.Author: shallowbay
Reviews.Content: Hotel Lancelot is a wonderful hotel to stay at while in Rome. It is on a quiet street behind the Coliseum; convenient to a major bus stop but in walking distance to the forum and Palatine Hill. The staff is extremely professional and very helpful. We had a room with a very nice terrace large enough to entertain friends. The hotel has a small bar and restaurant where breakfast and dinner is served. This is not a 5 star property but most certainly a wonderful place to stay while in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “near the train station sort of”
Reviews.Author: shropshire
Reviews.Content: We arrived from Naples on the Eurostar(train). Stazione Termini (the train station) has no lifts or escalators so we had to carry our bags which were heavy, up two long flights of stairs. There might have been porters but I didn't see any. It was then a 20 minute walk to the hotel. Lovely small hotel. Beds were good. shower temperature was slightly erratic. We had dinner in on 3 of the nights and it was good quality and good value. A starter and main course followed by homemade dessert, as was all the food, then fruit and coffee and wine was included. We met fellow travellers who were all pleasant and shared their holiday stories. Dinner finished at 9:15pm when guests retired to the bar or lounge area or outside patio. The hotel arranged our airport transfer, a limited edition Mercedes 900CL... - very swish, for 40 Euros. A lovley hotel in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience at the Lancelot”
Reviews.Author: artlak
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our 3- ½ week vacation in Rome at Hotel Lancelot and transatlantic cruise in early October ’07. After being delayed by a day due to an engine fire on our plane and having our luggage lost in Heathrow for four days, this might have been a very stressful if not impossible situation for us. However, with the help of Mrs. Kahn, and that of Analisa and the rest of the fine hotel staff, we were undaunted by the traumas and able to thoroughly enjoy our stay in Rome. We read about the Hotel Lancelot on Trip Advisor and we were very impressed by the past guests’ very positive responses to their experience at the Lancelot. We were not disappointed, especially our balcony view of the Coliseum. We were only sorry after our five nights we had to leave. Everyone was very kind and helpful. Even with all our questions and concerns regarding absent luggage and visiting the sites in Rome everyone was very kind and helpful. We must mention the fine dinners served at the hotel. We had planned to have a few meals in the hotel but to also eat in nearby restaurants. We dined out once and decided that after one dinner in their dining room prepared by their excellent chef, Mrs. Kahn’s son, to enjoy the rest of our evening meals at the hotel. It also gave us an opportunity to meet a number of very interesting and enjoyable people around the dining room table in the evening and to compare notes on sightseeing. It is a wonderful hotel and we look forward to our next trip to Rome and staying at the Lancelot. It is perfectly located and the staff makes every attempt to make you feel at home. If you are going to Rome, we encourage you to stay at the Hotel Lancelot.

Reviews.Title: “Not That Great”
Reviews.Author: JVC1967
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Lancelot for 5 nights. Like the others mentioned, it's near the Coliseum, which is to say it's not walking distance to much of Rome. While the hotel was clean, and staff friendly the rooms are quite small. And why is it that none of the hotels I stayed at in Italy provided washcloths or clocks in the rooms? We had the dinner one night at the hotel, it was just o.k. But the biggest problem was on our last day when we requested a wake up call and a cab (large enough for the four of us that were traveling and our luggage) and the staff completely failed on both counts. We never received a wake up call (which could have been disastrous as we had an early flight to catch) and they never called for the cab, though they came up with several excuses for the cab being late (my favorite was that it was Wednesday and the pope had a public audience on this day!) When a cab came 45 minutes later we were stuck in typical Rome traffic and were 5 minutes from missing our flight. Stress like that is not what you want on a vacation! For this reason, I can not recommend this hotel. There are others more centrally located, more modern and more reliable.

Reviews.Title: “This is a little treasure”
Reviews.Author: Muxima
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely time in this hotel. Here are some practical points and tips which you might find useful. If you're flying from Ciampino airport there is a flat 30 euro taxi fee to Rome. Make sure you take an official white taxi [there are plenty of them just outside the airport]. It's quite a schlep from Ciampino to Rome so it is good value and you're not messing around on buses and metros with piles of luggage. The hotel has a brilliant location. You walk down the little street it's on [Capo di Africa] and wham bang there's the Colisseum looming up in front of you. We love walking and Rome is surprisingly intimate - you can get to most places without needing a bus. You might want to take one to the Vatican - we did on our second visit there - we walked the first time. The number 81 stops frequently at the end of the Capo di Africa and you can buy your ticket for the princely sum of one euro from the friendly and attentive reception staff [you can't pay on the bus itself]. The hotel is small and friendly. Our room was OK - tired furniture and some scuff marks on the walls - and we didn't get a balcony - but it was perfectly adequate. The shower and the loo were brilliant - big fluffy towels and excellent maid service. Breakfasts are good: cold meats, silver foil cheeses, fresh rolls and crosissants, decent coffee, cereals and juices. Tables are fairly large so you can have companiable breakfasts with other guests. We didn't try to the evening meals in the hotel but we hear they are good. Tourist Rome more or less stops at the Colisseum so one advantage of the Lancelot is that there are good restaurants nearby which are frequented by locals and which charge reasonable prices. We recommend the Naumachie and ate there twice. We had a grim experience in the Papagio. It looks great but despite booking in advance we were poorly treated - shoved in a corner and kept waiting for over an hour for our first course by waiters with poor eye contact and dirty fingernails.
