Avoid! A really important tip if you're going to the Vatican: Don't be put off by the huge queues. They move! Above all don't be conned by people promising you wait-free guided tours at 40 euros. They are all deeply dodgy. We foolishly got conned into one but the Vatican police intervened and insisted everybody's money be returned to them. It only costs 13 euros to see all the entire Vatican museum - it is breathtakingly beautiful and you can rent excellent headphones for six euros [[you need to submit a driving licence or passport as a security]. Gents - best buy in Rome are gorgeous silk ties from 8 euros. Women - best buy in Rome are pashmina scarves fron 5 euros.

Reviews.Title: “Loving the Lancelot”
Reviews.Author: jackieb0y
Reviews.Content: Our family had a great time at the Lancelot. It was close to the metro - so we could get around easily. (1euro for a 75 minute metro journey was a bargain.) We found some nice bars around the area and especially liked Trattoria Luzzi just around the corner. The hotel was friendly and our family room was large, clean and had a balcony. Communal breakfast was a good opportunity to chat to other guests. We did get pick-pocketed on a crowded bus on our first day, so beware! Highligts of our trip includes Ostia Attica, Vatican Museum and window shopping down the via Condotti. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay”
Reviews.Author: estorilphil
Reviews.Content: Read about this place from RickSteve's. It's RIGHT next to the Colosseum. That's both good and bad. Good that when and if you do visit the Colosseum & the Forum/Palatine Hill it's right there, no metro whatsoever. But it's bad because it's kinda far away from everything else. But it's close to the colosseo metro stop so that's not too bad. Also because of its proximity to the Colosseum everything's quite touristy. That's not necessarily bad, however, since just about all menus and every proprietor lists/speaks some English. If I spoke Italian at all, however, I think I'd want to stay somewhere else just because of that. The room was clean and beds (we had a triple room) comfy. The spare bed we got was a real bed, not a roll-away sofa-bed so that was cool. And the double bed was actually a double bed, not 2 single beds put together so that was also great. You'd actually be able to see the Colosseum from your room IF you have a room with a terrace. Otherwise you can't. No biggie. Reception & cleanning staff were INCREDIBLY helpful and friendly. What else, the tv is old and small, but you're not in Rome to watch the BBC right? Bathroom is ok, but there's no tub in ours if that's important to you. Also the door to the bathroom was a weird folding kinda door. It's close to a few (1 "big" and a couple TINY) grocery mkts. Always on my checklist when booking a place. Important to stock up on supply upon arriving, you know? Oh yeah, there is no mini-bar so you can't store food that require refridgeration, kinda inconvenient but not a huge deal. Breakfast was ok, not great. Seating was sometimes hard to come by so you may need to share. Haven't had the communal dinner so can't really comment on that.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in every way”
Reviews.Author: Hunter747
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Lancelot for 7 nights in Oct 2007. There were 4 of us incl 15 and 16 yr old sons. We had a quad room with a terrace. It would be hard to find fault with the Hotel Lancelot. We emailed them about 10 times requesting clarification to the reservation, help with booking activities, etc., and each email was answered promptly, accurately and courteously. On arrival and during our stay, all the staff were equally pleasant and helpful. One example, the hotel helped us book an afternoon of horseback riding on the Appian Way. When we left Lorena was at the front desk and made sure we had the address, called taxi, etc. On the way back we had to walk the last mile to the hotel (due to a political demonstration) and we ran into Lorena walking home, She asked how we enjoyed the afternoon, etc. When we got back to the hotel, AnnaLisi was at the desk (just started her shift) and as soon as we walked in she asked us how the horseback riding was as well. Rarely do you find engaged employees like that. We would echo most of the comments in the other reviews, so I wont repeat them all here, just make some select observations. Our room was on the street side, and although some say the street noise is not noticeable, it really is. For light sleepers, this could be an issue, but earplugs easily fix any noise issue. We ate dinner at the hotel each night. Excellent food prepared by a creative chef. First course is pasta, main course was usually meat (fish on Friday) and two vegetables, and a different dessert. Wine and water served with dinner. If someone in your group is having a birthday, it is noted by the Hotel and a birthday cake, champagne, etc is added to the dessert. A nice touch. As others have noted, many places to eat in easy walking distances. One option that worked well for us at lunch was to walk down a block towards the Coloseo and get sandwiches at a corner store (fresh bread and rolls) along with various side items (cookies, chips, olives, cheeses, etc). All fresh and we all ate for 10 euros. The Hotel is everything the other reviewers have said and more. I honestly dont know why you would voluntarily pay more (like double) for other hotels in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “very nice hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: NewEnglandSteve
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Lancelot for 3 days prior to our wedding in September. The hotel itself was very nice. The room we had was spacious and clean. The bathroom was tiny, but that seemed to be the norm everywhere we went in europe. The staff was extemely friendly and helpful. The hotel was located a short walk from the colosseum and many little bars and restaurants. I will definitely stay at Hotel Lancelot when I return to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Very Mixed Reaction To An Okay Place”
Reviews.Author: Porsche_Guy
Reviews.Content: I am really torn about this hotel. My feeling, and rating, about it should be higher since there was nothing particularly wrong about the place. It's just not really a hotel I would stay at again since I believe there are better choices in Rome at the same price point. So, first what we liked. The hotel staff was very helpful and courteous. The fact that everyone had English helped a lot. The room on the fourth floor was okay. It was clean and fresh, and the bathroom was not too small, save for the shower stall. I would pity an overweight American in that shower stall. Also, the bar area was a nice touch, and included a full selection of brands and choices. The location of the Hotel Lancelot is very good in my view. It is a five minute walk to the Coliseum and bus routes are nearby. There ae some great restaurants within walking distance. And that always helps. Why would I not return? Overall, the hotel is just dull. The lighting in common areas and in our room was dim and had an overall "old" feeling. I am not suggesting the place is worn, but it just feels dull. The plethora of older patrons with their backpack (US and British) was a drawback for me. But I completely understand this is a very personal reaction. All in all, the Hotel Lancelot is a perfectly serviceable hotel. Just not my cup of tea since it is not modern enough.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent *** Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jollydays
Reviews.Content: Friendly, polite and informative staff create an easy and sociable atmosphere . Rooms are more than adequate, clean and secure. Breakfast plenty to set you up for the day. Dinner was lovely (although perhaps more English than Italian) and the service friendly, attentive and non-intrusive, providing a relaxed evening meal. The small bar area / lounge is perfect for a quiet before/after dinner drink. Only a couple of minutes walk from the Colosseum and Metro line. Definitely one to be recommended.

Reviews.Title: “As the reviews say, a true gem & great value. Wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: jrabano
Reviews.Content: As an owner of a travel company, I chose this hotel based on all the great reviews. The owners & staff certainly did not disappoint. The hotel is well run, clean & charming. The location is outstanding...a quick 2 block walk to the Colosseum. The service is what makes this hotel a gem. This was my third time in Rome but the first time I've experienced every hotel staff member greet myself & my family of four with at least a smile. We will definitely be back to stay. Great hotel for young families as I can attest to with a 4 yr old & a 17month old traveling with us.

Reviews.Title: “Helpful with the disabled”
Reviews.Author: skibanff
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel and as the reviews say, it was terrific My contribution is that the front desk were very helpful with my mother who was in an electic wheelchair. The hotel staff consistently assisted her with the ramps, doorways, ordering a specific kind of taxi and one of the staff insisted she take his umbrella because it was going to rain. Very kind and thoughtful. My parents are older and their memory of where they put things is not the best, but the hotel was very patient in helping them locate items. I appreciated their kindness and tolerance of the older generation and the disabled

Reviews.Title: “Good Deal In Rome”
Reviews.Author: nyc10029
Reviews.Content: This was the final stop on our honeymoon, and although the room was much smaller than we had in other cities and a bit far from some major landmarks, we had a good time. They brought us a bottle of champagne when we arrived, and in general the staff was very friendly. The room was unremarkable but clean; not much of a view either. There are a fair number of decent restaurants within walking distance, but if you're staying for more than a few nights like we did, you get tired of the options and have to walk much farther to get to good places. We also booked a day trip to Naples and Pompeii through the hotel, which we enjoyed.

Reviews.Title: “We'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: 24fun
Reviews.Content: My family of five (including three teenage boys) stayed at the Hotel Lancelot for five nights in early August. It was an absolutely wonderful base to relax and connect while exploring the Eternal City! Upon checking in, my husband and I were shown to our immaculate sixth-floor room with a large terrace and jaw-dropping view of the Colosseum. Our sons shared a comfortable quadruple room on the fifth floor. Breakfast was of good quality and selection and served in a lovely dining room with large round tables, perfect for planning the day's schedule. We opted for the half-board rate which included a delicious three-course traditional Italian dinner (with wine) each night. It was a great value and the food was the best we enjoyed in Rome. The dinners also provided us the opportunity to meet other world travelers and learn about their thoughts and experiences. The entire staff was professional and friendly, accepting advanced reservations to sites on our behalf and providing helpful tips on exploring Rome. As far as I am concerned, staying at this hotel is a no-brainer. I threw my coin into the Trevi Fountain to assure my return to Rome and the Hotel Lancelot.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent small hotel”
Reviews.Author: marie5v
Reviews.Content: We just stayed here for three nights in August 2007. It was a great hotel. Not only reasonably priced, but sparkly clean, nicely decorated, conveniently located (near colloseum and metro), and includes a really good breakfast (the best one we had in all of Italy!). I'd recommend this hotel for just about anyone, although if you are very young and primarily interested in nightlife, you would be better off near the Pantheon area, where I notice young people hang out a lot after dark and there are a lot of clubs. Lancelot is in a nice, but quiet area.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Winterspring
Reviews.Content: My two sons and I stayed at the Hotel Lancelot for three nights. We had an absolutely wonderful time there. We splurged and rented the 6th floor suite with a terrace. It was very nice with a quirky, slightly Asian theme. In the mornings I sat on the terrace enjoying my tea while looking at the Collosseum. At night after a long day of touring the sites, with wine glass in hand, I could look over the rooftops to see the illuminated Collosseum-priceless. I really enjoyed the hotel's breakfast-it was fun to try new things and the fruit was wonderful. My 11 and 13 year old were not quite as thrilled with it as I was. The staff was so helpful,and would do anything you asked them to do, and they made some wonderful suggestions for dinner (Li Rioni has the best pizza in Rome!) The hotel is close to the Collosseo metro station, and is in easy walking distance to the Collosseum and Forum. We would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Top marks for Lancelot”
Reviews.Author: Seacroft
Reviews.Content: If you want a quaint, slightly quirky but traditional place to stay in Rome - a stone's throw from the Colleseo - then book a room at the Hotel Lancelot. I can only echo all the previous - good - reviews of this hotel. It is a lovely old six storey hotel stuck down a narrow road off the Colleso. It's in a neighbourhood , a very quiet one at that, of homes, corner stores and lovely little restaurants. We arrived very early but were met with smiles and an offer of a free breakfast while our room was prepared. This was done quickly and efficiently. Before we even left our home in Hong Kong we'd contacted the hotel who'd booked us a table at an up market restaurant - so excellent front desk service. This extended to help with directions around the city and suggestions for places to eat in the neighbourhood. We had a quadruple room on the 6th floor, overlooking the front and with a view of the Colleso. It had recently been redecorated and the bathroom was of a good size. The air conditioning worked well. We all enjoyed the Continental breakfast, tucking in to fresh breads, meats and cheeses as well as fruit and cereal. We were picked up and taken to the airport on time and with no fuss. I strongly recommend this hotel if you want to avoid the 5 star anonymous hotels and the prices they charge.

Reviews.Title: “Super location, quiet, and nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: jattcf
Reviews.Content: Stayed in early August for three nights. Our family of 4 needed two rooms because they were out of quadruples. It was priced at 160 euros/night/room - the most reasonable I could find at the time. They were kind and made sure our rooms were right next to each other, one room with a queen and one with 2 twin beds. Our teenagers thought it was great to get their own room for the first time. The hotel is down a very quiet street about 2 blocks from the Colosseum and 5-6 blocks from Termini station. We walked both to and from the station with our luggage and it was fine, some people may think it a bit far for dragging luggage and prefer to get a quick taxi ride. The beds were the softest we stayed in of our 4 hotel trip through Italy. The rooms spacious enough, the bathrooms a bit tight, but everything always clean. The breakfast was traditional European breads, meats and cereals. The juices were not good. The fruit was usually pretty picked over, no matter what time we arrived. The front desk was very willing to answer our questions, but were not personable. Overall, a great location and nice hotel, but too pricey for two rooms.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: ElmoScotland
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent three nights at the Lancelot in July. We arrived very late at night, but took the bus from the airport to Termini station, then a 10 minute taxi ride straight to the hotel. All previous comments about the great location of the hotel are true. I would also point out that although one previous reviewer complained of noise in the street on one occassion we found it to be an extremely quiet area of an otherwise hectic city and never experienced this problem. Our reception at the hotel was excellent and our room, very clean, bright and basic. Again, I think most previous reviewers have hit the mark. We seemed to be the only guests who took advantage of the bar after arriving back at the hotel after dinner and drinks and the night manager was happy to serve us until we wanted to go to bed! Definitely a place to recommend to anyone going to room who wants excellent service, location and value for money.

Reviews.Title: “mixed”
Reviews.Author: suekush
Reviews.Content: First let me say that the management graciously refunded a full night's stay because of my problems, so I have to give them credit for customer service. Also, the owners were away at the time of my stay, so the problems may have been better addressed if they were there. The walls of our large, airy room were disgusting. They had hand and foot prints, plus something thick and red that was either blood or candy. I couldn't stand it, so I asked for a cloth to clean it myself. Since housekeeping was gone, a bellman gave me a dry cloth, with no cleaning solution, and agreed that the dirty walls were distressing. He said someone would address the issue the next day, but no one did. Anyway, I got nearly all the grime and grossness off with hot water, proving that it was, um, biological, and could have been cleaned by housekeeping (they tried to tell me it was stains at one point). Also, the breakfasts were horrible here - stale bread and swilly coffee - in Italy!!! And one man at the desk consistently gave our party incorrect directions. The location is very close to the Collaseum, which is great in one way, but not close to much else, which was kind of a hassle. The price is good, and most of our party was very happy with the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “View of the Colosseum”
Reviews.Author: Becky98
Reviews.Content: We loved Hotel Lancelot! It is just a few blocks from the Colosseum. You can pay extra and get a room with a terrace that overlooks the Colosseum. It was beautiful- especially lit up at night! The service was great! Everyone spoke excellent English. Be sure and stay for one of the hotel dinners. You sit with others staying at the hotel and eat a fabulous authentic Italian meal. It's fun to talk to others about their experiences in Rome and get lot of ideas. It was reasonably priced with the wine included. We were able to park our car right inside the gates of the hotel entrance, but we walked and took taxis to everything while we were there.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Value”
Reviews.Author: EDHJIM
Reviews.Content: Five Star service at a three star price! One of the finest hotel experiences we've had in 10 years of traveling in Europe. Fantastic staff - were treated like royalty our entire stay. Perfect location - ATM around the corner, Pharmacy around the other corner, restaurants around every corner, Forum and Coliseum 2 blocks away, subway across the street from the Coliseum (subway entrance 10 minute walk from hotel), everything you need is within walking distance. Rooms are typical "european", tile floors, modest decorations & furnishings, but spotlessly clean. If you're looking for the Bellagio in Las Vegas, this isn't it. But, if you are looking for safe, clean, quite, centrally located accomodations with the most helpful staff in Rome, then try the Lancelot.

Reviews.Title: “Quite a find!”
Reviews.Author: KrisPena
Reviews.Content: This is the perfect place to stay in Rome!! The location could not be better - you can walk to the Colloseum, there are two different bus stops within 2 blocks and the Metro is just across from the Colloseum. The neighborhood is quiet and there is a small grocer and a few restaurants within 2-3 blocks. The staff was SO helpful! All spoke excellent English and were great with helping with transportation and planning our days. The breakfast was great - lots of fruit, yougurt, cereal, meat, toast... Room was very comfortable but small (typical European room). The shower water pressure was GREAT! Free wireless internet in our room. Definitely recommend it, especially for families.

Reviews.Title: “Just like the reviews... A great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LtColG
Reviews.Content: I always wonder when reading reviews that are just one after the other positive. Makes me think there's some kind of "fix", but I can say our stay at the Lancelot was everything we were hoping for and all the previous reviews were right on the mark. The Hotel Lancelot is a wonderful place to stay in Rome. Relatively inexpensive compared to other hotels, clean, excellent staff, good food, and a great location. We stayed four nights and took the taxi in from CIA which cost us 30 Euro. No fuss getting a taxi or feeling pressured to pay more upon arrival. There are signs all over the baggage area informing you about taxi fares and we knew in advance ours would be 30 Euro. Bus service was available from the airport to the main train station, but we would have needed to take a taxi from there anyway, so we just decided to go with the taxi from the airport. The location is in a residential area set back from the Colosseum. You literally can see the Colosseum when standing in front of the hotel and it's only a few minutes walk to it and the Forums. Bus and Metro connections were also about 10 minutes by foot. There were about a dozen small corner restaurants in the neighborhood and we ate at several during our stay. Everything from pretty good/inexpensive to excellent/moderately priced. The reception/lobby area was very well decorated. Exactly what I would expect from a small Italian hotel. Rich woods, antiques, period pictures on the wall. It was lke steppping into a movie. The reception staff was EXCELLENT and set the standard for the rest of our stay. In addition, every staff member we dealt with (even the maid) spoke very good English. Off to the side was a small sitting area with magazines and newspapers which led into the dining area and in the other direction a hallway which led to the bar and garden terrace. Again, the entire area was immaculate, and very well decorated. We took a small elevator up to our rooom and were met with a standard European hotel room...small by American standards. However, it was clean and decorated with antique furniture. There was a bed, small writing desk, end tables, a stand alone closet and a larger desk where the TV sat. The bathroom was also small, but functional. It had a stand-up shower (no tub) and a hair dryer. My wife felt the mirror and shelf over the sink were too small for all her toilettries but I was happy. We did not have a terrace or balcony, so we were somewhat disappointed in that, especially since it appeared our room was the only room without a balcony. Our room overlooked the street and did not have much of a view. The TV was very small (14 inch?) and provided BBC, SKY News, several Italian channels, a German channel and Le Monde (French). One strange thing was the TV provided audio of CNN, but no picture. I was happy with BBC so I never mentioned anything to the front desk and have no idea if it was just our room or the entire hotel that couldn't get CNN. One small problem with the room I did notice was that just below the air conditoner the wall was stained and in the bathroom the paint was peeling in some places. Believe me, this was not a big thing, and after noting it, never paid attention to it again. Breakfast in the morning was standard european style with some juices, cereals, breads, meat, jams, fruits and pastries. Not the best Continental breakfast I've ever had, but good enough and we didn't go hungry. We did not eat dinner at the hotel, but preferred eating at all the corner restaurants that were available within 5 min from the hotel. There is a bar down in the lobby and I took advantage of it after we got back from the free Genesis concert that was 20 min walk from the hotel (I told you it was in a great location). Even though it was late, the bar was open and the drinks were cool and refreshing. Kudos to the staff yet again. There was a very small internet room available but I didn't use it. I believe it cost 1 Euro per hr with a 3 Euro min. I read in a previous posts that WiFi is available, but I didn't bring a laptop to confirm. By far the biggest and only real complaint we had was the noise. For whatever reason, there seemed to be a party in front of the hotel one night with cars and motorcycles racing up the street. To top it off, as the street party finally calmed down, the teenagers in the room above us decided to move the furniture around (literally) and start their own party. That went on for over an hour until I finally got out of bed and went down to the lobby. The receptionist told me he was aware of the problem (apparently I wasn't the only one to complain) and said it would be resolved. Sure enough, 15 minutes later, no more noise. Kudos again to the hotel staff! Even though the noise was bothersome, there's nothing the hotel could do about the party on the street and when made aware of the noise in the hotel, took care of it. So overall, an excellent hotel that we will definitely come back to during our next Roman holiday. You can't loose if you stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Lancelot - Great place to stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: passengerIreland
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel Lancelot for four nights from June 12th to June 16th 2007. The hotel is charming - a bit old fashioned but in a very classy way. It is an oasis of quiet and cool calmness compared to the heat and noise of the streeets of Rome. We availed of the limo pick up service from the airport, which is suberb and great value. For 10 euros more than the standard Taxi fare ( 50 V 40) we were met in arrivals by a suited driver who brought us out to a large black mercedes limo and 30 mins later dropped us at the door of the hotel. No stress - just luxury and comfort all the way. I would highly recommend this service as we found that taxi drivers in Rome do not speak English and are not very communicative so it could be a bit difficult to get into a taxi and get to the right hotel. I was travelling with my husband and two children aged 5 and 7. We booked a quadruple room. We were allocated no 10 which is on the first floor. It is a large room with plenty of space for 4 people; a large double bed, a single bed and a large couch/bed . The couch bed was bigger than a standard single. We were more than happy with the accomodation at first, as the bathroom was reasonable big too, which we were not expecting! The best was yet to come, though, as we discovered that we also had a large terrace, approx 12 feet by 15 ft with a table and four chairs and beautiul potted plants all around. In the evenings, after returning from dinner, it was perfect for sitting out with a drink while the children went to sleep inside. We sat there, just down the road from the Colosseum, listening to the sounds of Rome in the distance and loved it! The Hotel location is great, on a quiet side street, near buses and a taxi rank but not too close. You can walk to all the tourist sites, if you don't have a grumpy five year old holding you back. If you do - get a taxi - they are very reasonable. When you leave the hotel if you go left, then left again, there is a lovely cafe/shop which sells ice cream and drinks at local prices as opposed the the tourist prices you nmight pay a few streets away. It also sells great sandwiches and mega coffee. We were attending a wedding and other family members and friends stayed around the Via Natzionale and found it a much noisier area and dfficult to sleep at night. We had no such problems. We will definately stay at the Hotel Lancelot when we return to Rome, which I hope will be soon, as it is the most amazing city to visit. The room rates are expensive but all hotels in Rome are so it is as good as you can get.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Lancelot wasa great place to stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: JohnF_1959
Reviews.Content: My wife, daughter and I really enjoyed our stay at the Hotel Lancelot. The top reasons we liked the hotel were: the location, friendly staff, comfort and value. The location was marvelous: about 2 blocks from both the Colosseum and the Basilica of San Clemente. Palatine Hill and the Roman Forum sites were within walking distance (4-5 blocks), and the Bus 81 stop (which took us to the Vatican, Spanish Steps, Trevi Fountain, and shopping on Via del Corso) was 3-4 blocks away. The staff was extremely helpful with travel tips, setting up tours (AngelTours forthe Vatican was very good), and even getting my laptop working with the Wi-Fi available on every floor. I do recommend the hotel dinner one night. The food and wine were excellent, and it was a good way to meet other guests and get some tips for visiting Rome. The hotel itself was quite comfortable. The rooms size and appearance were very good. We had an inside room and didn't encounter any loud noises at night, but the sound of birds early in the morning woke us up. That was not a problem for us, but if it had been I brought earplugs (which are a good idea when traveling anywhere in Italy).

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, amazing staff, excellent location, good value.”
Reviews.Author: Osti
Reviews.Content: I got married in Rome in June and I stayed in the Hotel Lancelot along with many of our guests and its safe to say we were all VERY happy with the hotel. The staff could not be more helpful during our stay. The wedding suite is lovely with an great view of the Colosseum. Would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding service”
Reviews.Author: FCummings18
Reviews.Content: The staff were incredibly helpful and friendly. They spent much time on the phone assisting us with communications with the lost luggage department at the airport. The room was spacious for our family of four, very clean, and the breakfast very nice. We will be a repeat customer when we return to Rome. Thanks again for a wonderful experience.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded my High Expectaion”
Reviews.Author: DaJoos
Reviews.Content: First off I want to thank all the fellow TA members for all their help in planning my trip, and for pointing me to this wonderful hotel - I felt I should contribute my small review even though it's just more praise for this already well-regarded hotel. We stayed 3 nights at the Hotel Lancelot earlier this month and had a great time. I had decided to split my Rome time between the Lancelot and another, more highly-rated hotel in Trastevere, and though I liked the other hotel part of me wishes I'd spent all my time at the Lancelot. I LOVE the Ancient Rome sites, and the Lancelot is in an ideal location to visit them. In addition I had been told we'd be staying in a Superior Triple without terrace when I booked (though I'd hoped for a terrace) - I was very surprised to find the extremely spacious (by European standards) corner room with balcony on the 5th floor that awaited us. I'm not sure why or how we were upgraded but I didn't complain (or notice an increase in the cost). It was a wonderful way to start our trip and we loved the view of the Colisseum from our terrace. The breakfast was representative of what we'd receive at the other hotels on our trip, and while the food was of high quality I must admit I'm a fan of American breakfasts and missed the toast, bagels, pancakes, eggs, etc you might see in the US. My wife has more refined tastes and liked the selection - my daughter was in my camp. Not a slight on the Lancelot, just on what is standard at Italian hotels. We were too busy to have dinner at the hotel, but smelled it cooking a couple times - wish we could have tried it! We had fun instead trying the casual restaurants all around the Lancelot - there are many to choose from, mostly reasonable, but all with similar menus. I was not aware that the Lancelot would help people book their activities in Rome - a courtesy highlighted by some other hotels we stayed at - but I'd guess the Lancelot would be very capable doing so. On our last evening, and continuing into the next morning, the one (small!) elevator went out of service. As we were on the fifth floor that was a bit of a drag, but it certainly wasn't the hotel's fault. They were kind enough to tell us to leave our luggage in the room on the morning we departed, and after we'd seen some last sites we returned to the hotel to find all our bags had been carried down for us, as promised. (Happily for them the elevator repairman appeared as we were paying our bill). All in all a great stay and probably our favorite hotel of the four we stayed at - I hope to return some day.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: GailKer
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed for two nights at the Hotel Lancelot, 47 Via Capo d'Africa. It's located near the Coleseum and several bus lines to other parts of the city. The rooms are nice with air conditioning and hair dryer and the hotel staff is exceptionally helpful and pleasant. There are nice lobbies that are inviting to sit in and read or chat, including one with a bar for a refreshing drink after a day of sightseeing. Dinner is served every evening for 25 euros per person either in the very nice dining room or outside in the garden. Laundry service is provided for a small fee, a happy surprise for us. I'd definitely stay there again if I ever return to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great character and location”
Reviews.Author: Chester100
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at the Lancelot for 6 nights in March 2007. We arranged our stay directly with the hotel by email. The hotel staff responded to emails promptly and organising the stay was a breeze. We managed to get a 6th floor terrace room (with Colosseum view) for 4 nights, after which we had to move to a 2nd floor room with no terrace. If you can get a 6th floor terrace it is well worth it - taking into account the magnificent view and access to a private garden terrace, it is worth paying the small supplement. The only drawback was that the terrace adjoined a terrace for smokers to use. A group of school kids were staying at the hotel and consequently some nights we had to endure noisy teenagers slamming the terrace door, talking and smoking into the early hours of morning. The stairwell and hard flooring of the hotel added to this noise. In contrast the 2nd floor room was slightly smaller and looked out on the internal courtyard - which is compatively unremarkable. Both rooms were clean, comfortable and both had been uniquely decorated. The breakfast, which is included in the price was quite adequate. We did not try the dinner, so we cannot comment on this - but the smell of it cooking at the end of a long day sightseeing gave the hotel a welcoming homely charm. We had breakfast around 8 most mornings, and never had a problem getting a table to ourselves. The hotel staff made us feel welcome and were polite and informative. Mrs Kahn, the owner, is often at reception and it is obvious that she takes pride and interest overseeing the manner in which the hotel is run. The hotel is beautifully decorated with flowers, books, antique furniture and ornaments, giving it the feel of a home rather than a sterile hotel. The hotel is located on a quiet street within minutes of the Colloseum, making this hotel an excellent base to sightsee. There is also a metro stop at the Colloseum, which might be useful because the walk to other sights such as the Trevi fountain is a bit longer (20 mins maybe), and whilst can be done it does get a bit tiring to do every day! Overall this hotel has a lot of character and charm, and we would gladly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great find for families visiting Rome”
Reviews.Author: JoeValrico
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. Highly recommended. We recently spent three nights at the Hotel Lancelot. The rooms were clean and comfortable. Breakfast was very generous. And the service was exceptional. On the day we were supposed to leave, there was a nationwide taxi strike. We were at a loss for how four people with luggage were going to get to the station to catch our train. One of the staff offered to drive us in the hotel's van. When offered payment for this service, he declined to accept anything. I think this act speaks volumes for how this hotel caters to its guests.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Accomodations at the Hotel Lancelot!”
Reviews.Author: Hebel
Reviews.Content: My mom and I stayed in Rome on May 20-24 and May 26-28. We stayed at the Hotel Lancelot both times. The Hotel had a warm and welcoming staff who spoke perfect English. They had a very efficient taxi system- all you had to do was ask them to call you a taxi and within five minutes one would be outside waiting for you! They even allowed us to leave some of our luggage at the hotel when we left to visit Florence for 2 days. (If you are visiting Florence, see my review of the Residenzia Il Villino, which is also fantastic!) The rooms are standard European size (e.g. small to an American) but were well equipped with an air conditioner and a small electric safe. The breakfast is simple (bread, tea, coffee, fruit, cheese, some proscuitto) but very tasty and always out promptly at 7 am. There is also a small bar area for guests to lounge in, and you can order wine/beer/coffee there anytime of the day. There is an outside patio to sit in and enjoy a glass of wine in the afternoon. The hotel is 6 floors, but there is a tiny elevator that works pretty well, so you don't have to lug all your bags up several flights of stairs :-) There's also a great gelataria about two blocks away from the Hotel, and the Hotel is four-five blocks away from the Colleseum, Palantine Hill, the Forum and the Arch of Constantine. It is a great location from which to explore Rome! I would highly recommend this hotel to everyone who is looking for a nice, but reasonable, place to stay that is centrally located in the heart of the city.

Reviews.Title: “The Lancelot is a gem!”
Reviews.Author: NStassino
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Lancelot for 3 nights at the beginning of our two weeks in Italy, and for 3 nights at the end. We chose the hotel based upon the recommendation of a friend, who said it was the only hotel he would return to out of all the hotels he had stayed at during 3 weeks in Italy. We concur, and we will definitely return. We wanted a location near the ancient sites. Although the hotel is near the Colosseum, it is on a quiet street in a very nice residential area. The hotel is beautifully decorated and spotlessly clean. There is an attractive bar and lounge, with very reasonable prices for wine and cocktails, even espresso for one euro! The staff are friendly and extremely helpful. The owner, Mrs. Khan, has a delightful sense of humor. We had a lovely room on the first floor (meaning the second floor for Americans), with a door opening out onto a terrace decorated with beautiful plants and vines, It was wonderful to relax there in the early evening with a glass of wine and a bowl of pistachio nuts from the bar, watching the swallows fly overhead. The breakfast was good, and we enjoyed meeting different guests each morning at the large round tables. We did not have dinner at the hotel, but we enjoyed the nearby pizzeria Il Rioni so much that we went there two nights in a row!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Lancelot”
Reviews.Author: ckml
Reviews.Content: My husband and I, together with our daughter and son-in-law, stayed at the Lancelot Hotel for five days at the end of May 07. This is a beautiful hotel, a really cool oasis to return to at the end of a hot and tiring sightseeing day. It is situated behind wrought iron gates in an ideal location being a very short walk to the Coloseum and the red hop-on-hop-off tour bus with a variety of restaurants in the vicinity. The hotel staff are most friendly and helpful and having heard that it was our Golden Wedding Anniversary at the time, they arranged a champagne celebration for us at dinner ! We had adjoining double rooms on the first floor and our patio doors opened out onto a connecting balcony/patio, complete with tables and chairs and a profusion of flowers and shrubs. The rooms were well furnished, the beds made up early every morning with fresh towels daily in the bathroom, which, admittedly, was rather small, but hey! who spends their days in the bathroom? The entire hotel is beautifully furnished and spotlessly clean, a vast selection of books etc. in the lounges and a very good bar and television room. The dining room arrangements mean that a variety of guests sit together at breakfast and dinner, giving the opportunity to exchange views with people from other countries. All four of us would recommend the Lancelot hotel for however long the holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel, great location.”
Reviews.Author: ABSH4
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Lancelot for two nights and loved the quiet, secluded ambience of this hotel. We arrived early but were warmly welcomed and shown to our room which overlooked a lovely couryard with a little terrace. The hotel seemed to be full each night but there were no poblems with noise which you tend to get in larger hotels. The staff were all English speaking, friendly, and made helpful suggestions about local trips etc. Best of all was when you required a taxi, the receptionist contacted the taxi from reception and it appeared at the door of the hotel three/four minutes later. We took at taxi to the Vatican for €10, and also taxis to other areas were not too expensive. The breakfast was pleasant with a good choice of items. We did not eat dinner in the hotel but it was a good menu and seemed to be popular with other guests. In general this was a lovely, small traditional hotel in a good area. The staff were extemely friendly and helpful (especially Lorena). I would like to return for another stay here and I wouldn't hesitate to recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “I would stay here again for sure!!!”
Reviews.Author: msu_99
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at this hotel in late May 2007. The staff was incredibly friendly, the rooms were clean, and the neighborhood could not be better. The hotel was just a few minutes walk to the subway and many other attractions. If you choose to stay at this hotel make sure you have dinner one night at LaManuche, which is just a couple blocks away.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: JetSetGal22
Reviews.Content: This was our first time in Rome. The hotel from the airport was about 15 minutes by cab. The neighborhood was very quiet with good restaurants and tratorias. The hotel was a very short walk to the colossuem which was really convienient. The complementary breakfast was good and refilled frequently. The room was very clean and housekeeping cleaned it everyday. The shower was not as clean as i thought it should be. There were couple of black mildew or rust stain on the shower walls. The front desk was very nice and helpful in answering your questions. We walked to all the major sites in Rome even to the Vatican (45 min. walk) and the location was very easy to find at night on the way back. One thing we dislike about this hotel is that the shower head was not attached to the wall which made showering very hard because you have to hold it. My fiance had a very hard time showering. The bathroom was also on the small side with very little counter space. But that didnt bother us too much because we spend very little time in our hotel room anyways. Oh one little tip, do not use their laundry (not dry clean) service unless absolutely necessary unless you want to pay 2 euros for a pair of socks. And there was no price list in the hotel room telling you before hand how much laundry cost unless you ask the front desk.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: PumpkinLover
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Lancelot in May 2007 and we were very pleasantly surprised. It was our first trip to Europe and didn't know what to expecpt from the hotels. It was in a great, convenient location. The staff was friendly and helpful. The rooms were clean and comfortable. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A Lovely Stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: SuzanneWS
Reviews.Content: What a lovely 6 days in Rome (14-22 May 2007)! The Hotel Lancelot was the perfect place for us. We were in Rome for the last week of our Italian holiday, met there by our 22 yr old son and 21 yr old daughter. Our accomodations were perfect - two rooms on the first floor connected by a beautiful plant-filled terrace where we loved relaxing every afternoon before venturing out for dinner. The kids arrived first, very tired from the long flight, and were immediately taken to their room even though it was before the posted check-in time. We ate dinner that night at the hotel and were very pleased with both the food and the company at our table, a couple from Manchester. Breakfast was equally enjoyable, meeting new people each morning. Annalisa and Lorena were so very helpful with everything from museum reservations to shopping advice to even opening a stubborn bottle of wine for us! Farris and Michael were the BEST bartenders - always availalbe and eager to learn how to make unfamiliar cocktails as well as suggesting Italian specialities. Each evening on returning from dinner we enjoyed sitting in the bar/lounge visiting with other guests. The last night there the owner, Mrs. Khan, took us up to her apartment to see the view from her terrace - spectacular! We felt very privileged to be able to visit with her and really enjoyed her hospitality. It would be hard to find a better location in Rome - three blocks from the coliseum and the "red bus" stop. You definitedly could not find a more pleasant place to stay in the Eternal City. Many thanks to Mrs Khan and her staff for a truly delightful 6 days!

Reviews.Title: “Book the Suite!”
Reviews.Author: CaliforniaGirl54
Reviews.Content: Wonderfully appointed small-ish hotel in a neighborhood just adjacent to the ancient ruins. Book the suite - I believe there's just one in the hotel - it has a seperate living room, wonderful bathroom with a tub, and a patio overlooking the Colosseum. Although the other rooms are nice as well, it's worth the difference in price. The staff are very friendly and helpful and for sightseeing purposes you're right by the ruins - with a subway stop only two blocks away. This will be my home away from home when in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid the Lancelot”
Reviews.Author: gisca
Reviews.Content: Reviewer: Gisca, Miami, Florida What a disappointment! We had a confirmed room on the sixth floor with a terrace overlooking the Coliseum which was reserved approximately seven months prior to arrival. When we got there, they said the room had been overbooked and they gave us a triple room which we did not need. No refund was made (we were paying extra for the terrace room) because they claimed it was an oversized room. The sheets were old and yellowish in color and the bathroom had a urine smell. The only thing positive about this hotel is that the girls at the front desk were extremely nice and helpful, particularly Annalisa. They helped us with reservations even before our arrival and were very helpful with our requests during our stay.

Reviews.Title: “The true meaning of service with a smile”
Reviews.Author: iceangel8
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a wonderful trip with my two children. The staff were lovely and welcoming and made our stay really special. The room was huge and clean - just perfect for all four of us. The breakfast was nicely served and plentiful. This hotel was worth every penny especially the free sweets at reception!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Location”
Reviews.Author: CadfaelShropshire
Reviews.Content: My wife and I returned this week after a lovely holiday in Rome. The room was excellent with good airconditioning, roomy and spotlessly clean. The decor was very tasteful. The staff were extremely helpful and polite. We didn't have an evening meal at the hotel as we were busy exploring but the breakfast was good. The location for the historical centre is excellent and there are many good places to eat and drink in the locality. We had one disturbed night due to loud Canadians in the adjoining room who left next day, but that wasn't the fault of the hotel. If we return to Rome then the Hotel Lancelot will be our automatic first choice.

Reviews.Title: “The Lancelot is #1 in my book!”
Reviews.Author: lovetotravelTarzana
Reviews.Content: Every positive review below (and there are many!) is absolutely accurate. I had planned this trip 10 months ago and knew from the reviews and hotel website the Lancelot was going to be a treat - it was. The staff could not possibly be more friendly, accommodating and helpful. The breakfast is outstanding: sweet and savory breads, croissants, cheeses, meats, yogurts, fresh fruit, dried fruit, nuts, 6 types of cereal, everything imaginable to drink...just fabulous. It is served in a beautiful and elegant dining room, where each evening a gourmet meal is served for which one can sign up during the morning for a very reasonable price. Lastly, the rooms are more than comfortable and sparkling clean. One of the other great features of this hotel is the location, a 10-minute walk to the metro and Colosseum and a few minutes' walk to the incredible Basilica di San Clemente - don't miss it! Thank you again to all the staff for making our first stay in Rome so very extra special. We can't wait to return! Laura & Jeff

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel in a nice & quiet neighbourhood”
Reviews.Author: rawaspecial
Reviews.Content: I attempted to book a hotel for Rome beginning of March for the beginning of May and was successful, only after approx. 9 B&B's and Hotels had turned me down, at the Lancelot. Booked a quadruple room through their website, which is great - lists lots of good tips and ideas! Upon arrival at FCO we took an official white taxi (as described on the hotel website!) and paid 42 Euros. Hotel is situated in a nice neighbourhood, not too loud as not too much traffic on the narrow road, which is a big plus, since we slept with window open - A/C is in the room, but it was not so hot yet. Colosseum is a few minutes walk away, you can take the 110 open top bus, but beware, it doesn't stop at the Colosseum on Sundays and that day they have a different route which is not mentioned on the bus maps or anywhere else! Did not take any public buses but I think that there would be more pickpockets on public buses than on a tourist bus which costs 18 Euros per head. Our room was on the first floor. Clean and had one double bed (european queen size), one single bed and a divan bed as well as a balcony for which the Hotel charges 10 Euros per night. Bathroom was clean and big enough for 2 people - one in shower, other brushing teeth. Nice strong shower and toilet was also equipped for the handicapped. Breakfast was very nice and diverse: coffee, tea, fruit juices, various cereals, pastries, white bread, butter, jams, Nutella, even Prosciutto and Salami! We had dinner at the hotel once and the hotel staff really went out of their way to help us! Since 3 of us don't like to eat meat they offered us to have either another portion of the appetizer (cannelloni stuffed with spinach and cheese, my daughter's comment: very yummy!) or some vegetables. I took the veggies and got potatoes dauphinoise with spinach, glazed carrots, some emmental and some cream cheese! We also had one litre of red and white wine each and lots of various bread and breadsticks! Dessert was Tiramisu. Wow! They charged 25 Euros p. person which was ok, considering what we got! Front desk recommended that there's a very nice church 2 streets from the hotel - San Clemente, very old (4th century) and more off the beaten track I would say. The nuns there offered to also show us another church close by, but we had no time as we had to go to the airport. Alltogether it was a nice hotel for a reasonable price, even though the Hotel seems a bit dated already. What makes it special is the knowledgeable & extremely nice staff!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: dirkv
Reviews.Content: A great find for a reasonable price (Euro 170/night for Std double). Breakfast was adequate (cereal, pastry, fruit, coffee, juice, etc). Staff was well above average, very helpful. Location very near to Ancient Rome; about a 20-30 minute walk to Pantheon and Trevi. Local restaurants are adequate, nothing spectacular. About a 10 minute taxi ride from Rome Termini - 10 Euro. Don't miss San Clemente Church a few short block away. Common rooms are very nice, comfortable; lots of english speaking guests; rooms are clean, small, and basic, but when in Rome, who spends much time in their room? Bus # 81 to Vatican, get reservations to museums ahead of time. Metro is at best so-so..nothing like Paris

Reviews.Title: “Great place!!”
Reviews.Author: Ryan50
Reviews.Content: The Lancelot was a great start to our Italian holiday. The staff were warm and very nice. Breakfast was the best on our trip. Our air conditioning failed the first night and was promtly taken care of the next morning. Hated to leave the Lancelot and will be sure to book there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: turleyg
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 5 day stay in the lancelot, we were attending a wedding and it was a great location in which to enjoy Rome, first of all location, 2 minutes from the colleseum and 5 minute walk to subway made it very easy to navigate the sites, there were also a hoast of excellent restaurants and bars in the vicinity of the hotel. The rooms themselves were cosy and spotless at all times, the staff were excellent, very helpful , whether taxis, or advice on places to dine etc. When we stayed, their internet station wasnt working, but there was a internet shop nearby a €1 for 15 minutes. The only downer was breakfast which was'nt that exciting, saying that theres fresh fruit , cerial, breads, juices etc, its just functional, maybe the italian thing is to have tiny plates... All in all a lovely stay in the lancelot

Reviews.Title: “Best Value, great location!”
Reviews.Author: davidv
Reviews.Content: Loved it! Wonderful staff and very clean. Location gives a true taste of Rome and convient to all of Rome. Best hotel during 3 week stay in Italy.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: murns76
Reviews.Content: The best thing about this hotel was the friendly staff, they were only to happy to help and answer any questions we had about trips, how to get there etc and their english was very good! Breakfast was buffet style and was plentiful! Dinner was a set menu if you wished to stay in the hotel, i would recommend going out and trying the plenty of resturants there were around and about the hotel. The location was excellent for the colosseum, a word of warning be very careful crossing the roads!! Even on a green man they are not 100% safe to cross, i think red lights are merely guidelines for the drivers to stop if they feel like it!! The hotel was very clean and had lots of lovely flowers all around the hotel lobby and sitting areas. There was a small courtyard by the bar (this is only accessable by foot, wheelchair users would not get down the steps) despite this the hotel was wheelchair friendly with ramps where appropriate a specific wheelchair friendly room.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, but for older crowd”
Reviews.Author: Eukatuba
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very nice, as described in the other reviews. However, it's quite expensive 170 euros for a double and feels a bit stuffy. Most of its clients are people in their 50-60s, and, judging from the frequent sightings of the Rick Steve's book, big fans of Rick Steve. They offer dinner at their hotel, which is served at round table, where everybody gets to meet each other. I didn't participate, as I am not so much into it. The hotel is also quite far from the center, so I was moreover surprised by the price. I think the "quiet location" praised by many reviewers is much appreciated again by an older crowd. Overall good experience, but I don't think I will return.

Reviews.Title: “Helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: SusanI
Reviews.Content: Have just stayed 3 nights at the Lancelot and agree with all the good reviews about it . We had no problems at all. We found the staff very helpful - the hotel website had said that a taxi from Fiumicino airport to the Lancelot should cost 40 euros, but we couldn't find one at the airport that would charge less than 60. On our return to the airport we asked the hotel reception to book us a taxi, which arrived on time and cost 40 euros! A tip if you do not have a balcony attached to your room - on the 6th floor there is a sign to the terrace, which brings you out onto a small balcony, not attached to any of the bedrooms, where you can relax and sit amongst the flowers and greenery and have a view of the colosseum.

Reviews.Title: “a wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: travelbugsy
Reviews.Content: We had a really enjoyable stay in the Lancelot. It was very clean, full of character and excellently located. It's only about a five minute walk to the colosseum, the forum and other sites. There are also some lovely restaurants and cafes in the area. But the nicest thing about the location is that though it is inevitably touristy to a degree, there still remains a local charm to the area. In the restaurants and cafes you get a mix of tourists and local Italians which really adds to the overall experience. The only downsides to the hotel were that it could be quite noisy quite early (7-8am) in the street in front of the hotel, though it isn't on a busy street-perhaps some type of construction was going on? It didn't ruin our stay by any means but just a warning to ak for a quiet room if you like a lie in. Also, on one of the mornings, we arrived at breakfast at 9:20am (breakfast finishes at 10) and there were no rolls or bread. My husband asked for some as we only wanted some bread and fruit and was told they had none. I think it would have been good service for the staff to get more considering it was within normal breakfast times and would have been easy to pop out to get some around the corner. It was just a minor thing and otherwise the staff were excellent, especially at the front desk, where they were more than happy and able to give information, directions, advice etc. Overall, a really wonderful place to stay in Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Small Friendly Hotel in Quiet Location”
Reviews.Author: VATriplover
Reviews.Content: My husband and I checked several of the hotels recommended on tripadvisor.com in our price range before making a final decision. The Lancelot was perfect for us. The staff spoke excellent English and were very friendly and eager to help with anything we needed. If you are looking for a large room with spacious bathroom, then this may not be the place for you. You need to go to one of the chain hotels and basically get what you get in a chain restaurant - same old thing! Or, you can spend a lot more money for something elegant with everything you need elsewhere. I would say our Lancelot room was small and simple with a small bathroom - just like a lot of the other European hotels we have stayed in throughout the years. The difference is that the Lancelot was spotless, and we never felt cramped at all - just adjusted because everything else was so nice. We had a large window (some have balconies if you can get them) that opened onto the street with a nice view. I will say that last September I stayed at the Marriott World Center in Orlando, and the bathroom there was no larger than the one at the Lancelot! Every morning they post their evening meal menu to help you decide if you want to dine there that evening. We did two evenings and were not sorry. It is a full course meal with wine included and VERY reasonable. We also enjoyed meeting other guests from all over the world. There is a nice lobby if you are interested in visiting more with some of these people after dinner. We had a friend staying in another hotel who lives in the south of France, and she raved over the beautiful fresh flowers that were all over the Lancelot every time she visited us. Just about everything is close, but we did take a taxi to the Vatican and a few other places just to save time (and feet) because we were only there four days and had a lot to see. I also recommend that you get the Lancelot to get someone to pick you up at the airport if you can swing it. We were so relieved to meet our driver when we got off the airplane and have him literally drop us off with luggage at the door of the hotel because the flight over had been a long one. The Lancelot was our favorite of the hotels we stayed in during our trip to Italy, and it was the most reasonable!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Marie5884
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay at Hotel Lancelot. The hotel is spotless, nicely decorated, and on a quiet street. Our room was of moderate size with extra pillows and a blanket in the room. The breakfast had a nice selection of choices each morning. The hotel staff was very professional and helpful. A short walk to the Coloseum and restaurants in the area.

Reviews.Title: “A good hotel, we'd recommend”
Reviews.Author: MrandMrsH
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Lancelot for three nights in mid-March and really liked the hotel. The staff were friendly, spoke excellent English and always willing to provide assistance if requested. The rooms were immaculately clean. The buffet selection at breakfast was good and varied. We did not have an evening meal at the hotel since we were out for most of the day. With respect to location, the hotel is in a very quiet street, yet very close to the Colosseum (5 minute walk). The Pantheon and its surrounds is a 20 minute walk. The bathroom, though small, was perfectly functional with a good shower. Other tips. Of the guide books we used, a combination of Top 10 Rome (DK) and Lonely Planet Rome were good.

Reviews.Title: “Small and overpriced rooms”
Reviews.Author: goonson
Reviews.Content: I've recently returned from staying a weekend at the Lancelot Hotel and was quite disappointed with the hotel. Firstly on the positive side the decor of the hotel is of a high standard throughout and the location is reasonably central. But there were a number of things that I didn't like about the hotel. The room I stayed in was small and for the amount that was charged I would expect a larger room. The bathroon was tiny approximately 6 ft x 3 ft and the shower was so small I had problems turning around in the shower. There was no room in the bathroom to hang clothes and the bathroom storage facility consisted of a small shelf overhanging the toilet. So little space existed my partner dropped a few items into the toilet whilst trying to squeeze everything onto the shelf. Housekeeping woke us up 2 mornings in a row knocking on our doors to clean the rooms at around 08:00 and there was no "do not distrub sign" to keep them away. The next issue to arise was at breakfast. The restaurant consisted of 7 tables and for a hotel with 6 floors of rooms this was clearly not enough. The first two mornings we went for breakfast we couldn't get a table so ended up eating outside of the restaurant whilst other guests waited for a free table. Not the greatest start to the day and to make things worse there was a single waitress managing the breakfast. As hard as she was trying she was clearly overworked and trying to do the work of about 3 people. I almost got up and gave her a hand. Finally there was a bell to press for the reception to open the gate into the courtyard. Most times this worked fine and the gate would open straight away, but over the weekend we soon figured out that if the manageress was on reception it would involve mulitple rings and waiting on the street for a few minutes until she realised a queue of people were waiting to enter. One evening after letting us in (after only 3 rings) we went to collect the key from reception and she just sat there replying to her emails. After 2 minutes of waiting I went behind the desk and helped myself as she clearly had better things to be doing rather than giving her guests room keys and letting them through the gate. Overall it is a beautiful hotel that is overpriced with small rooms and tiny bathrooms and to stay here you really need an open mind to try and see the comical way the hotel is managed.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: RobMo
Reviews.Content: First and foremost this hotel does everything it sets out to do very well. It is clean (very) and the staff were surely the most friendly people we met in Rome. We were always greeted with a smile whenever we saw them and anything we ever asked they always helped with. The rooms were good for a 3* hotel and as I say, were superbly cleaned every day. Shower was also very good (a must in hotel rooms in my opinion). The location was also superb - a 5 minute walk from the collosseum and 15 minutes from the main centre with the Trevi Fountain, Pantheon, Spanish steps etc. The only downside is that I felt this hotel was a little overpriced. That said, I would rather pay €170/night for a good 3* hotel than a bad 4* one.....

Reviews.Title: “Gem of a hotel!”
Reviews.Author: jts227
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a four bedded room with our 8 and 12 year old children for 3 nights. The room was surprisingly large, very clean and comfortable. The bathroom was clean with toiletries and the towels were soft, large and plentiful (unusual these days!). The continental breakfast was good with quite a bit to choose from. The hotel staff were very welcoming, spoke excellent English and answered any questions and queries very thoroughly. The hotel is located within easy walking distance of the Colosseum (take ID for free child entry!) and the Forum and is near to the bus stops to get anywhere else (hotel staff will tell you which bus you need and they are only 1 euro a trip with younger children free). Overall we had a really good trip to Rome and the Lancelot was an excellent place to stay for a family.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: irishtraveller69
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for 3 nights in the Lancelot Hotel. The welcome was warm and friendly, check-in was easy, English was spoken by everyone. Our room was clean and nicely furnished, the bathroom was quite small but clean and fully functional. Absolutely no complaints. The breakfast was fine although no hot food as is the European way! Dinner in the restaurant was interesting when we sat with other guests around the same table and talked. We would definately go back to Lancelot. Location is a short stroll to the Colluseum and while slightly out of the city centre, it is quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Liked it.”
Reviews.Author: guy999
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed the Hotel lancelot, but coming from America made me really wish for the larger size rooms. They did give me one of the famed rooms with terrace, but the room is so small I just felt claustrophobic. The staff was very nice, however they did guide us toward a restaurant that we couldn't find, however we found another on the street that was very enjoyable. I would probably not stay in such a desirable location in the future and travel a bit more so that I could get a bigger room.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: travelpaint
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful time at this hotel. The staff were very friendly and helpful, the hotel was clean and beautiful, and the food was outstanding. We arrived on Christmas Eve, and enjoyed a fabulous four course meal prepared by the hotel chef. The lobby was decorated with cute holiday decorations and provided a very warm atmosphere. We highly recommend this hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Choice in Rome”
Reviews.Author: TheObserverBoston
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Lancelot for 5 nights in December 2006, in Room 60 (6th floor suite with terrace). The suite is very roomy, with a nice sitting room and a marble bathroom, plus its own semi-private terrace with a view of the Colosseum several blocks away. In warmer weather the terrace would have been more useful, but even in winter it's nice to see over the rooftops of Rome--and there is a shared terrace for everyone as well. The room was clean and well maintained, and nicely decorated, including with a small flat panel TV. Unfortunately, there is no wireless Internet access, but they do have a computer on the ground floor with Internet access for one person to use at a time. The service is excellent--the front desk staff helped us make reservations and find attractions and restaurants, a very important benefit in Rome! The breakfast is only OK--the selection is limited and the croissants and the fruit are not consistent in quality--this was the main weak point. But the location is excellent--you can walk to almost anywhere in Rome (except the Vatican, but there is an easy bus with a stop three blocks away). So overall this is a great choice to stay in Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding experience”
Reviews.Author: Valorous
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful stay we had at the Lancelot! It is located on a quiet street (very important in Italy!) just a few minutes walk from the Colloseum - and just down the block from a new archeological find in the church next door that may make it THE place to stay in Rome. Our view out our fifth-floor balcony was of the Colloseum. The decor and appointments of the hotel are elegant and spotless. Our room and bathroom was comfortable and clean. The staff, most of them family are highly educated and well-traveled and speak English very well; they consistently went out of their way to help us with taxis, information, and anything we needed. We had dinner there one night and wished we had had it with them every night, because one of the family is the chef and the food was the best we had in Rome (and absolutely the most reasonable - don't miss having dinner there as often as you can!) The Lancelot is not the least expensive hotel I found but I'd gladly pay more for the experience we had, and we highly recommend it to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “2nd stay excellent again”
Reviews.Author: suze55
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Lancelot for a 2nd time in two years and was happy to see that it had maintained it's high standards. Very helpful staff, lovely clean rooms and nice quiet location but within walking distance of the main sights. This time we had a suite which was much larger than the double rooms and well worth the extra cost, with fantastic views of the city from it's own terrace, highly recommended. Compared to some of the hotels nearer the Trevi fountain, Spanish steps that were far more expensive and had bad reviews on Trip Advisor, I don't think you can go wrong with the Lancelot as long as you're not expecting a 5 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but basic”
Reviews.Author: Sokal
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 3 nights during our honeymoon. I also booked this hotel for the high reviews it received on TripAdvisor. I will say, I think my expectations may have been a little too high because of it. The hotel staff is excellent, as is the location, both mentioned in many of the reviews. However, the room we had was very basic and plain, no frills what so ever. If you don't mind basic hotel rooms, this is a great place for you. The bed was 2 twins pushed together and the bathroom was very small, even when compared to other local hotels we stayed at in Italy. Also, if you book directly with the hotel and make any changes to it, I would contact them before you arrive to confirm details. The changes I made to my original reservation--higher floor for our room, shorter stay than originally planned---were not implemented when we arrived. In the end, the 1st floor room we stayed in had a lovely terrace!

Reviews.Title: “Would recommend”
Reviews.Author: scottishlass8
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel after reading reviews on tripadvisor. The service we received was excellant. The staff at the hotel recommended walks that would encompass the nearby sites, restaurants and transportation. The location is brilliant, away from the busy Termini area and only 2 mins walk from the colloseum and metro. A continental breakfast is included and there is plenty of choice of what to eat. Our only problem was that the air conditioning in the room didn't seem to work so we slept with the window open. I'm sure that it we had mentioned it they would have fixed it but as we were only staying for 3 nights we didn't bother.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent position in Historic Rome.”
Reviews.Author: anany
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this Hotel for a few days recently and found it to be first class, in particular the position of the Hotel is very close to the Colosseum, and therefore most of the important historic sections of Rome can be visited all within a short walk away. The Hotel itself was found to be very clean, and the staff very helpful to all requests either about our stay or places of interest to visit. Nothing was too much trouble. Our only negative comments about the Hotel would be some of the rooms are a little on the small size, and also there is not a great selection for the breakfast menu. Overall though the Hotel is situated in a very quiet area, and there is a good selection of local restaurants in the area.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely stay in the Lancelot Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MaryDoherty
Reviews.Content: Our family of five booked two rooms for 4 nights at the start of November following a recommendation from my sister and having read positive reviews on this website. We were very pleased with our accommodation, especially my husband and I since we had a lovely terrace on our first floor room, so there was space for our three children to come and sit with us. We ate dinner in the hotel on the first night and found it to be very good home-cooking - on other nights we dined at local restuarants such as Charley's Sauciere and ate magnificantly. The hotel staff were friendly, helpful and welcoming, though at times they were over-stretched so that the bar was not always staffed when it needed to be. The hotel proved to be very popular with wedding parties given its proximity to The Irish College where such ceremonies are held. However these were mostly family groups and there was no "hen party" atmosphere. The hotel benefits from being close to the Colisseum and other key sights and is a very comfortable base from which to explore Rome. Our rooms were very clean and warm and although the bathrooms were small they were well equipped. We intend to return to Rome and we will book with the Lancelot again.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel was great!”
Reviews.Author: lovingitaly
Reviews.Content: I can not say enough good things about this hotel. It is so close to the colleseum and from there you can take a bus pretty much anywhere of interest in Rome. I would suggest taking the 110 bus (double decker, outside seating on the top) the first day you get to Rome. It has a bunch of the must see sights on its loop and you pay 11 euros for the day but can get on and off as much as you like. That way, you get a pretty good idea where everything is and there's audio explaining each of the sites. The following day we just used the regular bus system to get to the places that we didn't get a chance to see the first day. The staff spoke English and were so great. They recommended a great place to eat close by - Cafe Luzzi, and were wonderful as far as arranging a cab for us. They also helped us open the bottles of wine that we had bought, and provided us with wine glasses so that we could enjoy it out on our terrace. For the money, you really can't beat this hotel and I would highly recommend it, and will definitely stay there again the next time I'm in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: jgayser
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Lancelot Hotel for 4 nights on our honeymoon and loved it. The front desk staff is very helpful with restaurant recomendations and also helpful with the bus system. Every major bus stops by the Coliseum which is only about 4 blocks or 5 min walk away. Pantheon, Trevi Ftn, Piazza Navonna, Campo di Fiori are all about 15 min walk. Spanish Steps a bit longer like 20+ mins. The rooms are pretty big, the bathroom is not but the shower is very good. I would recomend this hotel to anyone - you'll love it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel in good Location”
Reviews.Author: Salsakitten
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Lancelot for 2 nights 5-7 October. We had arranged an airport pick-up from Fiumicino through the hotel which was great. At €50 it was a similar rate to a normal taxi, but we didn’t have to search or queue for one and knew in advance how much it was going to be. I was hoping to get a room with terrace but unfortunately none were available. Our room on the 4th floor was fine, not exactly spacious but not too small, nicely decorated and had a comfortable bed. We had a view of the road and there was really nothing interesting to see but at least it was a quiet road. The bathroom was tiny, but clean. The location was good and it was easy to get anywhere. There are many sights (mainly the ancient Roman monuments) in walking distance and for further places we took buses. The girl at reception was very helpful with telling us which buses to take from where for our destinations and sold the tickets as well. The continental-style breakfast in the morning was adequate, but it seemed that you had to get there early to get croissants, otherwise only dry rolls were left. We did not take advantage of the evening “round table” dinners. There are some good restaurants in the neighbourhood. We had lunch at Luzzi – the pasta was good, the tiramisu average (with a bit of plastic in it!) and the coffee delicious. We had dinner at Hostaria da Nerone (opposite the Collosseum) which was delicious traditional Roman food and very reasonably priced – our favourite in Rome. We had another pasta lunch at Pasqualino, which was also very good. Accommodation in Rome is expensive and Hotel Lancelot offers good value for money compared to other hotels in this location. We would stay here again, but hope we can get a room with terrace next time so we’ll have a view of the Colosseum.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay at the Lancelot”
Reviews.Author: rockport
Reviews.Content: Excellent loction, within 5 mintues walk to the Coleseum. Staff were extremenly helpful in recommending restaurants and reservations, transfer arrangements. Breakfast was very good. We stayed there for 2 nights at the beginning of our trip and then again for another night at the end of our trip. We had one of their standard rooms on the 2nd floor looking out into a courtyard. Room was small, but comfortable, with a small safe and A/C. Bathroom shower stall was reasonably sized especially compared to some others in Europe I experienced. Would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a clean, reasonably priced, well-located hotel in a quieter area of Roma. We walked everywhere from the Lancelot...as far as the Vatican, Spanish Steps. Great city!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel & Service at the Lancelot”
Reviews.Author: Zampano
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Lancelot Sept 13- 17th and were very pleased with everything about this small, lovely hotel.
