On a previous trip to Rome we stayed in the Piazza Navona area and although it was fine we definitely liked the quieter and more neighbourhood type atmosphere of the Lancelot. Not to mention it is only minutes from the Colosseum and Forum. We had a lovely suite on the 6th floor which had a spacious living area, separate bedroom and large bath and most of all a spacious terrace with great views of the Colosseum and the dome of St. Peter's. Mrs Khan and her staff provide personal and attentive service. The front desk staff speak English and are always friendly and helpful. I happened to be celebrating my birthday on one of the nights we ate at the hotel. Mrs Khan surprised me towards the end of a lovely dinner with champagne and a birthday cake. We had not mentioned it to her but she had noticed my birth date on my passport when we checked in. My husband and I have travelled to Europe on at least 7 or 8 occasions and have never experienced the friendliness, the courtesies and the desire to please on the part of Mrs Khan and her staff. This hotel is outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel”
Reviews.Author: RogerRabbitsRun
Reviews.Content: Stayed at The Hotel Lancelot for four days , the hotel is in a perfect location to walk to most of the sights and a bus to the Vatican ( No. 81 ) stops at the end of the road. The Hotel is clean and tidy and the staff are the friendliest I have come across. The evening meal which includes wine is superb value at 21 euros. The rooms are a good size with a/c and are soundproof. For the money you will not find a better Hotel in Rome

Reviews.Title: “A Great City Hideaway”
Reviews.Author: matkustaja
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Lancelot for a weekend Sept 1 - 3, This is our second trip to Rome and first time staying in Lancelot , the last trip we stayed near Spanish Steps - the location was great but the hotel ( Hotel Homs ) was a absolute horror and noisy. This time we wanted a different location and after reading all reviews we decided on Hotel Lancelot. I made direct reservation via Lancelot website - paid 165 euros per night, location is excellent , easy to get everywhere with the bus 87 and 85 which takes us to Vatican for just one euro , it is a city hideaway and very quiet. All staff we have encounter very friendly and helpful including the taxi drivers arranged by Lancelot. The room just like in any other Europe is small and nothing to shout about. After reading all reviews I paid extra 15 euros to get the 6th floor room with big terrace, surprisingly very quiet and pleasant (Room no 62 ). After a tired day out we really appreciate undisturb sleep thru out the night. Many good traitorias around with reasonable price and good food ( recommend by Lancelot staff ) compared to staying around Spanish Steps - full of typical tourists restaurants with rift off prices. We even took our chance and go to CRAB a nearby seafood restaurant , we know good fresh seafood is not cheap in Rome so we are prepared to pay more, we were not disappointed - the hot seafood plater we had was very delicious and worth the price. Service was 5 star. We definitely stay here again and highly recommend Hotel Lancelot. Regards from A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: scphel
Reviews.Content: Great location, near the Colliseum/Forum/Plantino. The room was very comfortable for the three of us (except the shower was a bit small for my 6'4" body). Fortunately the ac worked very well since we were there in a July heat wave. The Shah's and their staff were very helpful and attentive. The breakfast was great and the everning dinner was even better. We highly recommend the Lancelot!

Reviews.Title: “An excellent value in an interesting area...”
Reviews.Author: gene
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Lancelot for five nights mid June based on reviews on Travel Advisor. We found reviews to be accurate and our experience was generally a good one. We booked the sixth floor room with terrace which was really nice as the room was very small and it was great to sit out there and see the colliseum especially at night all aglow in lights. General Celio area is really neat and as I had been to Rome many times I enjoyed staying in a less crowded area and the little restaurants in the area were great and reasonably priced. Staff at hotel very nice and if you needed breakfast before they open they would make a note and be there in the morning open for you. It was very very hot and our A/C was not functioning up to par and we really got no response from front desk in solving the problem...only complaint about the Hotel. Since it did work somewhat we just made the best of it but I did feel we were blown off with respect to that situation. For the money this is an excellent choice in Rome and the location although not totally central was good and easily accessible to all modes of transportation and taxis were very easy to get .

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: artgaldm
Reviews.Content: We spent three terrific nights at the Hotel Lancelot this June. It was the beginning of a 2 week trip to Italy for a group of friends. We had two rooms on the top floor, a double and a triple. Both had balconies covered in fragrant flowers with lovely tables and chairs to soak in the amazing views of the Colosseum and the Vatican. The hotel is very well located just a few steps from the Colosseum and in a great neighborhood for restaurants. The staff were so helpful and kind throughout our stay. We appreciated the ample breakfasts and the beautiful decor. Their courtyard is very relaxing and quiet, though (because of our terraces,) we spent most of our time at the hotel upstairs enjoying our views! The staff arranged our train tickets to Arezzo and suggested really good places to eat, away from the hordes of tourists. We also found a local wine shop that was excellent! The other thing that was very nice about the Lancelot was the mix of clients from many different countries. We even met a couple who had met at the Lancelot as young students over 30 years ago (she from Australia, he from the States) who were back for a visit. I have stayed at other hotels in Rome and, for the price and amenities, this is a real find. I would return again.

Reviews.Title: “Lancelot hotel”
Reviews.Author: 007wife
Reviews.Content: The Lancelot was perfect for our site seeing needs. The location is near the Colosseum and was a nice place to begin the day from. The breakfast there is really great. They also offer a three course dinner for 20 euros/pp. The dinner was okay, but the free breakfast, nice rooms, clean bathrooms, updated facilities, bar, internet room and board games/books to borrow are what make this hotel a bargain. The owners and staff are so kind and helpful too. They will call reputible taxis, receive faxes, book tours, suggest nice restaurants at a moments notice. La Dolce Vita indeed!

Reviews.Title: “Fab & Friendly”
Reviews.Author: mda_yorkshire
Reviews.Content: My fiancée and I stayed at the Lancelot for 3 nights in June and loved everything about it. Our air conditioned room was a good size and spotlessly clean, with the added bonus of a little balcony with a table and two chairs. We found that the staff could not do enough for us, whether it was booking us dinner at a local restaurant (Da Giggetto which was fabulous), advising us on bus routes, or arranging a taxi. The location of the hotel is superb. Only 5 minutes walk from the Colosseum and The Forum. The Piazza Navona is about 20 minutes walking and the Vatican and Spanish Steps are a short bus trip. Take bus 81 for the Vatican and 117 for the Spanish Steps from the bus stop just around the corner. Don’t miss the hotel’s beautiful inner courtyard which is the perfect spot to enjoy a cold drink after a hot day’s sight seeing. Overall we could not recommend this hotel highly enough and will be stay there again when we return to Rome (Well we did throw three coins in the Trevi Fountain)

Reviews.Title: “Weekend in Rome”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I just returned back form hot weekend in Rome where i spend 2 days in Lancelot hotel with my girlfriend. This is a nice hotel overall, it has a good location, 5 min walk from Colosseum. If you are planing to come with the car, they have 5 parking spaces infront of hotel, cost is 10€ per night. Rooms are spacy, clean and nicely decorated. I recomend not to sleep with open window because you can hear a lot of car noice in the morning from 8.00 on. The only minus point of this hotel is the breakfast...its horrible, you dont get even one type of chees or bacon, no fresh vegatables, very poor selection of yogurts and fruit, all in all...if you can, dont eate breakfast in this hotel, request a rate without brakfast and go to some local coffee shop and get a good sandwich for 3€. We paid 165€ per night, breakfast and tax included - this is a very good value for money, i think you can not get better hotel for this money in Rome. Will definitely stay again in this hotel...hope they do something with their breakfast by then :)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Moriarty
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights at the Lancelot - rooms & shower rooms are smallish but confortable, well kept, very clean, excellent air conditioning and quiet. Our standard room had a small balcony overlooking the street and the large terraces (these adjoin first floor superior rooms that accommodate more guests/families. Good choice of continental breakfast items served buffet style. We did not take dinner at the hotel - fixed price/menu/time - but heard from other guests that it was good. Pleasant bar with indoor and courtyard seating. The staff at the desk was excellent - friendly, efficient, fluent in English and advised us on bus routes (they sell tickets) tours, dress codes etc. They also arranged our taxi from and to the airport (75 euro each way for a private transfer for six people). We found the location very convenient for either walking around Rome or picking up local or tourist buses. There is a good choice of ristorante and trattoria in the adjoining streets and grocery stores, gelateria and an excellent wine shop on the corner of Capo d'Africa. We would recoomend the nearby Trattoria Luzzi for a lively atmosphere, good quality and reasonable prices. The hotel is excellent value for money and highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Lancelot”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Lancelot for 6 nights this February following our wedding in Rome and we were very happy wiith our choice. The room was large, clean and comfortable with a great view from the terrace and the staff were friendly and helpful. Please be advised that there are no irons in the rooms in this hotel and that the requirement is to send garments for ironing a day in advance.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location!”
Reviews.Author: Hollidayo
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Lancelot for 7 nights in May and really enjoyed it! I chose it based on the recommendation of two guidebooks I had bought and also the reviews here on trip advisor and it lived up to the good billing. I had booked a single room and have to admit that at first I was a little disappointed that I wasn't given a room with a balcony when I had practically begged when I made the reservation two mos. prior, but my single (that was why - only doubles & above get balconies or terraces) was very clean and comfortable and the staff couldn't have been nicer. The toilet was not working properly when I arrived and they had it fixed as quickly as possible. One caveat: my room was on the first floor (#8) and there was a bit of morning noise a couple of the days I was there, but that might have been because I slept in a bit and wasn't up with the 7 a.m. crowd. I absolutely loved the location in a great residential neighborhood on the south side of the Colosseum, which had enough restaurants & bars to keep any tourist happy. It was very convenient for both public transportation and/or walking anywhere in the city, which I did a ton of and I never failed to get a kick out of seeing the Colosseum while heading down the street from the hotel :) The ambience of the hotel is really nice, with a lovely courtyard in the front, very nice sitting rooms and a beautiful garden near the bar. The one night I had a drink there, it was a bit expensive, but it is a very relaxing atmosphere to kick back in after a long day of sightseeing. They have a very nice continental breakfast spread, which is included in the room's price and is a fun way to meet other travelers if you're in the mood to do so. They also offer dinners at an extra cost, which I didn't try although the menus sounded good. I also liked being able to check my email in a computer room off the lobby. All in all, I really liked the Lancelot and would definitely stay there again the next time I'm in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: papa4330
Reviews.Content: My Wife & I and my mother inlaw stayed at the Lancelot for two nights after our transatlantic cruise. My wife and I had a twin room and my mother inlaw had a single. Both were on the 5th floor. The rooms were very clean and had all the extras that a standard room in the US would have. The hotel is in a very good location for touring Rome. Mrs Kahn and her son run the hotel and they are like family to guests. We ate in the dineing room both nights and the food was excellent. When we return to Rome again for a visit we will deffently stay there again. If anyone has any other questions that I can answer please email me at papa4330@yahoo.com.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: jerink22
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Lancelot for 3 nights and were very pleased. It is a stone's throw away from the Colloseum and and all public transportation, which was very convenient. While the rooms were small compared to U.S. standards, they were very nice and the bathroom was nice too. The staff at the front desk was always friendly and very helpful. The breakfast was great, a nice variety. I would definitely recommend this hotel if you are looking for a reasonably priced hotel in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Lancelot Really Exceeds Expectations”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for five nights as part of a two week Tour of Italy, and were very pleased. The location is great, our complimentary breakfast was the best we had of the six hotels we stayed at (all found via TripAdvisor, by the way....) and the staff's service was absolutely superior. They were so willing to help - their taxi service is at the hotel's entrance within three minutes of being called - very impressive. I was on the search for "cannolis", and one staff member recommended a Sicilian pasticerria (called Dagnino, in Piazza della Republica) that was out of this world. The best part of the hotel was the bar area - where it seemed as though all the "social" guests congregated at the end of the day to share stories of the Rome sights or other worldly experiences. The room adornments and decor left something to be desired (at least some sort of picture above our bed would have made a world of difference), but when you get down to it, this is not a resort hotel where you'd spend a significant amount of time in your room, anyway - so who really cares? The A/C unit in the room worked and was adequate - something which we struggled with at our other hotels. Overall, we loved Lancelot, and would recommend it to any traveler looking for a great value.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: haroldz
Reviews.Content: While in Rome last month (April), we stayed at the Lancelot for six nights. The hotel is reasonably priced and has a very friendly and helpful staff, e.g., the receptionist suggested that we not miss the Basilica of San Clemente which is just a couple of blocks away. We had not known about its interesting history and would have missed it otherwise. The Lancelot is also within easy walking distance from the Coliseum and Forum. While returning one evening, we ducked out of the rain at Le Naumachie and found what should undoubtedly be qualified as a five-star restaurant - so good that we returned for the next five evenings. You will find excellent Italian food at a reasonable price and will dine in a very comfortable and unpretentious atmosphere. Le Naumachie is a few blocks east of the Coliseum at Via Celimontana, 7. Go there; you won't be disappointed. (Ask for the waiter Attilio, since I told him he would become famous on the Internet).

Reviews.Title: “close to the Coleseum, Palatine hill, Roman Forum”
Reviews.Author: ThoughtsbyMaria
Reviews.Content: We thought this hotel was wonderful! My husband and I and our parents stayed here for 5 nights in April 2006. The staff was very nice and helpful. The rooms are quiet, clean, and the beds are comfortable. The day we left we all gathered at the train station to go on to Bologna. My in-laws needed to get their train tickets validated and it turned out that my father-in-law had forgotten his money belt and passport in his room at the hotel. We called the hotel and a staff member went out of his way to bring the missing items to us at the train station. We thought this was just incredible service as we were prepared to ask them to just hold the items while we made our way back to the hotel to pick them up ourselves. We tried to give the staff person some money to thank him but he refused and wished us well on our journey. We loved that the hotel was so close to many historical sites. There are very nice restaurants in the same neighborhood as the hotel and there is even a great gelateria about a block from the hotel. The hotel was also very helpful in getting our reservation time for the Vatican Museum. My husband and I would definitely stay at the hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Only had two nights stay in rome but definitley chose a good hotel! The staff are exceptionally helpful and friendly, the service is excellent and the hotel is clean and bright. Though not luxurious the rooms are more than adequate and the showers are brilliant! Excellent vlaue for money. Close to the colloseum but you may need to travel to areas for more restaurants and nightlife, though buses are only a shot walk away and easy to use. Definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: riffs
Reviews.Content: This Hotel was the largest we stayed at during a first trip to Italy. Very nice hotel with all the eminities. Great location close to the colisuem and very friendly and helpfull staff. We were not all that please with their restaurant suggestions, but other than that, they gave really good advice. Very clean, nice onsite bar area including outside area. We would all stay here again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: DaisyDancer
Reviews.Content: There were 6 of us who stayed at the Hotel Lancelot for several days in April 2006. (My husband and I had never been to Italy before, so we had nothing to compare it with.) This family-run place is a gem. It is clean, quiet, within walking distance of many sights (about 5 min. from the Colosseum!), and it has a lift. The staff is over-the-top helpful and friendly. My husband and I returned late for supper one night, having had the adventure of his camera being stolen while on a local bus. We were a wreck to say the least. The young woman at the desk saw to it that we got our dinner (we were half an hour late) and soothed our frazzled nerves. Another member of the staff told my husband where he could get another camera, which he did, the next day. We were able to buy stamps at the desk, and the staff mailed the postcards for us. Our room was just lovely, very quiet (we were awakened by birds singing) and the bathroom was small but incredibly clean. We were given fresh towels every day, and the bed was made every day. We took advantage of the in-hotel laundry service and were totally pleased with that. The breakfast buffet was amazing...several kinds of dry cereal, several kinds of rolls and croissants, coffee cakes, yogurt, little pots of jam, honey, butter, fresh fruit, slices of ham and cheese, milk, two kinds of juice, the usual coffee, tea and hot chocolate. The dinner menu is posted every day and those meals were delicious! The seating is 'family style', with 6-8 at a round table, so you get a chance to visit with other guests. We enjoyed one dinner with a family from Ireland, and another with two ladies from Canada. We would definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: maryandsteve
Reviews.Content: We spent a wonderful week on the Lancelot in preparation for our wedding in Rome. It is such a peaceful haven but so near so many good restauranst and right around the corner from the colloseum. The staff esp Paola and Lorena were so helpful in many ways...they really helped with the organisation of our wedding day. We didnt have any evening meals in the hotel although they did smell wonderful. Breakfast was lovely...no fry-up but for me that was a nice change. The only minor thing was that the bathrooms in the rooms are quite small but that didnt make any difference to our stay at all. It was all wonderful and we look forward to returning some day.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely Recommend It”
Reviews.Author: Partyof5fromsocal
Reviews.Content: This was the last stop on our Italy vacation. We couldn't have ended it better. The hotel was quite charming, the staff was more than helpful and extremely pleasant. They really made us feel welcome. It was just a short walk to the colosseum and even though it was a bit far from Vatican City, we were able to walk our way back which enabled us to explore the ancient streets and beautiful buildings of Rome. The breakfast was okay, but more than plenty for us. Rooms were fine, we could see how there might be noise from neighbors, but we were lucky. There were also some good restaurants closeby within walking distance. We definitely would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “a great find”
Reviews.Author: acmes
Reviews.Content: We stayed over during Easter Week and couldn't have been happier. The location is ideal, just steps to the major sites of Imperial Rome, yet the neighborhood is calm and quiet. The staff was most helpful in answering questions about travel outside of Rome and making restaurant reservations. The breakfast selection was ample and would appeal to most tastes: no eggs, but plenty of pastries fruit, yogurt & cereals. We didn't opt for dinners because we were eager to try several different restaurants in Rome. We stayed in two different rooms: the first was somewhat simple but fine for one night--3 beds. It had a large comfortable terrace that helped us spread out a bit. The bathroom was a bit awkward but that may have been due to its handicapped-accessible status (which all Italian hotels must comply with). Our second room on the 6th floor was terrific, two seperate rooms with a lovely decorative glass door between the two. The kids were thrilled not have to sleep on a pull-out couch for once. The terrace features a phenomenal view of the Colleseum and St. Peters. It almost felt like we lived in Rome. One minor compaint: the bathroom featured one of those typical European glass shower partitions that never fail to leak--I've encountered these all over Europe and remain mystified at their popularity. It's a small quibble with an overall great place. We'll be staying here again without a doubt.

Reviews.Title: “Some thoughts, mostly positive, but a caution”
Reviews.Author: ELCHALJE
Reviews.Content: Stayed with my spouse 3 nights in April 2006. Hotel is very clean and the staff is most helpful and friendly. Room was pretty small and so was the bath. Price was high compared to other places in Europe, but I guess Rome hotel prices are just high period. Neighborhood is fine and some good Italian restaurants nearby. Some pricey and some very reasonable. Long uphill walk to mediocre shopping area. Surprised to find taxi rates very reasonable in Rome. About 8 Euros to the Borghese Gallery and same to the best shopping area in Rome--quite an experience. Hotel breakfast was average but again very clean and nicely presented. Good coffee. Overall reaction. Rome is such a zoo with the traffic and action that it seems very important to have a spacious and relaxing place to unwind. This hotel did not qualify on that point as the room was too small. I would spend some more for a larger room with some more touches--or, I would go outside the city and find a nicer and larger place and commute to the tourist sites.

Reviews.Title: “An all round winner!”
Reviews.Author: ed180
Reviews.Content: Just returned from an Easter break at the Lancelot and couldn't fault it. Excellent location 5 minutes walk from the Colliseum. Lovely clean room with very comfortable beds! Good choice at breakfast and although we didn't stay in for an evening meal we did hear good reports. Plenty of restaurants in the vicinity.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and wonderful staff!”
Reviews.Author: andasamo
Reviews.Content: We shared a triple room for 5 nights in mid-March and thoroughly enjoyed our stay. The location was perfect, within walking distance to all the sights in central Rome, plus close to public transportation for destinations further afield. We absolutely loved being so close to the Colosseum and found ourselves awestruck every time we walked past. The gentleman from the hotel mapped us out a wonderful night walk one evening, taking in the Trevi Fountain and Spanish Steps, and along to a lookoff spot called Pincio, which offered the most spectacular view of the city by night. Another day, he mapped us out a fantastic route from the Vatican back to the hotel, which took us past the Piazza Navona, the Pantheon and St. Ignazio church. All of the staff were very friendly and helpful whenever we had questions or needed items such as bus tickets. We liked the round table dining experience, where we met many wonderful fellow travellers. The breakfast itself was top notch. The fruit - both dried and fresh - was our favourite, along with the chocolate pastries!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, friendly service”
Reviews.Author: oakridge_10
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 5 nights out of 21 in Italy. The hotel has a very good location. Everything worth seeing is within walking distance. We ate dinner 1 night and breakfast every day. The dinner was very good. The breakfasts were average. We sat with other guests for meals and they were friendly and all spoke English. We had a first floor terrace which was great since we are smokers and smoking is not allowed in the hotel. The terrace was about 16x16 almost the same size as the room. The room needs some upgrading and free internet service would be nice. The bed was excellent. A nice bar. Very friendly staff and excellent transportation to the airport. I would recommend it but the shutters were hard to open and close, we never could figure out how to use the heat or the phone. We had no trouble getting ice. Maid service was prompt. The bathroom modern.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel; Good Location; Some Noise Issues”
Reviews.Author: livn247
Reviews.Content: We paid a relatively hefty price for a triple room and were a bit disappointed in both the room and the amount of noise. The room itself was clean, nicely decorated, and had comfortable beds; however, the bathroom was remarkably small. I am of average size and kept bumping the door open while trying to maneuver around. Our room faced a courtyard shared by other buildings (not related to the hotel). On one evening, a child's birthday party was held in the courtyard for several hours and on the following evening a wedding party (with the hotel) partied well into the night. The noise echoing between the buildings was remarkably loud. The hotel is located in a pleasant neighborhood about 3 blocks from the Colosseum, but otherwise a bit remote from most of the other major Rome sites. In the future, I think we would try for a different hotel located further towards the center of activities (perhaps around the Pantheon). On the plus side, breakfast was quite nice, the staff was very friendly, and there's a small bar that provided the ever necessary bottle of evening Italian wine!

Reviews.Title: “Great place and location to explore Rome”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I spent a lot of time on the web selecting a nice place to stay for 3 nights in Rome, and the Lancelot Hotel caught my eye on Tripadvisor. Maybe we got unlucky in the room that was allocated to us, but there wasn´t a lot of sunlight and there was only space for 1 person in the bathroom. But this did not affect our stay at all. How could it, with Rome sunny and 22 degrees Celsius, friendly staff, very clean hotel, not a noise from the streets despite the central location, a functional safe in the room, a helpful map from the front desk and great beds!! In Rome, who needs more than a quiet, clean and friendly haven since you hardly spend time in your room anyway? We paid 165 euro per night for B&B, which I still believe is quite a bit of money, but compared to some other places we saw, it´s pretty good value for money in Rome for the the time of the year. One night we had a very entertaining dinner out, just 2 blocks from the hotel. Out of the gate turn left, then turn right at the first crossing, walk straight for 2 blocks and you´ll find a restaurant with small terrace, run by a family. People were queuing up to get a spot. We had a bruschetta, 2 pizza´s and half a liter of white house wine. Total bill: 15 euro...

Reviews.Title: “great roman base”
Reviews.Author: mikesam
Reviews.Content: booked a quick weekend in Rome with my 21 year-old daughter. Missed our flight so e-mailed hotel; instant, sympathetic response. Arrived, location great, next to Collosseum. Staff great hotel v. good (even the visiting yanks that we ate & got drunk with said it was good, espec. enjoying a cigarette with Mrs. Khan, the owner.) This is a professional, freindly hotel with good facilities that delivers great value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, beautiful views, an oasis in chaotic Rome”
Reviews.Author: MaineIzzy
Reviews.Content: One of the few hotel experiences that has met, and in some regards, surpassed my expectations. We arrived at the hotel around 10 am, exhausted from the overnight flight. We were surprised and delighted that our room was ready within the hour. We were served latte in a nice sitting room. We stayed in #62, which is one of the terrace rooms with views of the Colosseum. The terrace was much more beautiful and spacious than expected. An incredible spot. The room was nothing special (could actually use a fresh coat of paint), but it was clean and comfortable. The shower was good, but will overflow if used for a super-soaker shower. The only downside of the terrace room: the terrace is not entirely private, as it adjoins a public terrace with only a movable metal gate separating it. Most people respected the gate, but we did have a few surprise moments when people were on our terrace. Also, the fire door was just outside our room door, and repeated opening and closing during the night kept us awake a few nights. The staff is wonderful. Exceedingly friendly and accommodating. The dinner at the Lancelot was good, not the best we had, but good, well-priced, and a cool opportunity to talk with other guests. The breakfast is simple, with coffee juice, rolls and croissants. The Lancelot is an oasis in the chaos of Rome. It's just minutes by foot to the Colosseum and Forum, but feels removed from all the hustle and bustle.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Henruy
Reviews.Content: I brought a small group to the Lancelot, and plan to do so again. The staff is warm and friendly, beds were great, location fantastic. The hotel was spotlessly clean. Every member of my group liked the hotel. Even though the location is central to the classical area, it is very quiet as it is at the end of the street. There are many restaurants and cafes in the area, as well as music bars and nightclubs - something for everyone.

Reviews.Title: “lived up to very high expectations”
Reviews.Author: helenamat
Reviews.Content: I was recommended this hotel and it certainly lived up to my expectations. Staff were friendly and went out of their way to help. The food was lovely and had well thought out evening menus. Our fellow guests at dinner were repeat guests for many years, which i think is testiment to hospitality shown at the hotel. It is not too far out of the way if you like walking but if not, the metro is not far away either. The only downside was that guests in the next room woke us up 2 nights running, coming in drunk and slamming doors over and over again. We did mention it to the hotel staff begrudgingly as we knew it was no fault of the hotel itself, just the selfishness and ignorance of these guests. The hotel took our complaint seriously and spoke to the guests in question, which we were pleased about as they did nearly ruin our holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Location”
Reviews.Author: Dreamin23
Reviews.Content: I absolutely loved this hotel. It was quaint and quiet and only 2 blocks from the Colosseum. We were met by Giovanni at the airport which was wonderful and I highly recommend it after a long trip. Our room was a nice size and the balcony was spectacular. The breakfast each morning was very good. Try the Nutella chocolate spread. It is delicious. After a LONG day touring Rome, the small bar in the hotel is a wonderful spot to relax. It is very cozy and opens to a private patio. I would suggest if you want to see a lot of Rome and only have a couple days to do it, to take an escorted tour. There is just too much to see in a short amount of time and if you're not sure where your going, it can get a little confusing. Whatever you do, "do not" rent a car. The driving is absolutely crazy here and some of the streets are very small. The only reason I gave this hotel a neutral rating is because of the very last experience we had at the hotel. Let me first say that all but one of the staff members was absolutely wonderful to work with. I was in communication with the hotel for a couple of weeks before we arrived and received great information and wonderful service. The problem arose when we were checking out and I asked for a cab to take us to the train station. The front desk was aware we were 4 adults in a room and were checking out, so we obviously were taking our luggage with us, however, they failed to ask us how many bags we had so when the taxi arrived he could not accomodate us. We had 4 bags, one per person which seems pretty reasonable to me but the cars/taxis in Rome are very small, which is something the locals are aware of and it is their responsibility to make that clear to their guests. Well the taxi driver was very upset because we would not go without our luggage and when I went in to ask the front desk clerk what we should do she became extremely irate very quickly and proceeded to blame and reprimand me for not telling her that we had luggage. I tried to explain to her that I was not aware we had to tell her this since it was obvious we were checking out of the hotel and if this is typically an issue she should be asking her guests a few more questions before calling the taxi. I was really upset by this whole experience because we had enjoyed a wonderful couple of days in the hotel up to this point but this exchange changed my entire opinion and I would probably not stay at this hotel again. The problem is this could have so easily been avoided if this particular woman had done her job correctly to begin with and if she had handled it the appropriate way afterwards. I didn't mind paying the taxi for coming to the hotel, even though I didn't feel like it was our mistake. I realize we are in a different country and communcation is sometimes strained, but it was the way she handled things that made the situation so bad. I had just given this hotel $500.00 and this woman is berating me in front of everyone in the lobby because of a mistake she made. A wonderful gentleman then took over and told us he would call another cab for us. It took about 20 mintues for the second cab to arrive and while we were waiting, he came out and apologized to us. Although it was very nice for him to do this and we appreciated it very much, it was not his responsibility to apologize for something that someone else did. Moral of this story is, if you are going to stay at the Hotel Lancelot and have luggage, make sure to tell the front desk how many pieces you have upon checkout and that you need a LARGE taxi.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel - great location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We had the most wonderful five days at this lovely hotel in Rome, which is how I imagine hotels used to be, in a delightfully old fashioned way. This is not to say that the faciilities are not excellent - the rooms and bathrooms are spotless and tastefully furnished. Some have view of the colesseum and St Peters; most have balconies. The staff are fantastic -so friendly and helpful (and multi-talented - all have excellent English - one is a pianist and plays the piano for guests in the evening.) Unusually for us, we decided to take half board and were not disappointed with the delicious and varied suppers we ate every night which were exceptionally good value (an adequate table wine included in the price). At dinner, you sit at shared round tables, so eat with other residents. We were initally quite anxious about this but in fact, meeting interesting people from other places and sharing our experiences of Rome, was one of the memorable parts of our holiday. This hotel feels like a home from home - such a lovely atmosphere. The repeat business from people coming back year after year is a testament to how great this hotel is. In all, this hotel is a little gem and I would recommend it to anyone visiting Rome. I look forward to visiting the Lancelot again when I am next in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Thank you so much for your kindness.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Lancelot is a gem of a hotel with staff that goes way out of their way to help you. I had originally booked into a bed and breakfast not far from the Lancelot, when I got there at one in the morning the woman at the desk didn’t speak English and they didn’t have a phone for me to use. I had a problem with my travel arrangements for my son and I was quite distraught. The room smelled like urine and the internet didn’t work. I decided to leave and I found myself wandering the streets of Rome at 1:30 in the morning alone with no where to go. I met a kind man who showed me to the Lancelot Hotel where they immediately found me a room and checked me in. The hotel is so quaint and lovely and the room was just perfect, it was super clean and the bed was so comfortable. The next morning when I went to the front desk, I was upset due to my son’s travel arrangements getting mixed up and he was still stuck in Milano. We had made plans to meet for the weekend and by accident he had boarded the wrong train and ended up in Milano instead of Rome. I had not seen him in several months and I was so looking forward to our weekend together. When I told my story to the wonderful people at the Lancelot they immediately helped me to find an airline ticket for my son. They found me a good deal on a flight and they helped me by taking me to the metro station and gave me instructions on how to find my way to the airport. They even called me on my son’s cell to make sure I got there safely. The kindness and concern they showed me was over the top and I will never forget them. I highly recommend this wonderful sanctuary of a hotel. The location is perfect for site seeing the Colosseum. There are lots of nice restaurants nearby and the hotel is a fantastic location in the oldest more historical part of Rome. Thank you again to the wonderful hospitality and genuine concern and kindness. I hope one day to return for another visit. Christine Montreal, Canada.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel near the Colosseum!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We went on a Mediterranean Cruise for our honeymoon and stayed 2 nights in Rome after at the Lancelot. This hotel was absolutely the cutest place! The hotel has marble floors everywhere! It's in a very quiet neighborhood right next to the Colosseum. We tried to get a room with a balcony (6th floor I believe) but there were none left. However, there is a little public terrace that overlooks the Colosseum and we had a beautiful view. Some people complained of the small bathrooms but after being on the ship they were not THAT small. Normal size I would say. The staff has to be the friendliest I have encountered in a while. The cold breakfast has everything you could want in the morning (yogurt, bagels, muffins, etc.). We went to a restaurant around the corner and it was delicious. There is also a gelato shop VERY close, and seeing how we could not get enough of it, we are experts on THAT subject! The only thing I could complain about would be the air conditioning. We couldn't figure it out at first. But once we did we were in heaven! Anyway, we loved the hotel and can't wait to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “An Emotional Experience - by Buggy Myartin”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Lancelot for 4 nights in February. It is emotional to think of my time there. The staff were fantastically friendly and the setting was splendid. I look forward to my return to the hotel as I plan to stay for a much longer spell with my partner Bernard. During this time I will seek plumbing work in the beautiful city of Rome. I would very highly recommend the Hotel Lancelot, a most beautiful and elegant Italian hotel. It sure makes a welcome change from my home town of the Blanch in eastern Ireland.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely above average accommodation”
Reviews.Author: Serge-Michael
Reviews.Content: Very nice stay in this hotel: on a quiet street - we had a clean, small, very simply furnished room, great small balcony with charming views on the coliseum and lots of greenery. Lots of storage area and an in-room safe. If you can do it, opt for the last floor units, with superb terraces. Owner and staff are fabulously courteous, very helpful and smiley. Nice “home-like” atmosphere. The common areas are warmly decorated and very pleasant, specially the small bar. Although the food is average, the formula of round tables is a good way of getting to know fellow travelers. Breakfast is healthy, a good start for a long day of walking in this fabulous city! Location is superb, at the foot of the Coliseum and Roman Forum, (charming walks, at night, after dinner, to see it illuminated) Laterano, St Clemente and Palatine Hill. Lots of restaurants nearby, all very good and widely used by locals: had a fantastic time at one of them for New Year’s Eve! Grocery store within a couple of blocks. All in all a very nice experience: we would stay there again, without hesitation!

Reviews.Title: “A Smart quiet and very welcoming hotel near the Colisseum”
Reviews.Author: delle
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from Rome having stayed at the Lancelot regrettably for only 4 nights as a surprise trip for my wife's birthday. The Hotel had been recommended by a friend of ours and it surpassed our expectations. The owners could not have been more welcoming and really made us feel part of their family surprising my wife with gifts on her birthday. The owner has had time over the years to furnish and decorate public areas and rooms with an eclectic variety of furniture, objects and paintings of different periods that truly give a very relaxing athmosphere. The Colisseum is about 500 metres away and if you are lucky enough to be given a 6th floor room you will have a view to die for. Even so the Hotel is tucked away in a side street in a very quiet and secure location. The continental breakfast served cater for all nationalities with a large variety to choose from. We threw a coin in the Trevi fountain wishing to go back soon to the Lancelot. Highly recommended

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: shetlandlass1978
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Lancelot a couple of weeks ago with my mum and brother. We arranged for the hotel to arrange a taxi pickup to and from the airport and this there was absolutely no problem with this. The driver Giovanni is very nice. The hotel is located on a quiet street which is a 5 min walk from the Colesseum. We walked everywhere in Rome and found this hotel very central with most sights 20-30 mins away and as it was near such a big landmark we could not get lost. The hotel room was lovely it was very big and had plenty of room and had a little balcony with table and chairs outside, the bathroom was spacious also. Our room was cleaned everyday. The tv only had one english speaking channel (BBC World) we thought this would not bother us but after walking about all day and coming in not too late it would have been nice to have something to watch before bed. The breakfast was great it had a bit of everything, we never had an evening meal in the hotel so could not comment about that. There is a little bar which is very comfy and is like sitting in a living room. The staff spoke fluent english and where helpful with directions however when we were leaving we were not asked if we had a nice stay or if we enjoyed rome etc, which I thought was a little unfriendly. I would recommend this hotel but in my opinion I think it is a place that is maybe better for couples on vacation.

Reviews.Title: “What a gem of a find in Rome”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: What an absolute gem the Hotel Lancelot is. Mrs Khan and her staff are superb, very friendly and yet at the same time very efficient. Our room was spacious clean and tidy. The hotel is so close to the Colosseum and yet in a wonderfully quiet location away from the noise of traffic. The food is superb, with plenty of choice at breakfast and very tasty evening meals, which are always four courses and include wine, water and coffee. We would gladly recommend this hotel to anyone and are so grateful to Anthony Coles for booking out tour party into the Hotel Lancelot. We will return!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel. Good location.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 nights at the Hotel Lancelot. The rooms were clean and nicely furnished, and the service was very good. The staff helped with everything from metro/bus instructions and internet help to getting us a ride to the airport at 4 am! The location (blocks from the Colosseum) was great, too. Overall, a nice place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel just steps from the Colloseum”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was the best hotel we stayed at in Italy. Wonderful staff, great location next to the Colloseum, the Palatino, and Roman Forum and easy access to other monuments. In fact, this is one of the nicest hotels I've ever stayed at and I often get to stay at 5 star hotels on business trips. Lancelot, is quiet, clean, and friendly, breakfast is included, etc. I would personally go back any time!

Reviews.Title: “Best Value in Rome!”
Reviews.Author: RWS1
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Lancelot in September during our first visit to Rome. We stayed in the suite on the 6th floor which has a wonderful terrace overlooking the Coliseum. The view was breathtaking!! It is very conveniently located; we walked to all of the sites - the Coliseum, Forum, Palatine Hills, and many great sites are within minutes. Many other sites (Trevi Fountain, Spanish Steps, etc.) are within a 10-30 minute walk. The hotel is very clean and the staff are great. They all speak fluent english and go out of their way to be helpful. The breakfasts are OK - fairly typical for a European hotel. We did not partake in the dinner at the hotel only because we were so busy seeing and experiencing Rome. It is located in a quiet neighborhood yet so close to everything. The neighborhood has some very good restaurants and some great sidewalk cafes to people watch! We also stayed at the Westin which is a magnificent hotel. However, if you want to get a flavor of Rome, I would definitely stay at the Lancelot. The suite here cost less than half of the price of the cheapest room at the Westin. We are already planning to return to Rome and will definitely book the suite at the Hotel Lancelot.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - friendly staff - great view of the Colosseum”
Reviews.Author: curlyloo
Reviews.Content: I'm reluctant to give this review because it was a hidden treasure in Rome. The hotel is on a quiet street, not far from the Colosseum. This is a treat especially if you've ever stayed on one of the more busy streets in Rome (where all the Vespas are). If you're lucky enough to book a room w/ a view, you'll wake up to gorgeous views of the Colosseum (and St. Peter's in the distance). All of the staff is wonderful. Mrs. Khan and her staff, especially Efren and Michael, are extremely gracious, helpful, and fun. There's a bar in the hotel that stays open late and offers the guests an opportunity to chat. By the end of my stay, I felt like I was among old friends. The rooms are a good size, especially in comparison to the typically small European hotel rooms. The bathroom has a tub, which is a nice treat after a long day of sightseeing. In order to help you travel lightly, the hotel offers laundry service that's fast and efficient. In your bathroom, there's a laundry bag with your room number on it. You just fill the bag with your laundry in the morning before you leave for a day of sightseeing, and by 3pm, the housekeeping staff has freshly laundered and pressed your clothes. The Hotel Lancelot is a wonderful place to stay in Rome. On my future trips, I know exactly where I will return.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night at the Hotel Lancelot on October 12, 2005 after our 12 Med cruise and found the hotel to be charming and an excellent value for the money. We had stayed in room 10 which had a nice balcony and ample space in the room itself. The hotel staff were helpful and pleasant. The location was great and off the main street and we could easily walk to all the major sites without any problems. Never had to use a taxi or public transportation. Would highly recommend this hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: ToodiQ
Reviews.Content: Just returned from three night stay. Nice quiet hotel, pleasant room with small balcony, tiny bathroom but spotlessly clean. Great location, easy stroll to Colosseum and metro. Unusually for Italy, the bar stayed open late so we could have a drink when we got back from a night out and chat with the other guests. Arrived into Ciampino at midnight to be met by car that the hotel had booked for us, which was fantastic, would thoroughly recommend this service especially if you're arriving late. Would definitely stay at the Lancelot next time we're in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice for a small hotle”
Reviews.Author: ijkh
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our stay at the Lancelot. It was warm friendly and clean enough for the pickiest traveler. The staff are just lovely. The elevator is small but works well. We loved our room. There is a terrace on the 6th floor where we had drinks overlooking the Colloseum. We ate one night at the hotel for 22 euros including wine. We thought the food just ok but the chance to meet people from all over the world was fabulous. The location was perfect for us and is in a nice neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Great Staff, Amazing Location”
Reviews.Author: faith515
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located really near the colessuem so the location cannot be faulted. It also has some really nice places to eat nearby. I was in a single room which was really clean and tidy with lots of storage space and a very comfy bed. Sometimes it was a bit noisy. But this was mainly the lack of consideration of the other hotel guests when on their way to bed, so not the hotels fault. Although the water tank of ther ajoining room to mine was sometimes a little too loud. The staff are lovely, and so willing to help! The breakfasts are also plentlyful (but I did find it odd that the milk was full fat. an odd comment I know but it was really hard to get used to and I could imagine that it would be for most people.) All in all, I would come back! A great find!

Reviews.Title: “Good value for Rome”
Reviews.Author: OliverTatom
Reviews.Content: Convenient to the Colisseum, il corso, and the train station, tucked away on a quiet side street, this hotel is a good bet for the price. The entire staff is fluent (not merely proficient, but fluent) in English and overwhelmingly polite. The rooms are small, but that is par for the course in Rome. For well under 200 Euros a night, it would be hard to do better than the Hotel Lancelot.

Reviews.Title: “Excelent location, clean, friendly staff, great breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Chiphennessy
Reviews.Content: The staff was very very very helpful at this hotel. They helped us "clueless" tourists understand the public transportation, sites, and restaurants. This hotel is so close to the coloseum that you can see it from some hotel rooms. It is also in close proximity to the busses and the metro, which isn't a convenient system. Suggestion: Ask where the 119 bus picks you up, it brings you to all the best sites in Rome. It's quick and so small that it even drives through alley ways! cool. The Rooms were decent, the family room is basically the same as a normal room with two cotts. The breakfast is excelent. There is a wide variety of foods, and it is very filling. If you are comming directly from the airport I would suggest you to take the train from the airport to Termini, and take the metro to the coloseum, from there you can walk to the hotel. Happy Trails!

Reviews.Title: “what a great place!”
Reviews.Author: vtowngirl
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a stay in Rome followed by 12 days on a cruise ship. The Hotel Lancelot is perfectly located to see the sights in Rome and the staff was wonderful: friendly, accomodating, helpful. They had suggestions for getting around, where to eat, etc. The breakfast was very nice - elegant surroundings and good food. It was much better than I expected and it was fun to meet people from all around. The rooms were small, but not cramped and the beds were very comfortable. The airconditioning was welcome after a long, hot day touring Rome. They were quiet and wonderfully restful. There were many small restaurants in the area as well. I would certainly recommend this hotel, and would stay there again myself.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and value”
Reviews.Author: ReluctantPeninsulan
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Lancelot was a fantastic find and a great value. The location is hard to beat, a few short blocks to the Colosseum. The rooms are clean and spacious, as well as quiet. The staff is super-friendly, and all speak excellent English, which is a big plus to English-speakers whose knowledge of Italian, like mine, is limited to a few key phrases from a phrase book. Breakfast is typically included with your room, and it's pretty good. Definitely sign up for dinner at least one night that you're there - it's very tasty, and it's a good chance to chat with some of the other guests. The next time I come to Rome, I plan to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “We'll stay again!”
Reviews.Author: Pmts
Reviews.Content: We've just completed 2 stays at the Hotel Lancelot. We stayed four nights prior to our Med cruise and retuned for two nights after the cruise. We we're delighted. Our room with a terrace on the 6th floor was small but functional with a very comfortable double bed, the bathroom was compact compared to American standards, but the fantastic terrace made us forget any perceived shortcomings. Our terrace had a large table surrounded by four chairs and two very comfortable loungers. Plants and herbs in large pots were placed around the terrace to give privacy, but did not take away from the view of the Coliseum or the rooftops of Rome - we could see all the way to St. Peter's. The staff lived up to all of what we had heard, friendly, and very, very helpful. Breakfasts were plentiful (the coffee superb) and the two dinners we had at the hotel were excellent. Mr Khan does a great job in his kitchen. We loved the evavator built for two (it's a good practice in patience) and the art deco decor throughout the Lancelot. When we return to Rome, the Hotel Lancelot will be our address.

Reviews.Title: “What a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: usalinda
Reviews.Content: My family of 5 adults just returned from a wonderful stay at the Lancelot Hotel in Rome. I am a travel agent and would recommend this hotel to most of my clients. Not only was it in a great location, it was clean and the staff very friendly. It is a family run operation and you can really tell that they are willing to go out of their way to be helpful. When we arrived from Florence it was very late at night and we had parked our car on a public lot. After checking in I mentioned this and the owner said that he would go with us and bring the car back so that we could leave it in their courtyard parking space. He drove the car back so that we would avoid any stress(traffic is unbelievable). I was supposed to take the car back the next morning to the Rome airport but was worried about the traffic so he said that he would either lead me on his moped and bring me back to the hotel or we could arrange to have the car picked up at the hotel for about $20.00 extra. Guess which option I picked. In going over the reviews about the hotel I saw one that mentioned that the bathrooms were dirty. I can't imagine what room they could have been in. All 3 rooms that my family occupied were very clean. This hotel is not the Ritz Carlton nor does it pretend to be. It is the type of hotel that I love to stay in. It has old world charm not sleek, sterile, modern why did we bother to leave home atmosphere. When returning to Rome my family has all agreed that we would certainly stay at the Lancelot Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Love the place”
Reviews.Author: bubblensqueek
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Lancelot in June together with our two sets of parents. Although the hotel was not my first choice, I was immediately impressed when the cab dropped us off in the quiet street Capo d'Africa in front of the hotel's courtyard. After our arrival we had a drink in the back courtyard and they even let us bring in take away pizza from a nearby pizzeria! The rooms are clean and quiet, my in laws were lucky enough to get a room with a terrace (which we gate crashed every evening, armed with bottles of wine which we bought at the local store) and I have to say it's worth the extra money! Staff are very helpful and will always do their best to recommend nice family run trattotias for dinner. The only thing is....don't be fooled by the 50 euros 'limousine' transfer the hotel offers to and from the airport: do your research on the net and you can find transfers from as little as 35 euros! (Ms Khan has obviously been in Italy long enough to learn the tricks of the Italian trade.) What you save will make up for the euros you will get overcharged for cab rides in the city....and believe me...it happens!!

Reviews.Title: “A very civilized hotel”
Reviews.Author: readyforvacation!
Reviews.Content: During our family's May 2005 trip to Italy, we stayed several nights at the Hotel Lancelot in Rome. And we highly recommend it. This hotel is in a little neighborhood just behind the Colesseum, so it's easy to walk to some sights or hop on public transportation, but it is also a bit off the beaten path. The decor was just lovely -- fresh flowers and exquisite antiques throughout the common areas. The rooms were clean, the beds comfortable, and the bathrooms modern. The food was excellent and the place is set up so that it is easy to meet other guests and share travel stories. But the thing that was most outstanding about Hotel Lancelot was the staff. We've never experienced such helpful hotel staff -- full of recommendations and tips to help make our Rome stay extraordinary.

Reviews.Title: “A Warm and Friendly Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and i stayed here for 5 nights in May. We found the hotel a great choice. The hotel is a a short stroll to the coliseum and forum and some local restaurants and bistros, yet quiet. Mrs Kahn and her staff made our stay in Rome a wonderful experience. Our room was large and clean. We would definitly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing better than the Lancelot”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I still cant get over the wonderful recetion my family and I were given at the Lancelot. From the warm reception to the guidance through the everyday needs we had, the staff were more than helpful. Without their suggestions,Rome would not have been as inviting nor as interesting. When we got back home we sheared our enthusiasme with our neighbours who intend to go to Rome this fall. To my surprise the Lancelot's rating had changed from 19th to 36th overnight....I dont understand why as no new reviews were posted... However for me it should be rated amongst the first ten and even why not number one!!

Reviews.Title: “Very well situated”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Mrs.Khan and her staff arranged to meet us the airport and made us feel very welcome straight away. The rooms were kept immaculate. Reception and bar staff always smiling and helpful. The hotel is ideally situated for everything. A 5 minute stroll to the Coliseum and the buses that take you around Roma. Roma is not a cheap city but this hotel is reasonably priced and the staff are a credit to this hotel. Thoroughly recommend this one.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from Home”
Reviews.Author: nancyandlucky
Reviews.Content: This feels like home in a big, exciting city. Lovely people offering anything you could imagine you might need. Try to book a terrace room, doubles your space for only a few Euros more. nancy j

Reviews.Title: “Lancelot is great”
Reviews.Author: TravelSmith
Reviews.Content: It is true, the Lancelot is excellent as so many have said (stayed there for three nights in April 2005) Only problem with such good reviews is that it may become so popular we can't book next time. Staff is wonderful and helpful, breakfast excellent, location great, even reasonably close to metro. Good, lively restaurants in the area also, lots of fun but hotel is quiet. Small elevator, but absolutely no problem if you are patient. We especially enjoyed joining breakfast with others of various ages to share stories about Italy and Rome. You can't go wrong here, but try to keep it to ourselves (Ha, it is in Rick Steves book). PS we heard many other tourists complaining about their hotels, and they tried to change to the Lancelot, but I am sure it was booked, so plan early.

Reviews.Title: “Great owner and staff. Clean and comfortable.”
Reviews.Author: PharmDoc
Reviews.Content: We just returned from 3 weeks in Europe. Hotel Lancelot topped the list of clean, quaint, pleasant hotels. Mrs. Kahn and her staff are outstanding--especially Paula. They were able to arrange a shuttle from the airport, a tour of the Vatican Museum/Sistine Chapel, had bus tickets, and served great meals. Breakfasts were more than your typical European breakfast and supper was fabulous. Breakfasts were included and suppers were reasonably priced. We enjoyed meeting people at the famous "round tables" from all over the world. My husband was excited he could even get his e-mail for a nominal charge. Although we were unable to get a balcony on a floor high enough to have a view over the town, we still had a cute balcony and the room was great. Kudos to Mrs. Kahn, her family, and staff!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Lancelot”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After spending a great deal of time considering where to stay during our most recent week in Rome, we chose the Lancelot for its location (near the Colosseum), its reasonable rates, and its many favorable reviews. We were delighted with our choice! We loved the neighborhood for its quiet residential quality yet with so many "must-see" attractions nearby. Our room was very airy and clean with pleasant furnishings, scatter oriental rugs, comfortable beds, and a well-designed efficient bathroom. We loved our view of the Colosseum, and the Vittorio Emanuele monument and St. Peter's dome in the distance. The small outdoor terrace on the sixth floor was charming. Breakfast and dinner at the Lancelot provided an opportunity to meet other hotel guests, something we found most interesting. Mrs. Khan and her staff were warm and helpful. We have previously stayed on the Via Veneto in large, very fancy hotels. We preferred the more personal, relaxed, homey atmosphere of the Lancelot. We would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Superb hotel,staff,food,and location”
Reviews.Author: Ant007
Reviews.Content: just returned from this wonderful hotel,(3 couples)Stayed for 4 nights and enjoyed the experience greatly.Firstly the staff and owners are so friendly,polite and happy to help with anything they can.We decided to eat in the restaurant for 3 evening meals, this worked out at about £10pp,3 courses followed by fruit and coffee and with unlimited water and red/white wine,the food was prepared by owners son Mr Khan and was delicious each night.We were celebrating our 24 wedding anniversary whilst there and Mr Khan asked if we would be staying at the hotel for our meal, he then offered to cook whatever we wanted as a treat, Lasagne for starters,Duck a l'orange, followed by Tiramasu,after the main meal the lights dimmed in the dining room and in walked Mr Khan with the tiramasu complete with candles and free champagne for all in the room...how cool is that !! The room's are very clean and we were lucky enough to have one with a view over the coloseum,my brothers next door room even hea a small balcony with table and 2 chairs ask room 52 if you want this one. The hotel is literally 5 min walk to coloseum at the bottom of the street.with a good number of bars and restaurants close by. We all would love to return to this hotel and recommend it to all.

Reviews.Title: “First rate for the price.”
Reviews.Author: Boink
Reviews.Content: Ah, what a nice place to find in Rome. 5 minutes to the Coliseum (10 to the Forum - then the other way it's about 10 minutes to San Giovanni in Laterano)... but it's very easy to catch key buses to anywhere. The hotel is on a peaceful street (with just a few good restaurants nearby). It reminds me of a by-gone time... a classy place with great service. Everyone spoke fluent English and were more than helpful with any arrangements we needed. They offered a dinner that was pretty good. We were on the 5th floor with a small terrace that allowed us to see the Coliseum. Nothing is cheap is Rome, but this is good value (I think we were in the 180 Euro/night range). We took a taxi from the train station to the hotel (which we were told might cost 15-20 Euros) and it only cost 8. We took their special, flat-rate limo to the airport (50 Euros) and that went very well too.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Lancelot, a jewel of Rome”
Reviews.Author: attilathecat
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Lancelot recently in their quad/family room. The room was lovely, our balcony had a view of the Coliseum which was grand. The hotel itself is very nice, tucked away from the main street of via del Corso, but close enough to walk to everything. We opted for the half-board rate and had dinner most nights at the hotel. Dinner was very good, consisting of 3 courses and followed by fruit and coffee. Wine was unlimited and they brought carafes of juice for our children without being asked. It was very nice to meet and chat with other travelers during dinner. The staff at the hotel is simply amazing! From the moment you arrive they make you feel welcome and do everything possible to accomodate you during your stay. I would not hesitate to stay there again or to recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Faultless Accommodation near Colosseum”
Reviews.Author: daimler67
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from a 5 night stay at this hotel and would find it difficult to fault. The staff were very polite and helpful (on the last day of our stay it rained continuously and the management went and purchased umbrellas for all the guests). Breakfast consisted of bread, cheeses, jams, fruit juices, yoghurts, hot drinks etc and all was very fresh and served in a lovely dining room. We never stayed for an evening meal but every evening the dining room was full which I think is a good indication of quality and certainly the menu always looked very tempting. Our bedroom was clean and fresh (maybe a little small but I have stayed in smaller) and there was always enough hot water for the shower and clean fluffy towels. The Colosseum is about a 5 minute walk away and many buses run from the bottom of the road with a Metro station being about 10 minutes walk away. A previous comment was that noise was a problem and whilst obviously I cannot comment on this persons stay I can say that we never had any disturbance and in actual fact found the hotel a peaceful respite from what is a very noisy city. Very very highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “A warm, gracious find”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Tucked into the charming neighborhood of the Celio between two of Rome's seven hills (the Esquiline and the Palatine) and within easy walking distance of the Colosseum, the Forum and San Giovanni in Laterano (the first home to the Popes and still the home church of the Bishop of Rome, i.e., the Pope when he is in Rome), the Lancelot is a small-scale, old fashioned hotel. It is a family business presided over by the lovely Mrs. Khan and it is a special place. The rooms are smaller sized, but charming and reasonable in a very expensive city; we went for the 6th floor suite with a private terrace and views of St. Peter's and the Colosseum, which was still a bargain comparatively speaking. Breakfast is European style and plentiful. Both breakfast and dinner (prepared by Mrs. Khan's son Ferris, in my opinion a "renaissance man," who is a multi-lingual chef among his many talents) are served in the dining room, where guests are encouraged to mix and talk at round tables. We met some fascinating people there, including a number of UN staff. The hotel staff could not be more helpful or considerate and was most accomodating at all times and also suggested some great itineraries. As a result of this gracious hospitality there are many repeat guests. I plan to be among them.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and Affordable Hotel near the Colosseum”
Reviews.Author: ioj27
Reviews.Content: This nice little hotel is about a five minute walk east from the Colosseum in a little neighborhood off the major route. The Roman Forum is just beyond the Colosseum. It is in a quiet area, but as all hotels go, there is quite a bit of activity rather early in the morning and the noise can be a distraction in the hotel rooms. If you're an early riser, this won't be too much of a problem, but if you intend on sleeping in, you probably won't have much luck with it! As an American living in Europe for 4 years, the one thing you have to realize first is that hotels are not the same as in the US. The rooms are smaller and the sound-proofing isn't normally as good. Once you get over this difference, you can easily enjoy the hotel rooms, especially since the only reason you'll be there is to sleep! We are a family of four (inc. kids aged 12 & 10) and stayed in a quadruple room, number 71, on April 3-7, 2005. It's on the first floor in an adjacent building, just outside the main building. While the beds (big double and two singles) and the bathroom were clean, there were quite a few dust bunnies that could have been dealt with, but the windows are always open (in the spring anyway) and the hardwood floors do often encourage the build-up! I do have to complain about the shower, as the floor got quite wet (the doors are really poorly designed) and the showerhead would not stay in place when you tried to raise it up higher. Good thing I'm only 5'9", as taller people will get rather annoyed at this. The air conditioning was barely adequate in this particular room with the warm weather we had (about 75) and I suspect that it will have real difficulty keeping up with the hot summers. As I said the rooms are smaller in Europe and this room was no exception. I don't mind, but we were a bit cramped. The beds were great though and we were all very tired from walking all day. Sheets were cleaned daily. Some people mention TVs in these reviews and I usually have to laugh because it's always the Americans who complain the most. This might surprise you, but nearly all Europeans don't speak english, so don't expect english language stations to be plentiful. Be happy you're on holiday in beautiful city and keep the TV off. If you do have to watch, the Lancelot had BBC News and CNN (I think), so you can get caught up with the news at least. Breakfast was good, but again, it is European standard. So, no eggs and bacon for those used to it. Simple breads, fruit, yogurt, Italian coffee, decent fruit juice and packaged cheeses and pate where the course for the day. I was expecting more meats and cheeses to be offered, but this was OK for us. I think this should be upgraded to include more for its guests. We did not have dinner here, but the word on the street is that it's very nice. It is a family style atmosphere and you will sit with strangers, but in our experience, these types of dinners can be very enjoyable. The staff are very friendly and their English is of a very good standard. They are helpful and will give you good advice. Overall, we paid 200 euros per night for our room, which compared to others I researched is very competitive for the location and standard of accomodation. I felt it was very good value for money. A couple of last pieces of advice: - Take the option for a taxi to the hotel from the airports, especially if you are a family. The luxury and convenience of this door-to-door service is well worth the price (60 euros one-way) and you'll get some tourist information from the driver (we did anyway). Removing the hassle is a good start to the trip and a nice relaxing way to finish it. - Use the buses! Get a map of the bus routes or memorize where the major piazza's are and find your way around. We bought bus tickets, which is recommended by the tour guides, but never validated them. The locals never validate them (if they even carry them) or at least, we never saw any locals do this. The only people I ever saw validate theirs were tourists like us. We never paid for our transport around town and saved us quite a bit of money! You might have to get over the nervousness of this, but trust me it's very easy to get around once you get your bearings! - I always felt very safe in Rome, but was very careful with my wallet. It does get very crowded in places, so be wary.

Reviews.Title: “Somewhat overrated”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in November of 2004. The hotel is in a decent location near the Coliseum. During our first night, we were given a room facing the interior courtyard. We experienced two problems. First, it was unseasonably warm and, since our room faced the courtyard, there was no breeze or circulation. It became uncomfortable in our room and we tried to turn on the air conditioning. It didn't work and when we called the front desk we were informed it had been shut off for the season. Second, we managed to drift off the sleep only to be woken a short time later by the sound of a young child from one of the neighboring apartments singing at the top of his lungs. Strangely enough, he was singing "Old MacDonald Had a Farm" in Italian. Incredibly, this went on for at least half an hour (although he did sing a few other songs). We tried shutting the window but it was simply too hot in the room for that. Shortly after this impromptu concert ended, and we had drifted back to sleep, we were woken again by the sounds of a couple having a heated argument on the ground floor of the courtyard. Having had more than enough of this, I leaned out the window and politely asked them to please lower their voices. I can't repeat the response I received. Needless to say, the argument continued at the same volume. We subsequently spoke with other guests who had interior rooms who agreed that the noise from the courtyard is a big problem. Breakfast the next morning was a pleasant surprise. A variety of fruits, cereals, pastries and other foods was available and was included in the cost of the room. Based on our experience of the night before, we requested a new room at the front of the hotel facing the street. The lady at the front desk said a room was available, but that, since it was larger than the room we had originally booked and had a street view, she would have to charge us $20 euros more. The new room was an improvement in terms of temperature, noise level and overall comfort, except that the bathroom was not completely clean.

Reviews.Title: “A home away from home!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I just got back from my first trip to Rome and stayed four nighs at the Hotel Lancelot. It is truly a home away from home. The staff is wonderful and go out of their way to make you feel at home. The hotel is on a very quiet street, but within walking distance to the sights in Rome. It has a built in bonus, their evening round table dinners allow you to meet other guests... giving you a chance to compare notes on sights and make new friends. The hotel came highly recommended to me by a family member who's stayed at the Lancelot for the past 10 years... they can now add me to their lists of loyal guests...

Reviews.Title: “A rare find -- for Rome or anywhere!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Lancelot cannot be beaten for a reasonably priced, comfortable, conveniently located, personally rewarding stay in an often impersonal city. It provided a home away from home for our family of 4 (2 adults, 2 teenagers) for 2 nights in mid-February 05. A well-deserved 5 stars. Why? Location: On a quiet, partially residential street a five minute walk from the Colesseum (we could glimpse it from our 4th floor balconey). Two blocks from the bus stop where you can catch a bus to Vatican City and many other tourist spots. Tickets available for purchase at the hotel's front desk. There's a small market just down the block that's great for buying snacks (or putting together a picnic lunch). The Room: If you're not looking for hotel chain lux, it's perfect.
