Our room (family room #45) was spacious (even by U.S. standards) with comfy beds and lounge chair, modern bath, spotlessly clean with the added bonus of a small balconey. The lounge: Comfy/homey place to relax. After a day of touring, while my kids played a game of chess, we compared notes with fellow guests from England, New Zealand, France, U.S. Meals: Breakfast is buffet style, continental rather than English, but abundant with cereal, fresh breads and fruit. Dinner is available nightly for a set price (discounted for longer stays). Prepared by the owner's son with fresh ingredients and care and served in the pleasantly appointed dining room. Guests seat themselves at large round tables (another great opportunity to chat with the eclectic group of people who have been lucky enough to find this hotel). Best for last: The owner, Mrs. Khan, and her sons as well as the rest of the hotel staff make you feel welcome (a novelty these days) and exemplify the best in service. During our short stay they suggested daily intineraries, provided maps and written directions, directed us to a church near the Pantheon that provided one of our best experiences ever (look up!), offered help with our rental car, arranged for a van to the airport, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, quiet, convenient”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed in September 2004 for 5nts, in a 4th floor double room with small balcony facing the front (€152/nt) and I'd recommend this hotel. The street is quiet for Rome (one way single lane), and in easy reach of the Colleseum, Forum and Metro. I'd ask for a balcony, some don't have one and though it's just big enough for a table and 2 chairs it's nice for a beer at the end of an evening. The staff are freindly, helpful and speak good English, hotel was clean. The room was a reasonable size and the bed was comfortable. The window is double glazed with roll down external shutters for extra noise/light proofing. The bathroom is small but adequate tho' the door is insubstantial. Breakfast is a reasonable buffet, but we didn't try the evening meal. Advance cancellation policy is good. There are restaurants, a supermarket and a pharmacy nearby. The shortest public transport way from FCO airport is to avoid the Leonardo Express to Termini. Instead get the normal train into Rome and change onto the Metro or Tram at Ostiense (cheaper too). Price was top end of our budget, no idea if it's good value as we've not stayed in other Rome hotels, but we don't regret it.

Reviews.Title: “splendid 5 star treatment”
Reviews.Author: marytravel
Reviews.Content: Just sorry that it took us so long to write this. We had a wonderful time there, the food is excellent, ferris was great, we enjoyed the Irish tour guide he gave us, we will come back. Location was spot on. Thanks to everyone there. Maria and James

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, Comfortable and an Incredible Hotel Staff”
Reviews.Author: autumn
Reviews.Content: I just came back from Rome where I spent 8 wonderful days. The hotel is conveniently located and within easy walking distance to most attractions. The staff are warm and helpful to all guests. Need directions, transportation, restaurant suggestions or anything else the staff can assist with a variety of suggestions. Out of the many conveniences, the hotel does offer metro/bus passes for sale. I found this service convenient and time saving. Several advantages to staying at this hotel are the clean & beautiful rooms, friendly & immediate service, breakfast included, great dinners, an opportunity to meet other travelers, and internet service. The hotel is inviting and comfortable for a single traveler (female or male) and to those with families. From all the guests that I met at the hotel, each guest was impressed with the services and many of the guests were either returnees or they had been referred by previous guests of the hotel. (this says a lot) On my next visit to Rome, I plan to stay at this hotel. (a home away from home) It was comforting to see that there are still hotels that really do care about servicing their guests and making sure that each guest feels comfortable and invited to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Lancelot was a good choice”
Reviews.Author: uzubuzu
Reviews.Content: Two couples stayed at the Lancelot for three nights in Oct 2004 at the end of a two week tour of Italy.We had adjoining rooms with adjoining terraces.To step out on the terrace and see the Colloseum at day is awe inspiring-to see it at night is dramatic.The Lancelot was perfectly located for all the walking we planned on doing and it was a very relaxing place to come back to at the end of our long days.The staff is very pleasant and helpful-they got us same day reservations at Villa Borghese(hint,you should reserve days in advance).It is a comfortable,homey place to stay that suited our needs well.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Lancelot”
Reviews.Author: marian
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Lancelot for four days in October, 2004. We had read very positive recommendations from other travelers. This is a good, basic tourist hotel in Rome. Our room (55) was very large with a small balcony, but while adequate, it was not very nicely appointed. The bath room was nicely appointed, even though it was tiny (it did have a tub/shower combo). The hotel is in a quiet neighborhood near the Coliseum which we found very convenient for our needs. We had read many positive comments about the communal dinners for which the Hotel Lancelot is (apparently) famous. We participated in this event one night during our stay, and we were not impressed. We found the quality of the food mediocre. There are better dining choices (and worse ones, too!) in the immediate neighborhood. The breakfast was good. This hotel probably is a good value for the money. Next time in Rome, I probably will opt to spend more for something a little nicer.

Reviews.Title: “Magnificant”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: It was wonderful. A friend and I stayed at the Lancelot Hotel Sept. 30 - Oct. 4, 2004. I know you can not please everyone, but our stay at the hotel certainly pleased us. So many good reviews have been posted that my comments would only echo the good already said. Not only did Mrs. Kahn help us prior to our trip but her care and concern for us during our trip was beyone the call of duty. Thanks to her and her wonderful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel - Makes you feel right at home”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here while we traveled throughout Europe for our honeymoon. We feel lucky that we were able to book this hotel because we got to see how all the great reviews that we read on Tripadvisor are true. The staff is super friendly and they are so patient with all the questions we asked. The breakfast is free and you sit with others in a dining room. We met so many wonderful people during breakfast talking about culture, literature, our own homeland, etc. The dinner is amazing there. The chef, Ferris, is very talented and very friendly and he even comes to the dining room to chat and eat with the hotel guests. The decor of the hotel is beautiful and it makes the guests feel so warm and welcome. We stayed at 5 hotels throughout our trip in Europe and no other hotel can bring together hotel guests like Hotel Lancelot. The hotel has multiple lounge areas for guests to hang out - and believe us - the lounges were always filled with guests chatting, laughing, sipping wine or tea. We had a couple of glasses of wine with other guests we met over breakfast and it was so much fun. We never mingle with other guests at other hotels but it was so fun to do so at this hotel. You've got to stay there to experience this for yourself. Hotel Lancelot made our trip to Rome so much more enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Lancelot”
Reviews.Author: Mindtraveler
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at the Hotel Lancelot at the end of September. It is just down the street from the Colleseium. It is a charming, family run small hotel. It is very clean and the room, although not large, was spacious enough for 2 people. They serve a very nice cold breakfast. We chose to eat dinners elsewhere as dinner is only served at one time and we were not always there to get it. There are many nice and inexpensive trattorias all around the neighborhood. We would certainly go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleased”
Reviews.Author: renabmw
Reviews.Content: Just like the reviews I had read prior to leaving. I'm so glad I came across tripadvisor. I checked out every hotel that was within my budget on hotels.com and they were all listed as terrible, smelley, too far out, but not this one. This is a quiet gem tucked away, 5 minutes walk from the Colosseum. Mrs Lubna Khan the owner was very friendly and so was her staff. It was very clean and we were lucky enough to get a room with a terrace, I've already told all my friends about it. If you're staying in Rome and you're on a budget, this is it, oh and the shower pressure is absolutely awesome, you get a massage at the same time.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Noisy Room”
Reviews.Author: mich_jason
Reviews.Content: Hotel Lancelot is in a great location, within 5 minutes walk to the Coliseum which has a subway station; however, the rooms are noisy...and I mean noisy from the hotel, not from the street. I found it a bit hard to sleep at night because of the noise from the other guests in the hotel (and they weren't being overloud either). Plus, we had heard so many good things about the dinners at the Hotel Lancelot and were really, really disappointed. In fact, the dinner was probably one of least enjoyable our entire trip. I might consider staying here again simply because of the location, but would definitely not eat dinner here again.

Reviews.Title: “The Lancelot was nice .....but........”
Reviews.Author: MIKEC
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Lancelot in July of 2003. It is a lovely, charming hotel located near the Colosseum. We were able walked from the Lancelot to many of the famous sights in Rome. BUT... they never did get the air conditioner to work properly we suffered for 3 days. Of course there was a heat wave that July. Also ,don't bring a van to the Lancelot. The parking lot is about the size of my family room, and getting into it is even more fun. Of course you don't want to drive period in Rome. Air and parking aside, I would stay there again because of the location and price.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Lancelot!”
Reviews.Author: OhioDiane
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a three night stay at Hotel Lancelot. I knew we were in for a treat when greeted by Mrs. Kahn upon arrival. She was warm and so friendly. My husband and I felt like family. Our room was located on the 6th floor. We had a beautiful terrace surronded with flowers and plants. We were able to sit out there and view the Colosseum. The room was very clean and had great A/C and even feather pillows. The breakfast was served in a very nice and clean dining room. Good coffee and basic essentials for a good start to your day. The dinners were an exceptional value as well as a culinary experience. We ate at the hotel our last night in Rome and it will be a night we will always remember. Dined outside in a candlelit garden with other guests from the hotel. It was truly wonderful! There was nothing that the staff at Lancelot would not do to accomodate their guests. The battery for our digital camera expired and we forgot our charger -- long story short Mrs. Kahn's son took our batteries and had them charged for us and left them in our mailbox the next morning. What a nice thing to do. Faris saved the day!! Thank you Mrs. Kahn and your entire staff at Lancelot for making our stay in Rome unforgettable. Hopefully we can return to your oasis in Rome someday soon.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Lancelot!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: August 30-Sept 3,2004 Everything said before is true! This is truly a remarkable place! I was very worried.(you read the horror stories) The people are so friendly, the rooms are very clean and while not the size of a suite, most comfortable. The breakfast (included) was excellent. The dinners(extra) were delicious! Mrs. Khan and her staff could not have been more friendly. It really is only two blocks from the Colosseum! A mere bus ride (15 minutes) from The Pantheon and other sites. We met many nice people, two, a father and son from England. This had been their seventh trip to Rome and The Lancelot! My travel agent wanted us to stay at a very expensive Hotel, when we arrived in Rome, we discovered that it was right across the street from the Lancelot! Many many kudo's!!

Reviews.Title: “Atmospheric and picturesque; great location”
Reviews.Author: cybergirl
Reviews.Content: I only withhold one star because our first room (we stayed there twice, coming into and leaving Italy) was inferior to our second room, which had a fabulous balcony and was quite large. Get that balcony and you'll be happy. The front desk is helpful and kind. Perhaps we were spoiled by our hotel in London but breakfast was only just okay -- pastries and cereals but nothing hot. Being that close to the Coliseum is great!

Reviews.Title: “Truly outstanding!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife, daughter, nephew, and I recently returned from a three week holiday in Europe. We spent three of those days in Rome, and there we were fortunate enough to be the guests of Mrs. Kahn and her excellent staff at the Lancelot. Our experiences there could not have been better. The facility itself is delightful- conveniently located near the ruins of the ancient city, beautifully appointed, and spotlessly maintained. Breakfast and dinner, served in the justly famous "round table" format, were simply outstanding, with an especially sumptuous selection for breakfast. The most outstanding feature of the hotel, however, is the warm family atmosphere that Mrs. Kahn and her staff work hard to create. We met several people there who were return visitors who cited this as their primary reason for coming back. I witnessed and experienced several instances of these good people going above and beyond expectations to insure that their guests' stay in Rome was memorable and rewarding. The Lancelot is terrific in just about every way a hotel can be terrific. I recommend it enthusiastically and without reservation.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Lancelot
HotelInfo.Address: Via Capo d'Africa 47, 00184 Rome, Italy
